deck_excerpt: An Alternative Mysterune build that address issues with Magical Musket Mysterunes
deck_description: This deck is built around trying to resolve Spring of the Mysterune as often as possible  while not dying. While decking out is technically how you end games, games are decided by how often and how much cards you can draw with Spring of the Mysterune. One popular variants of Mysterune is Magical Musket. From my playtest, I found them to be rather bricky, and draws with Muskets means no fuel for Spring of Mysterune. Additonally, lack of draws in Magical Musket means finding Mysterune spells to restart Spring of the Mysterune difficult. Live Twins, on the other hands, need far less garnets in deck to function, and the card draws from Ki-Sikil provide valuable chances to kickstart Spring of the Mysterune. In trading off the S/T negate from Magical Musket, Live Twin also provide non-targeting and non destruction removal, which out monsters that would otherwise need to be destroyed in battle, which the deck cannot do.   Spring of the Mysterune The heart and soul of the deck. search it out with Point of the Mysterune, or Huginn, Wings of Mysterune and make sure it always triggers. Drawing 1 is crazy good, drawing 2 is horrid.   Point of the Mysterune ROTA of the deck. Use it to fill up the grave with extra spells, or use it after Spring of the Mysterune to round out your hands.   Mysterune of Freezing Curse/ Mysterune of the Brilliant Flame/ Mysterune of Destruction All Mysterune cards are OPT, so use these turn 1 to summon the fusion, since they are generally dead. But these are the cards you should hold on if possible for disruptions, but feel free to burn them during opponent's end phase to cycle cards and mill their decks.   Mysterune of Slumber You run 3 because this card is ALWAYS playable, so Spring of Mysterune can trigger.   Mysterune of Disruption / Mysterune of the Golden Droplets / Mysterune of the Raging Storm Additional names to summon Extra Deck monsters, Golden Droplets -> Disruption mills 7 cards from the deck. Raging storm can hit pretty high numbers too, but its value mostly derive from being a easy trigger for Spring of Mysterune, and being a finisher to mill the remaining 2-3 cards from the deck.   Live Twin Lil-la/ Live Twin Ki-sikil / Live Twin Ki-sikil Frost With Secret Password and Sunny's Snitch, there are 6 starters to find Trouble Sunny. Ki-Sikil Frost is not only a ext or ender, but the extra card draw she can provide goes a long way in accelerating your game plan. With Gigantic Splight, negating any Live Twin doesn't stop the play completely, as you can choose whether to get a draw or a pop next turn. Do keep in mind those lines of plays will open you up to Feather Duster or Lightning Storm, with Trouble Sunny, you can activate Trouble Sunny and summon Huginn, Wings of the Mysterune to protect your field spell instead.   Secret Password / Sunny Snitch Because of the heavy card draws in the deck, and the importance of keeping Spring of Mysterune engine running, running more copies of the Live Twin and their searchers can brick draws from Spring of the Mysterune.   Ki-sikil & Lil-la / Forbidden Droplet Cards that can out annoying cards that cannot be targeted or destroyed.   Metalfoes Fusion Good discard target for Huginn, pop it with Lil-La to get a draw. Generally a good card that soften the impacts of disruptions.   Called By the Grave / Ash Blossom / Ghost Belle/ Upstart Goblin / Talents Free slots in the deck. Talents is a second copy of Called By The Grave.   Deceit of the Mysterune It is a dead card going first and second. You only search this if you already have a field spell, or want to end the game quicker. In both of those cases, we are already winning, winning harder is whatever. However, drawing this when you are low on cards or going second is terrible.

deck_excerpt: Mill your cards, Banish your cards, Recycle your cards, and do it all over again
deck_description: I have a lot of fun using this archetype, and this is my take on the deck.  Virtual World is a very recursive deck, able to gain advantage by sending cards to the Graveyard, Banishing cards from the Graveyard, and is even able to recycle Banished cards. Chuche is an amazing card that helps the deck immensely, it is one of the only good removal cards that functions under both IO(Imperial Order) and Skill Drain, and is your main source of bringing back your Banished cards, alongside Shenshen. All of the Virtual World Gate Spells and Traps have good Graveyard effects which allow them to special summon(Xuanwu), add a Virtual World monster to hand(Qinglong), or change the Level/Rank of a Virtual World monster you control(Chuche).
Time Thieves

deck_excerpt: Want a Deck the can Toolbox Basically any Dragon?
deck_description: Dragon Link is an exceptional deck that can potentially go through its full combo without using its Normal Summon.  A lot of the deck locks you into Dark monsters from the Extra Deck, so I would recommend making Romulus quickly, as Dragon Ravine is a great card for any Dragon-based deck since it was first printed, or if you need to make a Halqifibrax combo to get started you should to it early in your turn.  Borrelend Dragon is a very strong card that just got printed in the TCG, as it cannot be destroyed by battle or card effect, nor can it be targeted, meaning that the only outs to it are a Kaiju monster or a non-targeting absorption effect, such as Underworld Goddess of the Closed Word, and by negating an Effect Monster, permanently, can simultaneously Special Summon a Rokket from the Graveyard.  Chaos Ruler is a very important card for this deck, and is fortunately a Dragon, as loading up the Graveyard is nothing but an advantage for this deck.  Overall, the deck is very strong, very consistent, and shows that it deserves to be considered a meta deck in this format.

deck_name: SUSHIP BEST DECK!!! N/R Format version
deck_excerpt: A XYZ Deck made for Master Duel's N/R Format. It has Various cards to make XYZ summon of Rank 4 monsters. But the best it's Suships. Why? 'Cause SUSH
deck_description: So you stumbled in this decklist? Well as the title says it was built for N/R Format that's why some good stuff was left out (Time Thief Redoer, Zeus, Utopia); this idea was created mainly 'cause I'm a Yataloked fan and I liked the Idea behind the Suship archetype being a XYZ SPAM deck, well when I was copying a Suship Deck for Ranked in Master Duel I noticed that the whole Suship Archetype it's R and N rarity (Well atleast the cards we have in Master Duel), so I decided to theorycraft making the deck. Sadly using the maximun amount of copies of the Main deck cards it only makes 30% of the main deck (12 cards) so to complete the deck I needed more engines to support the Suships. So turned to another archetype I like Time Thiefs being a good Engine to spam Rank 4 XYZ Monsters so they are good with Suships, I put 3 copies of the playable cards, but if you wish you can remove the Spell card is just for a little bit of swarming but if you don't have a Time Thief in hand it's a Brick (Like a hand full of Monarchs), I didn't put the traps because they're unplayable 'cause they all work in the Time Thief XYZ Monsters which all are SR and UR rarity so I can't use them for this format so althought you can use them they will be just bricks. With that we have 37.5% of main deck taken by Time Thiefs (15 cards), but we have another 13 cards left to fill the deck (32.5%). In N/R Format Handtraps are practically nonexisting, well at least good ones. So we have the following ones: Sphere Kuriboh, Battlin' Boxer Veil, Speedroid Menko, Battle Fader, Ghostrick Jack Frost, and Construction Train Signal Red, so the Deck it's a Rank 4 XYZ Spam Deck so Sphere Kuriboh isn't very good amking the attacking monster go to defense position (Which links are inmune to) and only useful in Ritual decks by being a Ritual Raven on steroids, Battle Fader has the better effect of the five but it's a level 1 so unless you want to use it for Link plays isn't very useful, oh and Ghostrick Jack Frost it's like Sphere Kuriboh which makes a enemy monster go to defense position and like Battle Fader he special summons himself so well isn't very useful in this deck, so we have left Battlin' Boxer Veil and Speedroid Menko which both are Level 4 that special summon themselves, Veil when you're receive damage which makes you recover it and Menko that will trigger when you're attacked directly and makes all your opponents monsters go to defense position (Except Link monsters 'cause they can't). I put 2 of Veil and Menko, and if you ask why not 3? Mainly 'cause in the last N/R Format Banlist they semi-limited both cards, well I think they semi-limited all of the Battle Handtraps available except Sphere Kuriboh 'cause it's so bad nobody used it.  So with Veil and Menko in the Deck (being 10% of the Deck) we have 9 spaces left for more cards. Looking for ideas I stumbled in the N/R Channel where they post possible engines, I found 2 engines for XYZ Decks and with that I could fill the deck. First engine it's Astraltopia and Numbers protection, Astraltopia it's a level 4 monster that can be special summoned from your hand when you have a XYZ monster in the field and when it's on the field you can send to the grave 1 card in your hand and add to your hand a Spell/Trap which says Zexal, ZW, Onomat, and/or Number in it's description, the other card it's Numbers protection which it's a Solemn Judgment but you don't pay LP but to activate it you need to have a XYZ Number Monster in the field to activate. I put 3 Astraltopia and 2 Numbers Protection. The other engine it's my old friends Sharks most of the engine it's low rarity you could play it (Expect a future Shark Deck for N/R Format) ok so I put two cards Right hand Shark and Left hand Shark. Right hand when it's Normal summoned you can add 1 Left hand Shark to the hand, and if you have Right hand Shark in the GY and you can Special summon it to the field for free if you don't have monsters in the field but it will get banish when it leaves the field (This lingering effect can be unable by using it for XYZ summon as material) it has another effect but it will never trigger in this deck, and now Left hand Shark this card can be Special summoned when you have Right hand on the field but it will get banished when it leaves the field and the other effect it's this card will become a Level 4 if it's Special summoned form the GY. So yeah this combo it's a Link 2 at best 'cause Left hand it's a Level 3. We have 2 Right hands and 1 Left hand. If you're doing math correctly you'll notice there's a free space 'cause right now we have 39 cards. Well I put a copy of Shard of Greed just in case it comes useful later. So there's the 40 Card List. And now the Extradeck we have to put the XYZ Suship named Gunkan Suship Ikura-class Dreadnought 'cause we are playing Suships it gets two different effects if it's summoned using the Main deck Suship monsters. If you use Shari (The Normal one) you draw 1 card, and if you use Ikura (The effect one) the XYZ can Attack 2 times this battle phase, which it's relevant to this XYZ 'cause when a Suship Extra Deck monster deals damage you can destroy one monster in your opponents field. We put 2 copies of this card, we could put 3, but for Space we put 2 mainly 'cause it's better when it's summoned by the Suship cards which we only have 6 in a 40 card deck. Due to the lack of good Rank 4 XYZ monster we could use the King of all of them Number 70: Malevolent Sin, well the king in N/R Format I know Time Thief Redoer exists, well why do I call him the king? 'Cause he's a really good monster to go into, there 3 options you could use in N/R Format, one it's Digital Bug Corebage which return to the deck one monster in you opponent's field which it's in defense position you could inmediatly go into this card when you summon Malevolent Sin, and sadly after you attacked with Malevolent you can't go into Corebage, the other two can only be used after Malevolent Sin has made it's second attack and they're Number 84 Paingainer and Number 77 Seven Sins. Paingainer has 0 ATK and DEF but it's gains DEF equal to the amount of Ranks of XYZ monsters in your field (It counts itself) X 200, so when you summon it, it has 2200 DEF, and when your opponent activates activates a Spell/Trap it inflicts 600 LP of Damage, once per turn you can detach 1 material and destroy all of your opponent's monsters with ATK lower/equal the amount of Defense that Pain Gainer has. Seven Sins it's a 4000 ATK and 3000 ATK Rank 12 XYZ monster, which's effect it's once per turn you can detach 2 materials and banish all of you opponents monsters that were special summoned, then you can atach to this card one of the monsters banished by this effect. And when this card would be destroyed by battle or card effect you can detach 1 material instead. So we put 3 copies of Malevolent sin and 1 of each of the monster I talked earlier (Corebage, Seven Sins and Pain Gainer), oh and if you ask how on earth i'm planning to put and enemy monster in defense position if we don't have any way to do that in the Main Deck, don't worry 'cause we have a solution for that, it's named Evilswarn Nightmare, it's a Rank 4 XYZ monster which requires 2 Level 4 Dark monsters which all our Time Thiefs are. He's effect it's when your opponent summons monster(s) you can detach one material and make them all go face down, which will make possible to special summon Corebage next turn and return one card to the deck, believe me it's a good combo well at least in this format. And 'cause we only use 1 copy of Corebage we only need to put 1 copy of Nightmare. So that's 9 cards we have 6 spaces left. 'Cause most of our cards are level 4 machines we can summon Heavy Armor Train Ironwolf which requires 2 level 4 machine monsters. He can detach 1 material and make 1 machine monster attack directly this turn (Which Ironwolf is) but he it's the only monster that could attack this turn, and when he's destroyed by your opponent you can add to your hand 1 level 4 Machine monster (Menko, Regulator, Bezel Ship, or Chronocorder. But to be honest if your field it's going to get wipe the best options are Regulator to make a comeback by making a XYZ Rank 4 monster or Menko for surviving another turn). Next, we have Number 57 Tri-head dust dragon, at first it seems like a bad card mainly 'cause to summon it you need 3 Level 4 cards which is rare in this deck but it could happen, so what this card does it's when it's summoned you can increase it's attack to the current attack of a opponent's monster on the field and by having 100 ATK it can get past the strongest card your opponent controls, it's other effect is detach 1 material and select an S/T zone in your opponent's zone which doesn't have a card in it, and while this card it's on the field face-up this zone can't be used, it's not the best effect but it can stop in it's tracks Pendulum and Giant Ballpark Decks. And now our last XYZ monster Number 50 Blackship of Corn, it's a Rank 4 XYZ monster which needs 2 level 4 monsters, it's effect it's to send to the GY 1 monster in your opponent's field which has ATK equal/less than Blackship (2100 ATK) and deals 1000 LP to your opponent, but this turn Blackship can't attack. And now our Link monsters and if you ask why are we using Link monsters in a XYZ deck it's mainly due to a certain card being avaliable in the format, don't sorry I'll say which card it is. The link monsters are Geonator Transverser, Codebreaker Virus Swordsman, and Doublebyte Dragon. Geonator it's used due to her effect to exchange two monsters in the field to the zones this card points to, so basically a Creature swap, it's due to this card you shouldn't put your most precious monsters in the left corner of the field or in the center. Virus it's used 'cause of his possibility to revive itself and being a Link 2 monster with 2300 ATK being the Link 2 with the biggest ATK stat in the game. And Doublebyte which can only be summoned by using 2 Link monsters, it gains 300 ATK for each level of Ranking that the cards used to summon it in this case if you summon it in this deck he will have 2700 ATK which yeah isn't much BUT he compensates by having a great effect which makes it inmune to monster effects and battle unless the effects or battle are from another Link monster. So yeah this little package it's a case of using fire to deal with fire. Before I leave I want to suggest some options if you feel some cards aren't good to keep. In the Main deck deparment you can use cards like Photon Thrasher or Kagetokage which are special summons from the hand, XYZ Reborn to make a monster reborn of a XYZ monster in your graveyard, ZS Armed Sage ZS Ascended Sage which can be useful for more Level 4 monsters to make more XYZ monsters. You could replace the Time thief engine for Raidraptors or sharks that can be great engines for XYZ Rank 4 Decks, but Sharks are mainly used in pure water decks and Raidraptor can be good but most of them have to end in a Raidraptor XYZ and the available cards in the N/R Format don't make the deck justice. Some Dangers and Darkworlds could help the deck but it's a bit risky,. In the Extra Deck department you could use Firewall eXceed Dragon (Specially if you plan to use more Link monsters),  Super Quantal Mech Beast Aeroboros for a Book of moon (Sadly the Quick effect it's only active if it has a Super Quantal card attached), Number 80: Rhapsody in Berserk and Number 58: Burner Visor, to equip them to other XYZ monsters Berserk gives 1200 ATK and can use it's materials before equiping himself to another XYZ monster to banish 1 card of your opponent's GY (This effect it's not once per turn), and Visor gives the monster the possibility to do Direct attacks, Number 85: Crazy Box if you want to spice the game a bit and in the hypothetical case your opponent doesn't read Crazy box and Negates it's effect it's actually very good 'cause it turns this card into a 3000 ATK Beatstick, Gem-Knight Pearl just to have a 2600 ATK beatstick, Number 52: Diamond Crab King to have a 3000 ATK Beatstick of two uses and later a 3000 DEF wall if it manages to survive, Evilswarm Thanatos if you want a little towers monster, Gagaga Samurai to have a 1900 ATK monster that can attack two times. And for the Links well you have an abundance of monsters you could use. Well I hope you like this deck. Maybe in the future I can edit this Deck and put in the Description a video in which I showcase this deck.

deck_excerpt: The Only Good Archetype that Uses Fusion Monsters
deck_description: Invoked Dogmatika Shaddoll(often called IDS for short) is a Fusion toolbox that centers around Aleister the Invoker and his assorted Elemental Fusion monsters.  Previously, the deck did not have a lot of access to good Light Type monsters, until the Dogmatika archetype arrived. The Dogmatika monsters are a group of Light Spellcaster monsters that have abilities based on countering monsters summoned from the Extra Deck. Unfortunately, a lot of their cards lock you out of using the Extra Deck for a turn or two, so you have to be careful when you use them.  This deck is able to very easily run the engine for Destiny HERO-Destroyer Phoenix Enforcer(known as DPE for short), as it is an extremely powerful fusion monster, that gives any deck with the necessary space access to a strong monster that has a non-targeting destruction effect and can recur itself from the Graveyard each Standby Phase if it was destroyed, in addition to debuffing your opponents monsters.

deck_excerpt: Do YOU Want to be The King?
deck_description: Resonators are an archetype centered around Jack Atlas' Ace Monster, Red Dragon Archfiend, and is all about Synchro Summoning high Level Dark Dragon monsters. Unfortunately, most of the cards are very xenophobic, locking you out of your Extra Deck except for Dark Dragon Synchro monsters specifically, which leaves very few out of archetype options.  The Boss Monster of the Deck is Red Supernova Dragon, which isn't too hard to bring out in this archetype, and has an immensely powerful effect to banish itself and ALL cards your opponent controls when your opponent attacks or activates a monster effect, and returns to the field during your next End Phase. Though it can't be destroyed by card effects, it is vulnerable to negation, such as Forbidden Droplet or Infinite Impermanence, or Tributing/Sending, such as Kaiju or Shaddoll Schism.  Sadly, the archetype isn't very good, as it is extremely weak to Handtraps, and has been powercrept in recent times, as other decks have a higher ceiling and a stronger board presence than Resonators can make, leaving it in the dust of Yusei Fudo and his Synchrons
https://youtu.be/20TSL1ZmaBU

Synchrons are an archetype used by Yusei Fudo, the protagonist of 5D's, and is centered around Synchro Summoning. However, unlike Resonators, Synchrons are not very xenophobic, locking you into Synchro monsters from the Extra Deck, which isn't much of a restriction.  The center piece of the deck, and the primary Normal Summon, is Junk Synchron. Use this card for a free Junk Speeder, the ultimate target for an Ash Blossom and must be protected because of this, to gain immense advantage, summoning up to 5 different Synchron Tuner monsters(this deck only has 4 potential targets, but if Speeder is put in the Extra Monster Zone and you still have 5 targets able to be summoned in the Main Deck, you can summon all 5). After summoning Junk Speeder, your next priority is to make T.G. Hyper Librarian, as due to it not being once per turn, you can draw upwards of 5 cards during your 1st turn, to gain even more advantage.  This deck can also play the Majestic Stardust cards, but those make the deck worse in my opinion, though is does strengthen the end board potential.

deck_excerpt: Kaiju engine based Plunder Patroll deck for locals using Kaijus and Hand Traps to generate elements to summon Plunder Patroll Extra Deck monsters on t
deck_description: This deck is a bit of a work in progress - my roommate is getting into Yu-Gi-Oh and we're working to find him a budget (sub-100 dollar) deck for him to take to locals.  The deck uses a Kaiju engine to generate elements on your opponent's side of the field and in your graveyard to special summon your extra deck monsters from Plunder Patroll. Effect Veiler and Skull Meister were chosen as the hand traps of choice due to their price and elements, as well as their ease of use so you can dump elements into your graveyard for Emblem of the Plunder Patroll to use for summoning monsters.  Ideally, if more money gets put into this deck, it would really appreciate a side deck and options such as Nibiru, Artifact Lancea, and Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring to generate more hand-traps and give more options for Emblem of the Plunder Patroll.
This is a Lunalight Tri-Brigade deck. If you feel like there are any ways to improve this deck, please let me know in a comment

deck_excerpt: Cyberse 2022 With Firewall Dragon Neo Tempest Terahertz
deck_description: Use the Dragon Neo Tempest Terahertz Firewall Effect to send cards with effects that can be active in the graveyard for example flip frozen or code radiators
https://youtu.be/5oloNAImMtw

The strategy of this deck is basically to control the opponent's field, both going first with the xyz (redoer, dweller and evilswarm). Or trying to "hold" going second with the hand traps, or if everything goes wrong with the droplet to "break" the field.  Undoubtedly the best starter on the deck is the regulator, as it offers you the best combo. If Tribute, bring two team thiefs from the main deck (usually the winder and adjuster), what you add with the winder depends a lot on the situation. Going, because if you don't have any move extender in hand, you can bring the chronocorder, because with the bunjinki effect you can make the redoer using it material. With the adjuster most of the time you will send the bezel ship to the cemetery. With this move you can end the turn with two xyz on the field, because with the effect of the bezel you can Special Summon it from the Graveyard by discarding a material and with that you can activate the effect of the redoer when banishing, detaching a monster from the effect. of the chrnoocorder is activated in the graveyard and it also enters by special summon. I recommend that it be with the redoer and it perpetuates it in the first game.  I put allure as a purchase option, because all time thief monsters are darkness, I also put Danger! As another option both to banish with allure, and the move extender itself. The skull meister is a good hand trap option because it is level 4 darkness (often it will be the ban target) it can also be used as material for the xyz. To protect the regulator I put the gamma, because you don't want to take an ash on it. XD In the extradeck I put some different level 4 options, you can change some things if you have any other preference.  I've used infinitrack on a few occasions, it's a really nice addition to the deck. If you have any questions, you can leave them in the comments.  Have fun with this good deck!

deck_excerpt: Special Summon monsters from the Deck, GY, and that Banish to gain advantage over your opponent.
deck_description: Both the "Adamancipator" and "Fossil" arctypes are more Support oriented, so they are very flexible in their play styles. By using the "Adamancipator" cards to get free Special Summons of any Rock Monsters to the board. Then, use them to Special Summon into any Synchro Monster you are going to need, or into any Xyz/Link Monster. "Fossil" is a generic Rock Support that can be splashed into almost any Deck; using card like 'Fossil Fusion' to use as GY hate while at the same time giving you access to different Fusions Monsters.

Creating this deck took some time to finalize without having you locked out of using other card effects. With that in mind, the Main Deck "Chronomaly" cards that were playable (from many hours of play testing): 'Chronomaly Maoi, Chronomaly Maoi Carrier, Chronomaly Tuspa Rocket, and Chronomaly Esperanza Glyph'. 'Chronomaly Moai Carrier' has a watered down Cyber Dragon effect to Special Summon its self, while 'Chronomaly Maoi' can Summon its self when you control a "Chronomaly" monster. 'Chronomaly Tuspa Rocket' may not have a way to Special Summon its self or other "Chronomaly" cards; but, it does has a built-in 'Exrta-Foolish Burial' and 'Foolish Burial' on Normal or Special Summon, that can reduce the ATK of 1 targeted monster on the field. Finally 'Chronomaly Esperanza Glyph' may not be a monster, but it can take "Chronomaly" monsters from your hand, deck /or GY to Xyz Summon any "Chronomaly" monster with the corresponding Levels. The best part is that all 3 of the Main Deck "Chronomaly" monsters are EARTH Rock Monsters so any Supporting Rock arctypes, like "Adamancipator" and "Fossil", can be used to re-cycle any of the Main Deck monsters.
Not meant as a competitive deck

deck_excerpt: Uses Soul-Absorbing Bone Tower to delete your opponent's deck on turn 1. Don't copy if you like having friends.
deck_description: My take on a Mayakashi Bone Tower Deck. Meant for FTKs in Master Duel. Most of the spell cards are here to make the deck more consistent by cycling cards. Card and Hand Destruction are used to make the mill easier to perform. Bone Tower can be brought out with the effect of Mezuki (and both can be sent to the graveyard using Yuki-Musume, Foolish Burial, Card/Hand Destruction, Gozuki, and Reasoning) while the Mayakashi setup can be brought out by searching for Hajun with Mayakashi Return or One for One. This deck didn't get me 7 straight wins by doing nothing!

deck_excerpt: Qliphort 2022 deck budget master duel, tcg
deck_description: *If you are playing in physical tcg you may wish to replace Ash Blossom, Skill Drain for more affordable options like Effect Veiler and Lose 1 Turn* A Qliphort deck is a great budget deck both in physical tcg and in Master Duel. This deck focuses around pendulum summoning to play high attack monsters and summon the signature card, Apoqliphort Towers, which has great utility and wonderful defense with its immunity to most monster effects, spells and traps. Pendulum abilities offer effective searching tools and a attack buff to your monsters. The other main strategy of this deck is utilizing cards that negate monster effects. Most Qliphort monsters allow you to summon them without tribute summoning but with a lowered attack rating (usually to ~1800 atk). With the use of monster effect negation, this loss is reversed and you can easily summon monsters with 2000+ attack for free, especially with pendulum summoning. This will also negate the effect that states Qliphort monsters can only be used to special summon other Qliphort monsters if you plan to utilize an extra deck.

deck_excerpt: Melffys mix with Ronin Racoon to bring out a funny off meta fun deck. Though if you're in a pinch, Shuraig will be there to bail you out.
deck_description: Melffy cards a little ways away from displaying their true full decklist glory in Master Duel, but they'll still give you a run for your money. Bring along a menagerie of other funny fluffy and feathery friends to make a pretty funny deck. This isn't the end all be all to Melffy decks, and certainly not my only Melffy deck, but I wanted to put it out there. An opening turn with 'Melffy of the Forest' with any mix of regular Melffys on the field is always a good start for this deck turn 1. Turn 2 starting, if they come out with a monster big on attack points, I like to introduce them to Sandayu (Ronin Racoon). If you have 'Missus Radiant' on the field or 'Solidarity' in play, most of the time you'll take their biggest monster and pop out a token with equal to their attack points and then some. It's a fun deck to run with a lot of flexibility. Stall if you want to, summon the cards you want to, or shut down a card with the classic 'Melffy Puppy' into summoning Kalantosa. Pop! Unless they have something that protects their card, it's usually the end of the line for a lot of starting combos. Negate spell or monster effects with the Naturias if you know they'll be a problem. Have a free beast monster with Hasty Horse as long as there's no cards in the column. Pull out 3 fluffy friends on turn 1 with 'Obedience Schooled', and mix and match those into any number of Melffys or Racoons of your choice (You can use Sandayu more than once per turn; turn their 3000 attack monster into a 3800 attack token, then do it again for a 4600 attack token!) If you need a card off the field, Alpha MoB can help you out with that, or he can be a potential fodder into Shuraig if you need him. (I will warn you though, read your card effects, you can't summon Shuraig the same turn you use 'Obedience Schooled') You can easily mess with opponents on their turn. Pop their monster with the bread and butter. Or just stop them from attacking one of your Melffy's by bringing them to your hand. 'Melffy Fenny' into summoning Alpha is also always funny to do. After they summon a monster, use 'Melffy Catty' to add Hop Ear to your hand if you can't handle a monster or card effect. As long as it's their main phase, you can syncro summon right into 'Herald of the Arc Light'. Though, once the new Melffys get here, I may end up giving a thank-you to 'Hop Ear Squadron' and switching it out for the seal. Or when in doubt, 'Ayers Rock Sunrise' and 'Melffy Tag' will bring you enough monsters back from the graveyard to Xyz summon to your heart's content. There's a lot more I could say about the Deck, like the flexibility of Alpha MoB with itself or returning a Melffy to the hand to proc the effect of 'Melffy of the Forest', or how well Melffys and Sandayu use the playhouse trap card. But I think it's best to let the gameplay speak for itself. Mix and match more beast monsters if you'd like or even add other card archetypes to it. As long as there are Melffys there, any deck sure to keep your opponents guessing. I'm Mezamizu, this is my Melffy, and thanks for reading!

deck_excerpt: this is the moment raiden commited genocide and several warcrimes in feudal japan during the directors cut of metal gear rising
deck_description: Write your deck strategy here....

So, I added in the Branded engine instead of DPE, I've found out that it works out really well to get Mirrorjade and Balerdroch out on the field turn 1. Branded combo: (keep in mind that if you activate Glow Up Bloom's effect, that you get locked into Zombies) Activate Branded Fusion-->Send Fallen of Albaz and Glow-up to make Lubellion (even if it gets negated, it discards for cost) -Otherwise, if you don't really need glow-up bloom, you can always send Mezuki/Gozuki or Banshee as a contingency plan (especially if you suspect they have a way of getting rid of your Zombie World). Activate Glowup's effect in grave FIRST! then Lubellion (free discard btw ;) ) -- doing so will bypass the zombie requirement, allowing you to fusion summon Mirrorjade after you get Balerdroch. Verte Anaconda is also a good way to get Branded fusion, but make sure to fusion summon Mirrorjade using Verte and Albaz because you get only one more special summon for the turn (DON'T SEND GLOW UP--YOU WILL ONLY BE ABLE TO ADD BALERDROCH TO HAND!)   I also added in Jackalope and Tsuchinoko for added consistency so I can discard Glowup/Banshee/Mezuki etc. if I brick. Otherwise, you might be able to get into Halq if you get to special summon. Here's what I banish for Prosperity: 1x Dragonecro, 1x Mirrorjade, both Phoenix link monsters, 1x Avendread, 1x Vampire Sucker. I usually am able to find branded fusion off of this when I don't draw into it.   Your normal summon is gonna be Uni-zombie 70% of the time, but don't cry if it gets negated (which it WILL), really in a bo3 you can side in cards if you are struggling to make a good endboard. Otherwise, you can normal Gozuki to get 1 discard from the grave, which will be usually Banshee or glow-up. VAMPIRE SUCKER BTW!!! Vampire Sucker has an effect where you can tribute one of your opponent's monsters to tribute summon, so if you draw Balerdroch and don't have a normal summon/want to get Balderdroch for monster removal, you should probably go for it. I hadn't really considered this until recently, and it can catch your opponent offguard. (Disclaimer: DON'T GET GREEDY! Unless you REALLY think they don't have anything, don't special from their GY just for a free card draw. This really could just give them free link material if you don't get rid of it.) I took Jackobolan out of my deck because I REALLY don't think it's that good considering I have Super Poly and Branded Fusion. PS. I usually try to bait out negates with Foolish burial or even really Unizombie. Honestly, as long as you have Branded Fusion and a way to get Zombie World out on the field, you're probably good.

Septentrion is really good for searching disruptions or your draw 7 and chariot makes your ursarctic's untargetable something almost no one knows. The swordsoul package is usually used to summon your omni in de fleur or either level 10 swordsoul depends on what your dueling against. Your iris can be summoned if you have a card negated with septentrion. Sometimes you can also get a bunch of advantage from your ursarctic spells and sometimes sneak games from your opponet by stealing their monsters with your field spell.

deck_excerpt: Branded Invoked Shaddoll Toolbox. Fusion summon a variety of extra deck monsters, and always have a hand trap.
deck_description: Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon is quickly summoned from fusion summon effects, also a selection of Invoked and Shaddoll monsters can be used to lock out certain strategies, or come back from an unfavorable game position. Branded Fusion uses Albaz and The Light as material. The Light smooths out extra deck summoning, and it is the main reason this deck is playing a variety of fusion packages, not just Branded. 3 Magical Meltdown, 1 Terraforming, and 1 Branded Lost push Albion chains through opposing effects. Foolish Burial grabs Shaddoll monsters from the deck to gy for: draw 1, destroy 1 spell/trap, or banish 3 cards from any gy(s). 8 hand trap monsters are played to ensure coverage against a wide range of strategies during game 1 of a match. Overall, the deck is 16 starters,  14 extenders, 9 disruptions, and The Light - Hex Sealed Fusion.

Goal Summon Accesscode Talker and use Prohibit Snake cards to catch opponents off guard on their attack. Prohibit Snake is an excellent addition to any Codetalker deck; from your own hand, it sends your opponent's attacking monster back to their hand if it attacks any of your Codetalkers. Also: if Prohibit Snake is in your graveyard and you destroy an opponent's monster, you can banish a GY card and send another card back to your hand. This integrates nicely with chained effects, of which there are many in this deck. An ideal set-up would be to end with an Accesscode Talker and another linked Codetalker on the field, and a Prohibit Snake in your hand. That protects your CTs from attacks (which Accesscode is otherwise not protected from), and gives you the opportunity to act on the offensive with Accesscode's effects.   Your First Turn (Turn 1 or Turn 2) - Summon Code Talker with Micro Coder in hand + field card, then search for Cynet Codec (if already in hand, instead search for Cynet Optimization or Conflict) - Next: summon Transcode Talker with Code Talker + another card, preferably an in-hand summon card (e.g., Code Exporter). Special summon Eater of Millions if available. - Next: revive Code Talker with Transcode Talker, and continue to link summon so long as you have in-hand summon cards. If Turn 1, end phase and wait until next turn to summon Accesscode Talker. If Turn 2, summon Accesscode Talker with Transcode Talker + field or in-hand card. Use Accesscode Talker effects to destroy opponent's cards and then attack.   Your Second Turn (only if you started the game, Turn 3) - Summon Accesscode Talker and see above.

deck_excerpt: Cute Waifus and Big Dragons? Sign me up!
deck_description: Konami has made a lot of female-based archetypes, but this is one of the only good ones.  The main mechanic of these draconic housekeepers is that the low-level maids tag out for their high-level counterparts(you can tell which is which by the element or their names, the big dragons are all anagrams of their small versions).  The Boss Monster of this archetype is Dragonmaid Sheou, a walking Omni-negate with 3500 ATK and the ability to special summon any other Dragonmaid from your hand or GY. It's omni-negate effect allows it to tag out to House Dragonmaid, its maid counterpart. House Dragonmaid can special summon a Dragonmaid from your hand or GY that is 1 level higher or lower than a Dragonmaid you control.  Cards like Dragon Ravine and Chaos Ruler, that dump cards to the GY, are very helpful for this deck, as their cards both have good GY effects and use the GY as a second hand.

Crossing Designator banishes Metaphys cards. Yes it does work since their effect activates on your opponents turn so basically you are running 4 gold sarcophagus (doesn't work on cards like giant rex and necroface obviously)  Left arm offering banishes your entire hand for a spell so you can banish Metaphys cards, necroface, whatever cards and get a dimensional fissure on your field immediately  Muddy substitutes as a fusion material. Easily makes cards like Mechaba and Mirrorjade.     Side decked dragon kings aura since it might get some use

deck_excerpt: They are here to steal your heart, and your wallet
deck_description: While Master Duel is waiting for this deck to be actually playable, OCG and TCG can play them at full power with their Boss Monster, Evil*Twin's Trouble Sunny.  Though their Main Deck monsters are primarily lackluster in power and effects, the true power of this archetype lies in the Extra Deck. The Main Deck Ki-sikil and Lil-la, respectively, can special summon the other if you control no other monsters, making them excellent starters, and the deck has a lot of ways to search them out in their archetypal Spells and Traps.  On your 1st turn, your goal is to summon E*T Ki-sikil first, special summon a Lil-la from your GY, then make E*T Lil-la, special summon E*T Ki-sikil from your GY to draw a card, you can then make either Trouble Sunny or Unchained Abomination depending on your preference or whether you go 1st or 2nd, or if you have Evil*Twins Ki-sikil & Lil-la, the Main Deck Boss Monster, in your hand or GY, you could make that as well.  The Main Deck Ki-sikil and Lil-la are Cyberse Type, their alternate cards, Frost and Treat are Aqua and Zombie, respectively, and their Extra Deck monsters and E*T Ki-sikil & Lil-la are Fiend Type, and most of them lock you into Fiend monsters from the Extra Deck. So thankfully, Unchained Abomination, the Boss Monster of the Unchained archetype, happens to work very well with the Live/Evil*Twins as it is also a Fiend.

According to Yugipedia, the Tearalaments deck is potentially based on the tragic tale "The Little Mermaid" by Hans Christian Andersen. https://yugipedia.com/wiki/Tearalaments     That's why I named this deck "The Not-So-Little Mermaid." Gameplay-wise, this is a control deck, intended to set up as many disruptions and floodgates as possible, even during the opponent's turn. And honestly, I can see this deck being competitive in the TCG. Tearalaments is one strong deck!

deck_excerpt: utilize all available tribal resources to shoot out big, game ending monsters to crush your opponent into the dust by turn 3.
deck_description: So, this is a bit of a shot in the dark considering its the first deck I've assembled by myself of Yugioh, but the basic gist of it is that you utilize all available tribal resources to shoot out big, game ending monsters to crush your opponent into the dust by turn 3. A lot of the cards double up in utility, such as the jurracs being useable for both synchro and XYZ materials, with the extra deck functioning as a tool kit to deal with problems as they arise. Plenty of support-type monsters means the draw and summoning power is there (and hopefully consistent enough), with cards like Magical Mallet and the elemental dinosaurs fixing themselves so that there are (hopefully) no dead draws. The sideboard is designed to deal with any troublesome card archetypes that either get around destroy effects (such as hyper hammerhead) or monsters to come in handy in long games (such as Overtex Qoatlus). Feedback is appreciated, as I'm still pretty new to the game.

deck_excerpt: Competitive Charmer Meta 2022  Quick Guide + Key Cards Combo Video Tutorial
deck_description: YU-GI-OH! Master Duel: Chaos Spirit Charmer Check out my YOUTUBE CHANNELS The “Charmer”, or known as the “Spirit Charmer” is a standalone archetype of Spellcaster monster themed on controlling monsters with the same Attribute as them which is unfortunately not playable in any way without an exceptional support from another card. Surprisingly the new Archetype called “Magistus” came out soon after the “Spirit Charmer” was released in 2021. The “Magistus” archetype had a perfect synergy for the “Charmers” especially since they only rely on base from Attribute and Types. This deck is strong enough to be used in high Tier level on Master Duel or Tournaments(hopefully).... This build is very easy to obtain/play it and can be used for any newcomer duelist because most of the cards are actually straightforward for the combos which I already listed the key cards for anyone interested to play Charmer Deck.   Start with only using 3 simple Key Cards which is the only best I ever come out with for the Full Charmer's combos.   Just following the recommendation cards that are listed below. ___________________________________________   [Key Cards]: 3 Main Engine - Spirit Charmers - Performage Damage Juggler - Zoroa, the Magistus of Flame   [Recommend] to Search/Use - Lyna the Light Charmer (Hand) & Awakening of the Possessed (Spell/Trap Zone) - Performage Trick Clown (Hand) - Artemis, the Magistus Moon Maiden (Spell/Trap Zone) = Crowley, the Magistus of Grimoires (Hand)   ___________________________________________   Once you finally set up your cards. You will proceed with the next step by activating “Crowley, the Magistus of Grimoires” effect to send out “Lyna, the Light Charmer” from your hand to the GY. Then use "Crowley, the Magistus of Grimoires" effect to become Earth Attribute that allowed you to Summon “Awakening of the Possessed - Nefariouser Archfiend'' card from either hand or Deck by sending both “Crowley, the Magistus of Grimoires” and “Performage Trick Clown” from the field to the GY, which make them to trigger of their effects by Chain Link 2 and bringing it back “Lyna, the Light Charmer” from the GY to the field along with “Performage Trick Clown” by it own effect. Now you have finally had a chance to Summon “Familiar-Possessed Lyna” from either hand or Deck by its own effect. After that use “Familiar-Possessed Lyna” effect to search out “Dogmatika Ecclesia, the Virtuous” from your Deck then add it to your hand which is the only best Spellcaster monster with 1500 DEF/Level 4/Light Attribute monster that can be able to search out by "Familiar-Possessed - Dharc" effect when it Summoned by it own effect.   Reminder: Do not activate "Dogmatika Ecclesia, the Virtuous" effect during your turn when it Summoned to your field, it will disable you for summoning from the Exta Deck unless if you have too. (This is an Optional)   ___________________________________________   Tips: You might not actually get them from the opening hand with exactly cards. So I prefer you to try something else with different cards in your hand if one of the Key Cards are missing. You should better rely on your additional cards in your hand that might help you to set up your cards. Keep it in your mind that "Spirit Charmers" is just an additional card to use Familiar-Possessed - Lyna's Effect to search out "Dogmatika Ecclesia, the Virtuous" from your deck to the hand.   ___________________________________________   [Additional] for more Consistency You can use "Summoner Monk" as additional for "Zoroa, the Magistus of Flame" or any Level 4 monster from your Deck like "Rilliona, the Magistus of Verre" or any Performage monster depending what card you need. Requirement: 1 any Spell card, except "Spirit Charmers" card, if not, you can use it as well if you have too. I include “Summoner Monk” from my Deck Profile since It actually works very well for any Level 4 monster.   ___________________________________________   The End Board got changed frequently due to lack of cards since I actually used Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon lately in the actual game which is not my original plan for this deck. So I came up with the new play style by giving you more options to play either "Number 106: Giant Hand" or summon any link 2 like "Predaplant Verte Anaconda" depending on any situation if you have more additional cards on your play to expand it.   I want to try something new in Master Duel with different cards that I have so it got changed especially from the Extra Deck. You can still use I:P Masquerena as usual to link summon “Selene, Queen of the Master Magicians”, "Knightmare Unicorn" and/or "Apollousa, Bow of the Goddess" during your opponent's turn. You can also add as many hand traps you want as long the key cards had three copies for each the following Recommendation. Like & Subscribe for more Videos https://youtu.be/6_H_pc56WC8

deck_excerpt: Prank-Kids Adventurer DPE / 17th Place Lock Haven, PA WCQ Regional Qualifier
deck_description: 17th Place Lock Haven, PA WCQ Regional Qualifier
Write your deck strategy here...ok

Hello! Another Dogmatika Deck? Yeah. Nothing too fancy too be honest.  The decks normal summons are incredibly important so be sure you are actually able to get those off. Spellbook is an amazing deck thinner and has access to a searchable Reborn and Fate. Dogmatika are the only monsters in the main board that can special summon themselves so try to set them up. The Invoked cards allows for another spellcaster source on top of being excellent support for fusion engines such as Shaddoll.  My hand for this deck is pretty consistent and as long as you don't get Ash'd or Droll'd you will be fine. As long as you start with either Spellbook Magician or Spellbook of Secrets you can start thinning out your deck and setting up Fate.  Typical turns for me are pretty much Spellbook Magician + Search Secret + Use Secret search for Spellbook of the Master (to copy Secret) if you have another Book in hand otherwise go for Knowledge. Next you have Magician Link into Artemis and use Knowledge to sac her for 2 cards. This will set up your gy for Maximus or Mechaba.

deck_excerpt: Easy 10.000+ ATK. This deck can also go first?!
deck_description: Skull Servants in Master Duel are played quite differently from the TCG's version. Not only do they enjoy 3 copies of That Grass Looks Greener (Making 60 card decks a no brainer) in addition to Charge of the Light Brigade for some explosive milling but they also have better going first plan: Thunder Dragon Colossus is at 1 so cards banished off of Wightprince or Mezuki can be returned to the deck with Nemeses Corridor (Which can be searched by Nemeses Flag) in order to gain access to the one-sided floodgate that is Colossus, an insta-win in many instances. This deck still plays going second cards, with the best ones being Forbidden Droplet and Super Polymerization because they can also be used during the opponent's turn and because this deck loves to discard. The objective of the deck is still getting a huge King of the Skull Servants, a good combo to do this without Grass involves Uni-Zombie (Which can also be summoned by Shiranui Solitaire), using it's level manipulation effects to reach level 5 and to get both a Mezuki and a level 3 in grave so you can banish Mezuki, summon the level 3, synchro off into a Chaos Ruler, the Chaotic Magical Dragon to get some more cards in grave. Beware of Uni-Zombie's restriction to only zombies being able to attack the turn you use it's effects!

The goal of this deck is to turbo out the egyptian god cards as fast as possible. This is a going second deck, you want to let your opponent set up and then clear their board with sphere mode/soul crossing.  Soul Crossing is the reason this deck works. It turns every god card into a sphere mode, except the monster starts out on your field immediately. Incidentally you can use it to summon Sphere Mode to your side of the field immediately and go straight into a 4000 Winged Dragon of Ra.  Pot of Extravagance and Prosperity are maxed out because other than Egyptian God Slime this deck doesn't use the extra deck at all, and we want to get to our combo pieces right away.  Ra's Disciple and Reactor Slime are the main way you can get 3 tribute fodder on the board. Reactor Slime also allows you to tribute it to set a Metal Reflect Slime directly from your deck.  Guardian slime and Metal Reflect Slime are the 2 cards used to bring out Egyptian God Slime, which can act as 3 tributes for the summon of a Divine monster, as well as being a respectable monster in its own right with 3000 atk/def and a redirection effect.  Ancient Chant and Thunderspeed Summon are how you're going to summon the god cards the same turn you get the materials on the field (other than Soul Crossing). Thunderspeed Summon also allows you to tribute summon on your opponents turn or during your battle phase. Ancient Chant lets you search for The Winged Dragon of Ra and gives you an extra tribute summon (you can summon a monster other than Ra if you want to). it also gives Ra an attack boost on summon, which is nice because you're normally bringing it out at 7900 making you just shy of an OTK.  Forbidden Droplet and Solemn Judgment are quality staples and I don't think I need to explain why they're good. Technically Judgment has negative synergy with Ra, but I think the negation is important. It's also the only Solemn that can be used after Ra resolves its effect.

deck_excerpt: I found the way to make Assault Modes playable...
deck_description: Assault Mode is a notoriously underpowered archetype in Yugioh, as they require their specific Spells and Traps to change a Synchro Monster you control to the corresponding Assault Mode monster in your deck. First, you have to have the Synchro monster already on your field. Second, you have to draw the Assault Mode spell/trap. Third, you have to not have the Assault Mode card in your hand, as the original Assault Mode Activate, the searchable one, only summons from the deck.  These inherent flaws in the deck's strategy led to its immediate DoA(Dead on Arrival) status, but Legacy support for this archetype has made it a decent engine in some decks to cut down on minimum cards in deck, but I intend to use it for its original purpose, to actually summon an Assault Mode monster. And I will summon the best, and basically the only good, Assault Mode monster, Stardust Dragon(T.G. Halberd Cannon/Assault Mode isn't bad either).  To supplement the weaknesses of the Assault Mode archetype, I added the Brave/Adventurer Engine, giving the deck a stronger board presence, including an omni-negate, in addition to Stardust Dragon/Assault Mode, and a consistent way to recur your cards.

deck_excerpt: Redefining What it Means to be a Dinosaur...
deck_description: The Main Deck Dinomorphia monsters, and their previous Boss Monster Kentregina, are basically just humans in dinosaur-esque mech suits, but they do have 2 actual dinosaur monsters in the Extra Deck, in Stealthbergia and their new Boss Monster, Rexsturm.  This archetype is very interesting, as instead of increasing your LP like Aromages, all their effects halve your LP and have an effect, your goal is to have as few LP as possible, then get out your Fusion Monsters. Kentregina is a 3k+ Beater and can copy a Dinomorphia Normal Trap from the GY as a Quick Effect, Rexsturm is a 3k ATK monster that can change the ATK of all monsters your opponent controls to make them equal to your LP, which is usually pretty low(100 or less), Stealthbergia is monster with 2500 DEF and makes it so that you do not have to pay LP to activate Traps or the effects of your Dinomorphia cards, and when your opponent activates a moster effect, it can deal damage equal to that monster's original ATK.  All of the Dinomorphia monsters have reviving effects on destruction via battle or card effect, the 2 old Fusions can special summon a Level 4 or lower Dinomorphia, the 2 Main Deck Dinomorphia monsters can special summon a Level 4 or lower Dinomorphia monster with a different name(essentially the other Dinomorphia, as of right now). and Rexsturm can special summon a Level 6 or lower Dinomorphia monster, allowing it to special summon the other Fusion monsters as well.

deck_excerpt: Invoked Mekk-Knights Deck - Master Duel Season 5
deck_description: Invoked Mekk-Knights deck for Master Duel. Running VFD for if I get 2 Mechabas out (possible in one turn). Rest of the monsters are pretty self explanatory. There's a lot of cool things you can do to manipulate columns with this deck. For example, linking off Aleister into Almiraj and placing Invocation under it to create a column, or using Girsus tokens, or using Kaijus to manipulate columns by placing them in the one you want. There are a couple combos you can do even playing around your opponent not having many cards set up.   -- VFD Combo: Aleister + 1 Mekk -- • Normal Summon Aleister and grab Invocation • Link Aleister off into Almiraj, place Invocation under Almiraj • Summon Mekk-Knight under Almiraj, link them into Aleister of Madness • use Invocation, banish Aleister and Mekk to summon Mechaba • Madness procs, grab Invocation, use Invocation and the Aleister in hand with whatever other Light monster to make another Mechaba  • Use both Mechabas to go into VFD    -- DPE + Scythe + Mechaba -- • Normal Summon Aleister and grab Invocation • Link Aleister off into Almiraj, place Invocation under Almiraj • Summon Mekk-Knight under Almiraj, link them into Artifact Dagda in the OTHER Extra Monster zone and place Scythe under itself • Summon your second Mekk-Knight and link Dagda and Mekk into Verte  • Use Invocation to summon Mechaba (if going second, Purgatrio also works) • Use Verte to summon DPE

deck_excerpt: the best iteration of tri-brigade since full power bird up
deck_description:
Interesting Tech Choices

Gold Sarcophagus - you can banish mercourier to add albion the shrouded. albion send the trap, draw 1, and add back mercourier. you went from 0 tri-beast to 1 and potentially another with the draw or another handtrap.

One For One - One for one pitch kitt or mercourier is really good gets a body on the board without having to normal or when you dont have kerass access. good back up plan when cat gets stopped. note: you can't link the summoned nervall off with almiraj, might be worth playing linkkuriboh in the flex spot. Gamma Package - i think you have to plauy this, everyone is playing ash because of despia branded. it protects tenki, fraktall, rescue cat, and mirrorjade effect when it sent to grave with nothing else on field. you ca side it out going second if u want Alpha, Master of Beasts (Side) - experimental tech. theory was going second against despia you can out the mirrorjade and dodge the destrcution effects. another big body, another free special, sometimes you can bounce two if you have an extender in hand.   Locals Report - 2nd Place (3-0-1) Round 1 vs. BASED 2-0 (won die roll) Round 2 vs. Sky Striker 1-1-1 (lost die roll, tie in time game 3) Round 3 vs. Branded Despia Brave 2-1 (won die roll) Round 4 vs Branded Despia Eldlich 2-0 (lost die roll)   Overall Thoughts This is the best iteration of tri since full power birds in my opnion. The albion combo is so insanely plus. you get to draw/add so much off of shurag, fer, albion, brigrand, and bearbrum you are more likely to see the cards you side which is nice. tactics really under performed for me, might cut those slots and get down to 41, however i think the HT ratios worked really well in 43. very flexible, even with "brick" hands I was still able to make plays.

deck_excerpt: Reject shaddoll maindeck monsters, return to normal summon Albert.
deck_description: An extremely original strategy. The weakest main deck cards of IDS are in my opinion the shaddoll maindeck monsters, so why not cut them out and replace them with something better, that enables a plethora of new powerful fusion monsters. Also as far as I know, verte ignores branded fusion's locking effect, allowing you to use verte to send branded fusion and use its fusion effect even though you link summoned.  "Why not 3 aluber?" -me poor  "Why no DPE?" -see above and I think Fusion Destiny might get banned soon so I don't want to invest in it.  "Why no pots or draw cards?" -because I am a bad deck builder and don't fear god.  A card I am considering siding (or even possibly playing main deck) is incredible ecclesia, I feel going second this card could be great and it would be okay going first but it doesn't seem high-impact enough to justify its price tag, at least for branded stuff. In Swordsoul its probably justified.  You can do the usual IDS stuff to set up mechaba with schism to summon winda on your opponent's turn, as a matter of fact Winda is still going to be your wincon and as long as winda and the cards that enable her are legal, she will always be the wincon of this deck, despite being so hated. The difference is we have a better shaddoll fusion: branded fusion. Ghost Ogre, Effect Veiler, Nibiru, and all of our Dogmatika monsters are lights, which are fuel for Albion the Branded dragon, which can be used to go into Mirrorjade, Mechaba, Augoeides, probably more; I haven't sat down to do a lot of testing yet. With so many lights we can also run Despian Quaeritis as an extra deck option, but our space is tight so I didn't include it here. I chose to run Almiraj + Secure Guardna over just Artemis to ensure we have fodder for Maximus if we can get access to him. If we can get Maximus access, we have Winda access, and Winda is the wincon.

Inspired by Lebron James's "Wanna Sprite?" commercials, this Splight deck profile shows you exactly why two can be as bad as one. This archetype's playstyle revolves around summoning Level/Rank/Link 2 monsters. Now that this deck's name has been explained, onto the strategy!     This Nibiru-proof deck actually has a Live Twin and Frog engine, and around 15 hand traps. So while you CAN go second, your strategy should be to go first and set up as many disruptions/negates as you can. Funny thing about Toadally Awesome, though. Its effect isn't a hard once-per-turn, so if you can pitch it to negate a card, and revive it on the same turn, you can use its negate again! As a matter of fact, you can revive it using Splight Elf's effect!

Category: Tournament Meta Deck  Tournament Meta Decks are current-level Meta Decks that are capable of going up against the best of the best. These are curated lists that cannot be uploaded by regular users.  Creator: Walter Jule Tournament: YCS Guadalajara - May 1st 2022 Placement: Top 16

Pure D/D/D for Master Duel. Main deck - Not running any Maxx C because of the raw amount of search power that D/D/D has, along with having other draw/search cards. 2 Ash and 2 Called By, in case of a Maxx C or an opponents Ash / Droll / etc. Obviously running 3 of the staples, those being Keplar, Necro Slime, Lamia and Swirl Slime. 3 Berfomet to mess with the levels of other monsters, whether it be to go into a Synchro or XYZ. Orthros is just a good level 4 Tuner and serves as a decent Scale. Vice Typhoon is like a second Necro Slime, and can be sent straight to the GY by Copernicus, which is why I don't run something like Foolish Burial. Ragnarok is good for both the Scale effect and Monster effect. Zero Rage is the best scale in the deck, and stops you from taking damage by something like Ragnarok, Gilgamesh, or your Dark Contracts. Extra Deck - 2 Ghengis, to either go into High King Caesar or to use for Synchro material, and also to chain summons from the GY. Oracle can help heal lost LP and can be used as Synchro material with Lamia to make Siegfried. Beowulf is just a good card in general, having a field-wide spell/trap wipe and gives your monsters piercing. Caesar Ragnarok can be replaced by Purple Armageddon, but both work, I just find Caesar Ragnaroks steal/equip effect more useful than destruction/burn. Both work well. Alexander is kinda just an extender and Synchro fodder. Siegfried is one of your best negates, being a quick-effect targeting negate. High King Ghengis is also a spell/trap negate. Baby Caesar can search for any Contract after leaving the field, and you can summon King Tell using Baby Caesar. Burn your opponent then use King Tell as Link fodder for Gilgamesh, then use King Tells effect. High King Caesar is probably the best negate in the deck, being a summon negate + destruction, even if it's in the hand. It's not once per turn, and is a quick effect. Basically, it's 2 mini Solemn Strikes that don't require LP to pay. Kali Yuga is the last thing you want to go into, as it shuts down everything else for the turn. Hes also got a spell/trap board wipe, and can also search any Dark Contract from the GY. Gilgamesh is the last card, and he carries a lot of the plays. Use him to get D/D's in the grave such as King Tell, use him to get the Pend scales you want, use him as fusion fodder, he just makes everything possible. I'm using this in Master Duel, but this works in the TCG too I'm pretty sure. In fact it'd probably be better because of cards like Gryphon and Deus Machinex.

deck_excerpt: Swarm the field and control your opponent with Witchcrafters using the new fusion monster "Witchcrafter Vice-Master"! (Ft. Magistus)
deck_description: Hello everybody!. As you may or may not know, months ago was released some support to the Witchcrafters archetype that is yet to arrive to the TCG, but we may as well start doing some recipes and experimentations beforehand. Sadly, even though the new Witchcrafter Fusion Monster is a solid option to build a deck around, the Fusion Spell Card is really underwhelming (we are talking about a slow-searchable polymerization). so, i've been looking around the other spellcaster archetypes and found out that a Magistus package works wonders in this deck!. What does the "Magistus Package" do exactly?. Well i'm glad that you asked. Since there's no way to search out the Witchcrafter Fusion Spell without using Patronus (Too slow for turn-one) this deck uses instead "Magistus Invocation" that can be searched out with "Rilliona, the magistus of verre" (Since her effects procs also when special summoned you can use "Summoner Monk" to search her out). With this alone it makes the deck a lot more consistent and less dependant of Verte, but there's more!. You may combo this with "Magicalized Fusion" to have both Aiwess and Vice-Master on the field. "Magician Souls" is also a great card in the deck, you can cycle your deck with it's draw effect, prepare graveyard for Magicalized Fusion, and even link it off to "Artemis, the magistus moon maiden" and THEN normal/special summon Rilliona to search out Crowley and do Magistus combos. [Zoroa is there to be SS from the deck with xyz Rilliona] The best part of this deck is that depending on your opening hand you may go with a Witchcrafter-only play or a Magistus-only play, or even better, both of them at the same time!. I truly believe that this version of the Witchcrafter deck (While being an actual Witchcrafter deck) is the one with the highest ceiling and consistency out of all that i've tried out. It may not be meta (not without some hand-traps) and tends to die out quickly with negations but it's able to pull off strong boards and consistent OTK potential (with any 2 monster you can link-climb into Accesscode Talker that along with Vice-Master makes 8000 points of damage on the board) Updated 17/05/22 (Banlist): Now that verte is banned this deck lost it's way to get the fusion on the field in the worst case scenario. I replaced verte for a second copy of Artemis, the Magistus Moon Maiden.

deck_name: Adamancipator Sekka (Master Duel Diamond after May 9/5 Banlist)
deck_excerpt: Adamancipator Prank-Kids Sekka Master Duel Diamond
deck_description: See Here if you want to see one of the combo played under Maxx "C", nibiru, impermanence, veiler. Q: Why use sekka light and Called by the grave both? A: Adamant is one turn board-making deck, the win or lose would be determined in the first-two turn. if you draw both you will activate sekka first, if your opponent chain hand traps (usually to ash blossom, or sometimes i got chained to Maxx "C" in anticipation i would draw ash blossom later) which you can chain the called. if you don't draw into sekka light, called is one of the best card going first, and decent in going second. The combo start from each adamancipator or prank-kids engine + gigantes / koa'ki meiru supplier to become gallant granite to search for block dragon Start from adamancipator: by priority, you should summon Adamancipator Analyzer 1st, followed by  Adamancipator Seeker, then Adamancipator Researcher. Adamancipator Researcher is the easiest to special summon and can be used as last effort. one of the strongest early combo is to normal summon koa'ki meiru guardian, followed by Researcher and analyzer.   Start from Prank-Kids: to start from prank kids, you need either koa'ki meiru supplier or gigantes to make Prank Kids Bow-Bow Barks + 1 Rocksies and to gallant granite. Have Parallel exceeds in hand: prioritize for summoning bait (doki doki, prank-kids), the parallel exceeds would extend to : 1. Gallant Granite (to search block dragon, or koa'ki meiru supplier / gigantes as your level additional 4 extender) 2. Union Carrier / I.P. Masquarena 3. one as material for  Apolousa, and another for i.p. masquarena   Block Dragon: remember that each of the Adamancipators tuner have HOPT special summon. generally block dragon will search: Gigantes, adamancipator lv 2 tuner that have not been special summoned by own effect. If you have summoned gigantes, search for koa'ki meiru supplier for extend or adamancipator analyzer for next turn. Dinowrestler Pankratops: one of the best card for going second, it could try to attack into 3 mats apolousa, eldlich (can bait conquistador then chain into skill drain / other floodgate). if you 100% sure you would go first and/or surrender if going second (in case you only do dailies). change with the deck I used to climb to diamond 1 : weeping idol is removed to make the deck as compressed as possible, if you still want to use weeping idol. I would suggest to remove pankratop

deck_excerpt: Pure Dragunity deck that can pull off crazy special summoning combos, recovers quickly, and is just really fun!
deck_description: Flood your grave with tuners in order to constantly special summon them back out with the unique effects to equip then special summon for insane synchro and link plays! Barcha is your major player when it comes to this with its effect to equip as many Dragunity monsters as possible from the grave to it which is not once per turn. This deck has insane recovery power and hand control as long as Dragon Ravine is on the field as it can search monsters like Dux and Senatus or send tuners to the grave or monsters that can special summon themselves from the grave such as Remus, Arma Gram, and Tempest, Dragon Ruler of Storms. Besides Dragon Ravine there are a variety of searchers and cards that can fill your grave or even special summon straight from the deck. Dragon Ravine itself has searchers and searchers for those searchers so you have a plan for anything. And that's the best thing about this deck, your never restricted to one combo and chokepoint. You can discover a new, unorthodox strategy nearly every time you play with this deck and face a new challenge.

deck_name: Invoked Dogmatika Shaddoll Branded Mysterune B1
deck_description: IDSBM B1

The goal of this deck is to summon Simorg (Link Monster) Union Carrier to summon mist valley thunderbird and at the end phase Mist Valley Apex Avian.  This will be the unlimited negate where when your ppoonenet activates a card or effect you can activate Avians effect and select thunderbird to return to hand.  Due to thunderbird effect he will return to the field and you can rinse and repeat and negate multipolr times per turn.  The weakness of this combo is avians ability is only once per chain so dont get baited in a bad situation.  (side note:  mist valley thunderbird aftert it activates its effect to return to the field , you could technically summon Thunder Dragon Colossus.  
  1. Essential you want to fill your field with monsters so to start the combo summon scrap wyvern and fill the board with scrap golem etc.  use scrap golem to summon another scrap monster
  2. Link Summon Reprodocus using the  scrap wyvern and another monster. (Very important to have a monster underneath Reprodocus after he is summoned.
  3. Activate Reprodocus effect to change the monster type he is pointing to into Winged Beast.
  4. Now Link summon Simorgh, Bird of Sovereignty using Reprodocus and the monster he points to.
  5. use to other monsters with either the same attribute or type to summon union carrier.
  6. Activate union carrier ability and select Simorgh (link Monster) to equip Mist Valley Thunderbird.
My Typical First turn end Board will be Simorgh (Lin Monster) equipped with Mist Valley Thunderbird, Union Carrier, UTC in defense and at the end phase i will have Mist Valley Avian APex special summoned with the Simorgh (link Monster end phase)

deck_excerpt: A fun more of control style flip effect deck.
deck_description: Struggles a bit going second but can put up decent negate boards going second. Including Deus X-Krawler from just one Girsu, the Orcust Mekk-knight. Krawler Soma is just such a great card and it really makes the deck shine. Sol and Luna is also a great card. It can disrupt opponent's plays by putting their monsters face-down adn triggering your Krawler Flip effects. It can also along with World Legacy Pawns flip Krawlers face-up when opponent is targeting face down Krawlers with removal effects, triggering the Krawler monsters' special summoning effect. I decided to drop World Legacy in Shadow from the final build because it sometimes bricked and usually was just foing nothing except being a target for opponent's spell and trap removal. And nasty surprise fo people who don't read. Nibiru the Primal Being is an especially great card for this deck as it does not tribute face-down monsters. You can just wipe opponent's field with it while still maintaining face-down krawlers. Also opponent cannot really use nibiru on you for the same reason. On top of that it trigger's krawlers' special summon effects. Solemn Judgment is there to prevent feather duster, lightning storm, raigeki and nasty board wipe or negate monsters. https://youtu.be/TBz9Xh2LEEg

deck_excerpt: Silence engulfed in constant chaos with a million questions to be answered even noise seems strangely pleasant
deck_description: Today's video is gonna be linked down below. No questions asked ( https://youtube.com/watch?v=u8SC25-8zN0&t=762s ) So to Answer anyone's question on how far we (the players) can expand the everlasting length of the Branded-Despia Pantheon, this here is my mark. I have been playing Yu-Gi-Oh in all forms for over fifteen years, and to say the innovation of homebrew deckbuilding has been toppled by handtraps, generic staples, and banlist forged by incompetent corporate synicism is an understatement. Today I'm gonna challenge myself even further by making a collaboration of 4 different engines into one deck (5 if we are counting Branded, but turns out it was never a real engine at all). Turns out that even though the excessive milling was indeed the price to pay for Lightsworns, the addition of such isn't as bad as I thought. For starters, what I first learnt from all this was the ease of getting both Minerva, the Exalted Lightsworn and almost all the necessary Fusion monsters needed to fulfill your board building adventures (such as Lubellion the Searing Dragon ). Next comes the Chaos package; which (while not as big as intended) fits really well with both the Despia and Lightsworn engines with little problems (except for occasions to where you might need Chaos Dragon Levaineer, and either White Dragon Wyverburster or Black Dragon Collapserpent). Adventurer lineup for this deck is the normal lineup you would expect in just about any of the Adventurer-Despia builds since it's inception, and nothing has really changed regarding the lineup (until the release of the card, Illegal Knight from the set, Dimension Force). Finally the addition of some notable spell cards for this variant which includes Chaos Space, Branded in Red, and Frightfur Patchwork. Now we go on to the Extra Deck, which I mentioned earlier has the intention of giving me the ease of accessing the monsters with little issues. First in foremost this gives two options of either going into Minerva the Exalted Lightsworn or The Zombie Vampire; and while both do their milling jobs at a rate where it doesn't drain your decks too badly. The Zombie Vampire can be a lot more situational at times (especially against other Despian or Branded players), while Minerva the Exalted Lightsworn gives you a +1 for every Lightsworn milled from your deck (and can destroy cards on the field up to number of them milled if she is destroyed by battle or by card effect). Then where Frightfur Patchwork comes in is that is searches a copy of Polymerization for a very up and coming fusion monster Guardian Chimera (which requires 3 materials; but 1 from each your hand and field, and then you can draw/destroy cards up to the number of materials used from either side). Alongside that is the usual batch of Albaz Dragons commonly seen in most Branded builds with the addition of Despia Quaeritis and Masquerade the Blazing Dragon for the Despians. Finally comes the link monsters that (while not making the most significant impact) still play a decent part in making some gains on both ends on the board. First and foremost we have the strongest of the elemental Chamers, Dharc the Dark Charmer, Gloomy (played to snag Dark monsters from your opponents GY to use against them or to use them as fodder to fusion summoning with the Branded Dragons). Next in line is the familiar, but obscure Link-3 monster, Curious, The Lightsworn Dominion (recovers a card from the GY if destroyed and is a foolish burial on it's summon; but if a card is sent to the GY by an effect, it mills 3 cards from your deck). Finally comes the aforementioned Link-1 monster Link Spider (which is just an extender piece that is currently used to get off of your Adventurer token into any of the other 2 Link monsters I already mentioned).

deck_excerpt: Hand traps this format suck, so blow out your opponent's board with field wipes - then finish off your opponent with Sky Striker's unparalelled grind
deck_description: Who is gonna win? Hordes of Demons, Superpowerful Dragons, Masters of Arcane Arts, Or a single girl (with friends) in a mech suit? My money is on Raye, since she is more powerful than ever with an arsenal of 15 blind second cards!   The philosophy with blind second Sky Strikers is to destroy most if not all of your opponent's resources that they slap down on the board going first, and then close out the match with Sky Striker's unparalleled grind game. This deck has cards specifically picked out for the May 2022 meta, like Triple Tactics Talent (super good since everyone uses Branded, Flundereeze, and handtraps, etc). Evenly Matched obliterates most duelists this format since they spend all their resources building their "unbreakable" board only to fall to one card. Many boards are made to counter/negate monsters, but hardly anything (except Wandering Gryphon Rider) negates spell/trap effects! The current meta is easy pickings for blind second strategies, and Sky Striker is one fo the decks can make use of this style to its full potential. When your opponent forces you to go 1st thinking all you do is spam "Raigeki" and "Evenly Matched," metagame them by siding in devastating floodgates! If your weakened opponent hasn't surrendered yet, clear the board with Raye's besties Accesscode Talker and Destroyer Phoenix Enforcer!   And remember duelists... RAYE IS BAYE!!!   If you have any questions about this deck, feel free to ask me in the comments below!
