Of course, we have the Dogmatika package of 3x Ecclesia, 2x Maximus, and 1x Fleurdelis for monsters, 2x Nadir Servant(if it was unlimited, we would absolutely play it at 3) for spells, and 2x Punishment for traps  Standard Brave package as well, 3x Enchantress and 1x Wandering Gryphon Rider for monsters, and 3x Aramasir, 1x Fateful Adventure, and 1x Dracoback for spells.  Other cards are: 2x Nibiru, 3x Ash Blossom, 2x Ghost Belle, and 2x Veiler for Handtraps, 1x Called by, 3x Crossout, 2x Twisters, and 2x Impermanence.

deck_excerpt: Wanna stall you opponent to a bitter and painful Exodia death, well then this deck is for you.
deck_description: The strategy of this deck is pretty simple. Get your cook (Number 59: Crooked Cook) out and wait for the Exodia pieces. While you wait for the Exodia pieces, you can use the Ghost Reapers and Kaijus for clearing opponent threats. The Metalfoes Fusion is in this deck for Summoner Monk fuel, and to give additional draws (since you constantly will have 7 or more cards in your hand at the end of your turn), while also being a wait to protect yourself from a deck out. (Alternatively use Marron if you are scared of decking out) The Summoner Monk is probably the weirdest card in this deck, since you can't make Crooked Cook with him and the Right-Hand Shark, but then it is a good thing Buzzsaw Shark is a Level 4. Just summon him, make Almiraj with the Summoner Monk, tribute that monster of for it's effect, (which does nothing) then summon Right-Hand Shark and lastly the Cook. Another thing to note about this deck is, it doesn't care about Maxx "C", or to be more precise does it not affect this deck's gameplan at all. The opponent can get 4 free draws, and we won't care. Ash Blossom and Effect Veiler are the big hand trap counters to this deck, so hit them with Called By The Grave and Crossout Designator. As for the Extra Deck. Well, just fill it up with the cards you think will counter you. You only need 1-3 Crooked Cooks, and 1-2 Salamangreat Almirajs. The rest of the space can be used to whatever.  As for the weaknesses for this deck. There are a lot, but bricking is happily not one of them. (the deck has 13 cards that lead to cook, so that gives you a 10% chance of bricking) Kaijus are the biggest counter to this deck. A single Kaiju will make you forfeit, since you have no counter to it. Piercing and direct attacks are another big one, but the Ghost Reapers and Kaijus should help somewhat with those.  As for the matchups, we have Toons, Prank Kids and Blue-Eyes Max builds as the worst. The only thing stopping a Blue-Eyes Chaos Max Dragon in this deck is a Kaiju, but you will still take 7600 HP damage from a single attack, so you only get 1 turn to draw the Kaiju, if it is not already in your hand. On the other hand, does some decks not have a single out for this deck. I am talking about Drytron, Adamancipators, Virtual World esc.  As for a funny idea. I worked a bit on this myself, but found Exodia to be better. Final Countdown is another great win condition for this kind of deck. Crooked Cook is all about stalling, and why not let the 20 turns for Final Countdown tick down while you stall. You will only give your opponent 20 turns to find a counter, but most meta decks will have fount their counter within 5-10 turns, so your choice. If you chose to pick Final Countdown, will i recommend removing Metalfoes Fusion and possibly Summoner Monk, since you won't need the draw power anymore, and Summoner Monk becomes somewhat less useful without the Metalfoes Fusion. (Swap Summoner Monk out with Silent Angler and you won't feel a difference)

deck_excerpt: Want A Deck That Can Toolbox Basically Any Dragon?
deck_description: Dragon Link is an exceptional deck that can potentially go through its full combo without using its Normal Summon.  Borrelend Dragon, the Boss Monster of the Deck, is a very strong card that just got printed in the TCG, and is not yet available in Master Duel as of right now, as it cannot be destroyed by battle or card effect, nor can it be targeted, meaning that the only outs to it are a Kaiju monster or a non-targeting absorption effect, such as Underworld Goddess of the Closed Word, and by negating an Effect Monster, permanently, can simultaneously Special Summon a Rokket from the Graveyard.  A lot of cards in the deck lock you into Dark monsters from the Extra Deck, so I would recommend making Romulus quickly, as Dragon Ravine is a great card for any Dragon-based deck since it was first printed, or if you need to make a Halqifibrax combo to get started you should to it early in your turn.  Chaos Ruler is a very important card for this deck, and is fortunately a Dragon, as loading up the Graveyard is nothing but an advantage for this deck.  For the decklist, we have a Rokket package of 1x Absorouter, 2x Tracer, 1x Synchron, 1x Boot Sector, 3x Quick Launch, 1x Borreload Savage, 1x Borrelend, 3x Striker. A typical Chaos package for Dragon Link in 2x Collapserpent, 2x Wyverburster, 3x Starliege, 3x Chaos Space, and 1x Chaos Ruler. Standard Dragon support cards in 3x Noctovision, 1x Chamber and 2x Tidying(for a small Dragonmaid package), 1x Romulus and 1x Dragon Ravine, and 1x Hot Red Dragon Archfiend Abyss. Overall, the deck is very strong, very consistent, and shows that it deserves to be considered a meta deck in this format.

deck_excerpt: Just an update to my Darklord Despia list for Master Duel. Not much in-depth discussion this time, just wanna keep it short and sweet.
deck_description:
Hi, Grayewick the Fusionist here, back with another Darklord Despia list for Master Duel because I legitimately forgot if I've already sent one or not yet but anyway, yeah. "Why play this deck?" I mean... it's strong and it has thematic synergies that make them work together well. It's a really aggressive and oppressive deck if able to set up correctly, which shouldn't be a problem. Anyway, the list. Also, I'll just discuss the cards that need explanation and not the entire details of the list because, they should already be pretty understandable. Also I'm only playing 3 Alubers because I can, if there's a better option for this slot, I would cut one for a room. The only tech option that I will discuss today is this: • Diviner of the Herald - In my Darklord Despia Shaddolls list (if I was already able to post it here), this was Shaddoll Fusion and Shaddoll monsters as targets. But basically, it's just Branded Fusion at home. This is not a new tech choice for Darklords/Despias, in fact I've just been tinkering with this but haven't played the game due to how unfun it is. Normal Summon her, bin either Kristya, Lancea, or Scythe to the GY with her effect, then make The First Darklord. Speaking of which, the targets:
  1. Archlord Kristya - It's a floodgate that prevents Special Summoning, and thanks to The First Darklord, it cannot be Infinite Impermanence-d.
  2. Artifact Scythe - It's, again, a floodgate that prevents Special Summoning, although its effect has to be activated, but who cares. The First Darklord's effect prevents it from being targeted.
  3. Artifact Lancea - It's another free floodgate that prevents banishing for the turn. If you have access to this and Artifact Scythe or Kristya, then it's a guaranteed win unless they specifically have Dark Ruler No More or Forbidden Droplet.
Final Thoughts: If you can set up Scythe and Kristya in the GY going first, you already pretty much won the game. Also Konami, Ad Libitum of Despia where? An actual ban list where? Side decking where? OCG omegalul, uhh... Best of 1 format bad, what else... Can't wait for Normal Summon Aleister festival, bottom text, YEP. As per usual, if you have any questions or thoughts, feel free to express them down in the comments and I'll respond to them as soon as I possibly can. Edit: This list now also includes the DPE engine, a minor increase in ratio to fit certain tech options to adapt to the changes like Greater Polymerization.

So, you want a Pendulum deck in MD? Here's a Pendulum player's best attempt.

Overview: Endymagician as an archetype is all about board control, whether it be through monster, spell, or omni negates, big bodies, or protection. Using its mechanic of Spell counters as a resource, and using Magician support as half the deck to allow for an explosive, versatile extra deck, full of outs to almost anything, or O/FTK potential to weak boards. All this said, the deck is relatively weak to certain hand traps, moreso than some other pendulum decks thanks to Maxx C, and properly evaluating the absolute value of every card is a must.   Key Cards/Combos: HARMONIZING IS GOATED. This card as long as you have scales, is basically a Baronne for free, able to special summon any magician from your deck. Oafdragon for Baronne, anyone else for your rank 4 Xyzs and Lvl 8 Synchros. Alternatively, she can pull out anything for your Electrum engine. ASTROGRAPH IS GOATED. Kind of a garnet if drawn, but if you're at all familiar with this card, you'll know why. But to put it simply, it makes the Electrum engine work. Electrum, put Astro to the extra deck, Electrum effect, destroy something perishable, Astro to the hand, Astro effect summons him, puts thing you destroyed to hand (if theres another copy in the deck) Link out Selene using Electrum and anything you want, typically Astro, Selene effect, Link out I:P if you have the monsters, Link out Avram or Access depending on board with I:P + Selene. Endymion has the longest card text in YuGiOh, so here's an unofficial errata: in the P-zone he is an 8 scale that can take 6 spell counters from your side of the field to special summon him out, if you do this you can destroy cards equal to the number of cards that may have spell counters on them (you MUST destroy atleast one card.) and while he's a monster, he's a spell negate! the cost for the negate is to return a card that has spell counters on it to the hand, but once you do, those spell counters get put on Endymion himself. (yes he can target himself to be bounced if you need) and this is of course once per turn. Once he has spell counters on him, he gains target and destruction protection from card effects, and if he dies, he's a normal spell tutor. He kind of does alot. Jackal King is a monster negate as long as you have 2 spell counters somewhere, and he gains 2 spell counters for every spell played, not just one. Kiiiiinda really useful~   Conclusion: This was my first deck in Master Duel, and YuGiOh as a whole, so its kind of special to me personally, but its of course far from perfect, you will need to faf about with it a bit depending on what you like or need in your collection of archetypes. I come from Magic and Hearthstone, so Value/Control decks are some of my favourites, i tried to give this deck high value options for such a reason. If you have questions just ask, ill happily try my best to give you a proper answer ^-^ <3   I occasionally do Master Duel on my YT too~ https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGuaotx691PPQgCnSS-jrdg

deck_excerpt: Swarm the board with kuriboh monsters using five-star twilight. Spam link summons with the kuribohs. It is also easy to make a 6 material ZEUS.
deck_description: You want to get a level 5 monster on the field so that you can activate five-star twilight, which summons a bunch of kuriboh monsters to the field. The deck utilizes kuriboh support to either make this happen, or make it summon a ton of tokens onto the field instead with multiply. The idea is to spam into link summons so that you can have a full board of effects. Depending on the situation, it is also possible to make ZEUS with 6 material by using Lyrilusc's effect. A 5 card Albaz engine is added, mostly to keep the deck cheaper, but these can be replaced with staple cards like Accesscode, Apollousa, and Dragoon, which I reccommend as Albaz does not flow well with the deck.

deck_excerpt: In With The Old, In With The New

deck_excerpt: If You Only Want Monster Effects, Why NOT Draw 2, and Recycle 1?
deck_description: Since Fur Hire is a deck that heavily focuses on Monster Effects, and don't have any good archetypal Spells or Traps, other than Mayhem, their Quick-Play Reborn, so I had the idea to run them with Sekka's Light, a very powerful Pot of Greed retrain, but it has an actual cost. After activating it, you cannot use ANY Spells or Traps for the rest of the DUEL other than Sekka's Light. While it's in the GY, you can also banish it to recycle a monster from your hand back into the deck and draw a card.  For the decklist, we have our Fur Hire package of 2x Rafale, 2x Wiz, 2x Dyna, 2x Sagitta, 2x Seal, 3x Beat, 2x Helmer, 2x Filo, and 3x Folgo. For the rest of the Main Deck, we have 2x Nibiru, 3x Ash Blossom, 3x Ghost Belle, 3x Ghost Ogre, 3x Maxx C, 3x Droll, and 3x Veiler for Handtraps, and 3x Sekka for Spells, and for the rest of the Extra Deck, we have 1x Chengying, 1x Baronne, 1x Hot Red Dragon Archfiend Abyss, 1x Borreload Savage, 1x Chaos Ruler, 1x Draco Berserker, 1x Formula Synchron, 1x Underworld Goddess, 1x Accesscode, 1x Knightmare Unicorn, 1x Halqifibrax, and 1x Masquerena.

deck_excerpt: Tricky Vanilla beatdown with control elements revolving around their field spell and literal hand traps.
deck_description: The star of the show is the field spell Pacifis, the Phantasm City. it triggering to make a beefy token if your opponent activates *anything* and **mandatory** searching on normal or special summon of a normal monster (which tokens are) can get you1 search each on your turn and your opponent's turn, provided you don't already control a token. Paired up with the Legendary Fisherman support card Sea Stealth Attack, you can protect your spell/traps by remove your own token when you opponent activates an effect. Since the field spell activates on a new chain, both conditions for its activation 1. your opponent activates an effect and 2. you not controling a token *when it is able to activate.* That is why I also run Spiritual Water Art - Aoi as well as getting hand information and disruption. But being able to search archetypal cards is nothing to *what* the cards are you're searching. Both Phantasm Spiral Battle and Phantasm Spiral Power are the best search targets in a more controlling type of build. From-hand targeted destructions with Battleare still nice, and effect negation/attack lowering of power is arguably better. I like to think of it as a searchable Effect Veiler that can be used at any point of the turn, on either player's turn, includimg the damage step because of the stat point modulation. The equip spells are good ways to turbo out the 2900/2900 big chungus from almost everywhere as well as providing nice piercing, burn damage, or more discard against your opponent. This build is very enemic and made to be a budget Master Duel list. Includes to beef it up are a playset of Fossil Dig to search Megalosmasher X, the card Heat Wave to lock both of you (but mainly your opponent) from summoning effect monsters, and Card of Demise to dig further for your key cards of the field spell and either Sea Stealth Attack or a normal summon.

deck_excerpt: Oh Boy, A deck that isn't just Garbage?
deck_description: Now you may be asking yourself: "Why don't you just use tellarknights or any other Light Warrior themed decks?"  And to that I say: "There are other Light Warrior themed decks?"  I have always tried to make some sort of deck that used Poker Knights with something else that is nice. And that is where Heroics come into play.  Your main goal with this deck is to swarm the field to go into Extra Deck plays via Poker Knights or Heroics.  The Pokers are the Base of this deck, seeing as most of their support is here, which act as the metaphorical sterring wheel to the burning car that is this deck. Heroics are the Extenders, because the rest of their Archetype are don't wanna work or are bad (usually both), which can enable more Extra Deck shenanigans for you. Puppet Pawn is here for one reason only and that is Fusion Fodder but I'll explain later. BLS is here because Queen's Knight exists and by god does the new BLS work wonders here (Well... about as many wonders as BLS can make).  Isolde, which is basically in every Warrior deck now, should ALWAYS search BLS (or fucken whatever if you already have the blue brick menace in your grubby little hands) on link summon and use the equip spell to get Knuckle Knife out there. Jarngreipr is there for protection against basically most threats. Arcana Extra Joker is there to help negate things and enable a potential comeback on death (unless you get cucked by negates yourself). Tenyi is there in case the heart of the cards is a dick. Starliege for when you cuck yourself via Joker's Straight. Constellar for the rare occasion that you land on Jack's Knight and Knukle Knife. Arcana Knight Joker exists in there if you need to beat over something and Gilti-Gearfried because you are using two different Attributes and he is a good card.  So the Strategy: Face Card Fusion should 9 times out of 10 be used to get Gilti-Gearfried out with any Poker Knight (preferably from your hand) and Puppet Pawn (preferably form your deck). Then you can banisch the Pawn form your GY to get any EARTH Warrior (so basically the heroics) from your deck into your hand. Morning Star searches Envoy, Envoy searches Knuckle Knife and with him you can either go for Link or Jarngreipr and use his effect and extend play ad nauseum. BLS can be used on your second turn to get a Ritual Spell and summon him in order to STORM THE GATES. Note: Depending on the Situation you can use Advand Ritual Art instead of Super Soldier Ritual if you fancy it.  You also don't have to worry too much about getting cucked since a good handful of Poker support recycles itself with the base trio.  In conclusion: Deck is good. Play. Pls.

deck_excerpt: Final Sigma, Hey, Trunade!, Sphere Mode, Mathmech Circular
deck_description: I often win with this, you just need go 3rd or 2nd depending on if you wanna play or you wanna allowed all people in tag have a chance to play.  1- just clean opponent field tributing, use sphere, golem, kaiju if you can.  2- just clean opponent field, s/t using duster, trunade, red reboot maybe.  3- synchro summon Final Sigma using nabla, division and other level 4 monster. (Make your Synchro attack twice with nabla, divide atk of the weakest opponent monster with division effect in gv)  4- boost Final Sigma with summoning Mathmech Addition, then reduce 1 opponent monster using Mathmech subtraction.  5- Equip Nayuta Billion equip spell to Final Sigma, attack to the weakest monster on opponent field, I mean lowest attack position monster on your opponent field and send with nayuta effect Mathmech multiplication and then activate effect in grave your synchro Final Sigma should have 9000 atk now, he can make double damge and attack twice so attack weakest monster in attack position and win.  6- I am guessing you will need some basic instructions to get the final result but should find your appropriate play style by yourself, now you have the general idea of what I try to do with the deck, you just need modifi a little and make your own plays to reach the final objective what is? Of course win by Otk in tag 3vs3 using Mathmech is hard so if you can do it I'll be proud of you pal.  Anyway I accepting funny ideas of anyone and questions too

deck_excerpt: Hope you guys enjoyed that modern, fast and strong Evil Twin deck HF.
deck_description: In solidarity with Ukraine.   Russia has attacked several countries since 2000 (not much is said about it). The war in Ukraine has been going on since 2014. At this time: - Germany and France  sold weapons to Russia. This weapon is killing ukrainians now - check it out. Many countries sold Russia's military equipment using the provisions on the exemption from sanctions on contracts concluded before August 1, 2014 or ancillary contracts necessary for the implementation of such contracts, writes Investigate Europe. Many countries sold Russia's military equipment using the provisions on the exemption from sanctions on contracts concluded before August 1, 2014 or ancillary contracts necessary for the implementation of such contracts, writes Investigate Europe. / shutterstock Despite the embargo imposed on Russia after the annexation of Crimea in 2014, at least 10 EU countries sold military equipment for EUR 346 million in 2015-20-20, informs the Investigate Europe portal. The sale of arms, led by France and Germany, was possible thanks to a loophole in the sanctions. - Germany was building more pipes and pumping billions of euros into Russia. The previous pipelines ran through Ukraine, which secured them a bit, as the safety of these pipelines was of interest to Russia. What is happening now, while thousands of Ukrainians are killed, starved and is buried under the rubble: - Germany,  is against the real sanction. Germany introduces illusory sanctions on Russian banks. Sanctions on Russian banks except 2 largest Russian banks and the rest of the Russian banks make transactions through them. - The european union pays  hundreds  million € Russian for energy resources every day.  Sanctions on raw materials are still not introduced in UE. I appeals to common sense, leaders of many countries, because I have no reason to appeal to their decency. An attack on another country or maybe blowing up a few nuclear power plants in Ukraine, or maybe some other step and we are one step away from an even greater tragedy. Will you enjoy your fortune, luxury houses and yachts when the world turns into a nuclear deserts ?!   Thank also to all users yugiohpro for understanding. I know that this message is not easy, but I also know that over 90% of my deck users are adult people (maybe each of us separately and together we can also change something).   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0tnMV9EjEWw

deck_excerpt: Wanna stall you opponent to a bitter and painful Final Countdown death, well then this deck is for you.
deck_description: The strategy of this deck is pretty simple. Get your cook (Number 59: Crooked Cook) out and wait for the Final Countdown clock to tick down. While you wait for the Final Countdown, you can use the Ghost Reapers and Kaijus for clearing opponent threats. You only draw about 10 times after activating Final Countdown, so I don't expect to lose to deck out, but if you are scared of that, then just add a Marron. The Summoner Monk is probably the weirdest card in this deck, since you can't make Crooked Cook with him and the Right-Hand Shark, but then it is a good thing Buzzsaw Shark is a Level 4. Just summon Monk, summon Buzzsaw Shark from deck, make Almiraj with the Monk, tribute that monster of for it's effect, (which does nothing this time) then summon Right-Hand Shark and lastly the Cook. Another thing to note about this deck is, it doesn't care about Maxx "C", or to be more precise does a Maxx "C" not affect this deck's gameplan at all. The opponent can get 4 free draws, and we won't care. Ash Blossom and Effect Veiler are the big hand trap counters to this deck, so hit them with Called By The Grave and Crossout Designator. As for the Extra Deck. Well, just fill it up with the cards you think will counter you. You only need 1-3 Crooked Cooks, and 1-2 Salamangreat Almirajs. The rest of the space can be used to whatever.  As for the weaknesses for this deck. There are a lot, but bricking is happily not one of them. (the deck has 13 cards that lead to cook, so that gives you a 10% chance of bricking) Kaijus are the biggest counter to this deck. A single Kaiju will make you forfeit, since you have no counter to it. Piercing and direct attacks are another big one, but the Ghost Reapers and Kaijus should help somewhat with those.  As for the matchups, we have Toons, Prank Kids and Blue-Eyes Max builds as the worst. The only thing stopping a Blue-Eyes Chaos Max Dragon in this deck is a Kaiju, but you will still take 7600 HP damage from a single attack, so you will probably be long dead before being able to use the Kaiju. On the other hand, does some decks not have a single out for this deck. I am talking about Drytron, Adamancipators, Virtual World esc. on the pretext that you are going first.

deck_excerpt: Dragoon Turbo As It Was Meant To Be
deck_description: Known as Black Magician in Japan, this classic card that debuted in LoB has had an entire archetype built around it, and it still gets support to this day. However, some of its cards are extremely expensive, like Dragoon is $120+ per copy, Magicians' Souls is $50+ per copy, and Soul Servant is $45+ per copy, making this deck very costly.  Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon is a card that was meant to be support for the Dark Magician and Red-Eyes archetypes, but ended up being a staple shoved in every deck. 1-2x Dark Magician and Red-Eyes Black Dragon, 1-2x Red-Eyes Fusion, and a Verte Anaconda was put in every deck that could facilitate it. But if you play a Dark Magician or Red-Eyes deck, shoving the other in the deck when you're already playing one makes deckbuilding a lot easier.  For the decklist, we have a Dark Magician package of 3x Dark Magician, 2x Apprentice Illusion Magician, 2x DMG, 3x Rod, 3x Souls, 2x Illusion of Chaos, 3x Circle, 1x Timaeus, 2x Secrets, 3x Servant, 2x Eternal Soul, 2x DM Dragon Knight, 2x The Dark Magicians, and 2x DMG Dragon Knight. For our Dragoon package, we have 2x Red-Eyes B. Dragon, 2x Red-Eyes Fusion, 3x Dragoon, and 1x Verte Anaconda. For the rest of the deck, we have 3x Ash Blossom, 2x Ghost Belle, and 2x Veiler for Handtraps, 2x Avarice, and 1x Called by, and for the rest of the Extra Deck, 1x Chengying, 1x Hot Red Dragon Archfiend Abyss, 1x Borreload Savage, 1x Chaos Ruler, and 1x Underworld Goddess.

Known as Black Magician in Japan, this classic card that debuted in LoB has had an entire archetype built around it, and it still gets support to this day. However, some of its cards are extremely expensive, like Dragoon is $120+ per copy, Magicians' Souls is $50+ per copy, and Soul Servant is $45+ per copy, making this deck very costly.  Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon is a card that was meant to be support for the Dark Magician and Red-Eyes archetypes, but ended up being a staple shoved in every deck. 1-2x Dark Magician and Red-Eyes Black Dragon, 1-2x Red-Eyes Fusion, and a Verte Anaconda, which is now banned, was put in every deck that could facilitate it. But if you play a Dark Magician or Red-Eyes deck, shoving the other in the deck when you're already playing one makes deckbuilding a lot easier.  For the decklist, we have a Dark Magician package of 3x Dark Magician, 1x DMG, 3x Rod, 3x Souls, 2x Illusion of Chaos, 3x Circle, 1x Timaeus, 2x Secrets, 3x Servant, 2x Eternal Soul, 2x DM Dragon Knight, 2x The Dark Magicians, and 2x DMG Dragon Knight. For our Dragoon package, we have 2x Red-Eyes B. Dragon, 2x Red-Eyes Fusion, and 3x Dragoon. For the rest of the deck, we have 3x Ash Blossom, 2x Ghost Belle, 3x Maxx C, and 2x Veiler for Handtraps, 1x Avarice, and 1x Called by, and for the rest of the Extra Deck, 1x Chengying, 1x Baronne, 1x Hot Red Dragon Archfiend Abyss, 1x Borreload Savage, 1x Chaos Ruler, and 1x Underworld Goddess.

deck_excerpt: A basic Exodia deck for a casual format
deck_description: Before getting into the rules let me just say this format is not meant to go "try hard" and build the most optimal competitive deck to face off against your opponent. The idea of this format is to keep it casual and run those "bad" Knights of Atlantis, Chazz (Ojama/Armed Dragon/VWXYZ), God Cards and many other casual decks. Basically approach this format as if you're playing on the playground and not at a local game shop for a tournament.  This format was also designed to be used with the Duel Disk toys licensed by Konami. YOU DO NOT NEED A DUEL DISK TO PLAY THIS FORMAT.  Due to this format being made with the Duel Disks in mind there are rules in line limiting certain cards that can't be used with a Duel Disk.  1-Other than the following rules, all other official TCG rules apply.  2-Due to this being made for a Duel Disk XYZ, PENDULUMS, and LINK MONSTERS ARE BANNED!  3- All cards are limited to 1 copy per deck EXCEPT for cards on this list, you can play 3 of anything on this list: https://tinyurl.com/AnimeFormatExceptions  4) Other than Xyz, Pendelum and Links no other cards are banned, but to balance Gameplay there is a <#907791420469956678> You can only have 3 Cards on the A Tier List 5 Cards on the B Tier List 10 Cards on the C Tier List In your deck. https://tinyurl.com/FormatTierList  5)You can Normal Summon in face up defense like the Anime.  6) You can have up to 20 cards in the Extra Deck.  You can find the full community here: https://discord.com/invite/gGmy52ZEny

Gren Maju Da Eiza is a Level 3 Fire Fiend monster with the effect, this card's ATK and DEF are equal to the number of your banished cards x 400, and has become the centerpiece of an archetype that focuses on banishing your own cards. It makes use of cards that are supposed to use the effect of banishing your own cards as cost and turns it to their own advantage, using enablers such as Pot of Desires, Gizmek Orochi, Eater of Millions, and Topologic Zeroboros.  For the decklist, we have a Gren Maju package of 3x Gren Maju, 3x Eater, 3x Orochi, and 1x Desires(if it wasn't Limited, we would be playing 3). We also have moderate Kaiju package of 2x Dogoran, 2x Gadarla, 3x Gameciel, and 3x Interrupted Kaiju Slumber. For the rest of the Main Deck, we have 3x Ash Blossom, 2x Ghost Belle, 3x Maxx C, and 2x Veiler for Handtraps, 3x Alpha, 1x Avarice, 2x Trade-In, 2x Called by, and 2x Twisters, and for the Extra Deck, we have 1x Seven Sins, 1x Zeus, 1x Pain Gainer, 2x Draglubion, 1x Hope Harbinger, 1x Lancelot, 2x Numeron Dragon, 1x BLS Link, 1x Zeroboros, 1x Underworld Goddess, 1x Accesscode, 1x Knightmare Unicorn, and 1x Masquerena

deck_excerpt: Burn + Fight + live + try hard ( op Future meta deck )
deck_description: hello, everyone, it's Lohamora again, today we heading into the Albaz deck profile which is not pure it also has some OCG cards which when they become TCG, the deck will be over than OP. please card explanation and we don't use the Edge brick engine ( I know what you think but Aggro decks are good in their own way ). I even proved Youtubers  (I kinda needed to say that let's head into card explanation)  <hr />  MONSTER CARDS  1x Albion, the shrouded dragon: you can send any branded from deck or hand to GY to use these cards affect most of the time we send branded retribution to add branded spell/trap from GY to our hand, but you can also send branded opening to protect your fusion monsters, one of the important effects of this card is if you send branded card from your hand you can SP this card from hand or GY and it will treat as fallen of Albaz which is really becoming handi the times you summon Albion and dragoon you can sp this card and go into Alba-Lenatus and in end phase add or set branded spell/traps which in this kinda case I set branded separation.  1x: Ad Libitun of Despia: if you use this card for the fusion summon you can sp 1Despai or 1 fusion monster which is banished or in GY which is broken.  The reason for not using Dramature of Despia is that the card only gives you free negate which is not useful 60% time so logic says it needs to get removed but if you are a new Albaz player you need to play Dramature instead of Ad libitum ( this is for starters only )  3x Aluber the jester of Despia: the only thing gonna say about this card is you can't use both effects at the same turn so be careful full you can also sp this card by the effect of branded opening to add any branded spell/trap from deck to your hand.  2x Fallen of Albaz: people usually say 2 copies are extenders yes it's actually is but not for starters if you are a starter play 3 copies of Albaz, if this card is ns or sp you can use only this card and cards your opponent controls for fusion summoning, if you dealing with dragon boards you only need to set this card and summon Alba-Lenatus :)  2x the Springans Kitt: this card at 2 copies is all enough ( you can't do anything with 1 copy ), one of the important effects of this card is you can even branded spell/trap which is banished or in GY which makes this card more OP but you have to replace one card from hand to your deck ( fair enough cost ), well after you used branded retribution and kinda wast all fallen of Albaz monsters in extra you gonna add branded retribution by kitt's effect to bring those resources back.  1X incredible Ecclesia: this card can be free to waste your opponent negates also you can add this card from GY to hand if a fusion monster is sent to GY. basically, one copy is needed ( we don't want to make Albaz angry XD)  1x goddess with the third eye: why not another famous card reason is our field spell if fairy leaves the field you get to sp level 8 or higher fusions from GY, you might say but this card is getting banished at the End, yes but you sp with branded separation.  1x Tri-brigade Mercouier: the only thing that I'm going to say is if you banish this card with Albion you can add one card list fallen of Albaz.  2x Despian Tragedy: if this card is sent to GY or banish you can add one Despia monster to your hand, I prefer to send this card to GY, cuz this card sets you branded spell/trap from GY, also sometimes when you have enough back up you don't need to use this card effect when you sent to GY, cuz in that case if you discard the branded card you can set it that turn ( you can only use one of the effects of this card ).  Break time.....  <hr />  2x Ash  1x droll 2x Ghost belle ( this deck can use a max 8 hand traps) .it's up to you, playing more hand traps doesn't make a player better.  <hr />  SPELL CARDS  3x branded fusion: the only card you might want to see in hand it also locks you into fusions.  3x Branded Opening: discard 1 card and sp one Despia monster or add it to your hand, it also locks you into fusions.  1x Despia, the theater of Branded: fusion summon by using monsters on the field or hand you can't fusion summon lower than level 8.  1x Branded in Red + 1x Branded in white: these 2 together work amazing 2 branded in red doesn't make you play better ( being quick play spell isn't good at 100% times ), sometimes branded in white is more needed than the Red one.  1x Branded lost: this card is broken, if you fusion summon you can add one card that lists fallen of Albaz, also fusion monsters can not be targeted it ( basically the reason why Titaniklad is not in the extra deck )  1x Foolish Burial: you can send Tragedy to GY, and you know the rest, the reason why we playing 2 Tragedy is cuz sometimes you draw the only one you have but the tragedy at 2 is all enough.  2x Dark ruler no more + 1x droplet: you asking why 2 rulers and 1 droplet well you will understand if you face with Floowanereeze.  2x Super poly: why not 3 due we got our 3rd super poly and it is Branded Exile.  1x Called by grave + 1x Crossout  <hr />  TRAP CARDS  1x Branded Separation: this card is the most OP card in the deck, you can tribute one fusion monster or 1 fallen of Albaz fusion monster and sp 2 cards from both players banished zone or GY to your field ( imagine you tribute Mirror jade after you used and sp Albaz and another Mirror jade and you can Sp free card from opponent GY < Majestic dragon anyone, totally awesome anyone > yup this card is OP ).  1x Branded Exile: sp 1 Despian monster or 1 fusion monster and fusion summon by using both fields, fusion Materials will get banished ( time to banish Destiny HERO plasma or Dark Law XD ).  1x Branded Retribution: banish this card from GY, add one branded card from GY to hand, and also it's back when you wasted your resources ( explained in Albion the shrouded dragon and the Springans Kitt ).  Break time.....  <hr />  EXTRA DECK  1x Chimera: draw and pop what is better than this ( be targetable part since we don't have real poly is sad YOLO ).  1x Red-eyes Dark Dragoon: we all know this card so  2xMirror jade: you can only control 1 mirror jade on the field.  1x Starving Venom fusion: people forget this card's second effect and still wonder why you can target one level 5 or higher copy the effect which is really hard to deal with you copy Baronne if they negate their board goes bye-bye.  1x Predaplant Dragostapelia: free negate since we playing <there can be only one>.  1x Lubellion the searing dragon: send any dark monster with Albaz, like Tragedy or Albion the shrouded dragon, and sp this and sp one level 8 or lower fusion monster.  1x Alba-Lenatus the abyss dragon: deck_excerpt: Fill the GY with Reptiles and setup Rise of the Snake Deity, while it's not win condition of this deck it still is fun when it works.
deck_description: Ideally you'd want to go 1st and do the following:  Opening hand with Ogdoadics that send to GY, but Snake Rain is best.  Use Snake Rain or Ogdoadic monsters to send each other to GY.  Keurse must be sent to the GY at all costs as it's main combo starter. Send it from Deck with Nauya or Rain or from hand with Ramifications, Rain or Zohah.  Here is how it goes with just Nunu and any other Reptile in your hand (Ipiria, Vennominon, Medusa...) and opponent doesn't open handtrap.  Use Nunu to send Zohah, and retrieve it by discarding anything (better if it's Reptile).  Summon King of the Feral Imps with Nunu and Zohah.  Search for Nauya  if you didn't have it in your hand to send Keurse to the GY if its not there already or for Nunu to fill GY with other Reptiles so you have 5 with different names.  Keurse sends King of Feral Imp to GY and revives Nauya which searches Lily.  Lily sends Reptilianne Coatl and revives it.  Synchro Summon Geomathmech Magma then Synchro Summon Phantasmal Lord Ultimitl Bishbaalkin in Extra Monster Zone.  Use effect to Summon tokens on both sides.  Link Summon Reprodocus using Synchro and 1 Token that's either in center or far left or far right monster zone.  Reprodocus must point to token on your side from either Extra Monster Zone you summon it to.  Use effect and declare change type to Reptile.  Use 2 tokens to summon Reptilianne Echidna under Reprodocus.  Use last 2 tokens to summon I:P Masquerena next to Echidna.  Use Reprodocus and Masquerena to Summon Avramax to the extra monster zone.  Search 5 with Echidna, Scylla, Nyamini, Coatl, Lamia and Black Mamba.  Use Coatl to SS itself and Lamia, Scylla and Nyamini.  Link away Echidna and Nyamini into Cosmic Slicer Zer'oll.  Revive Nyamini.  Synchro Summon Hydra with Coatl and Nyamini and draw 5 cards.  Synchro Summon Melusine with Hydra and Lamia.  Special Summon Black Mamba.  Link Summon Alien Shocktrooper with Mamba and Scylla.  Set traps you got from draws, or activate Ogdoadic Continious Spell if you got it.  If you got Arasia and have Vennominon in your GY, SS Arasia and equip Vennominon.  With Trap Trick, Heavy Storm Duster or opponent's S/T Removal you can easily summon Vennominaga the following turn, protected by Avramax and Alien Links that can stun, combine it with Melusine and Recoil and your opponent will watch as their monsters change sides or as their ATK turns to 0.  Even if opponent uses handtrap and stops your combo you can still make Melusine and defend yourself with traps for a turn so you have enough Reptiles in GY for Vennominon to sweep.

deck_excerpt: Goal is to turbo out beyond the pendulum and setup a decent board using creative combos.
deck_description: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vk_vZgvwW4g&ab_channel=Chris  Goal is to turbo out beyond the pendulum and setup a decent board using creative combos.  The deck has access to level 6-10 synchros as well as ranks 3-7, and links 2+.     Turbo Cards (cards that get you to a link 2 without pendulum summoning):  Tour Guide (is a one card beyond by bringing out archfiend eccentrick)  Saambell (deck runs a lot of level 3 pendulums which allows it to summon itself from scales)  Curtain Raiser (summons from scale if you control no monsters)  Chronograph (generic scale 8 that can summon timegazer from deck)  Me-Psy-Ya (can special summon from hand and a generic 0 scale)     Combo Cards:  Harmonizing Magician (usual search off beyond and searches another tuner or level 3)  Halqifibrax (gets you another tuner or link fodder for i:p masquerena)  i:p masquerena (will let you go into a link 3 or 4, like avramax, on the opponents turn)  Igknight Reload (helps find specific pendulums by putting back the ones you don't need)     Important thing to note is that your zones will matter so be careful with your monster placement.  An average board will end on a level 7 or 8 synchro with beyond, i:p, and halq.  Satellite Warrior can be made with a level 5 dragster(after a negate activation) and a wonder magician made with halq or with a level 8 synchro and formula synchron made with halq.

deck_excerpt: A modern take on a Watt deck.
deck_description:
This is not some washed-up Watt deck from 2011; this is a blind-second OTK deck that can win vs some of the most oppressive board states in modern Yugioh. Either inflict 8000 damage with Watts or break the board enough to get a Mystic Mine out. This deck can easily OTK without removing Mystic Mine from the field, and Mystic Mine can allow you to use the high-risk Left Arm Offering. 3 card OTKs:
  • Interrupted Kaiju Slumber + Honest/Leeching The Light/Instant Fusion + Wattsquirrel/Wattwoodpecker/Wattrain
4 card OTKs:
  • Kaiju + Wattsquirrel/Wattwoodpecker + Leeching The Light + Wattkey/Wattrain
The deck is also fairly consistent thanks to Small World and Mystic Mine-protected Left Arm Offering. The side deck is to switch strategies into a going first deck. The goal is to get out Zap Mustung, Mystic Mine, and Ojama Trio. Lock your opponent out of attacking, monster effects, and special summoning. Wattchimera is the win condition here.

deck_excerpt: A Cyber Dragon Deck that is focused on OTKs with the fusions, but it can also use the XYZ-monsters to do some things turn 1. Made before the Cyberdark
deck_description:
Made before the Cyberdark Structure Deck was released in Master Duel. Some explanaitions for some card choices:
  • Gizmek Yata: Can be specialed over Core, gives you an additional normal summon and is a material for Nova. Searchable via Repair Plant.
  • Power Bond: Makes OTKs easier and quicker. Stronger with the Cyberdark support.
  • Maxx "C": Strongest card in the game, I hate it, why is it legal in Master Duel.
  • Denko Sekka: I played against too many Floodgate/Eldlich Decks. Completely shuts them down and allows you to dou your combo undisturbed by backrow cards.
  • Called by the Grave: Saves you from handtraps and Eldlich.
  • Forbidden Droplet: Insane boardbreaker/OTK-enabler, activates Herz
  • Imperm: Great handtrap and useful even if going first.
  • Cyber Eternity Dragon: Occasionaly useful. A great wall.
  • Invoked Mechaba: A target for Nova.
  • Artifact Durendal: A good Rank 5 XYZ. Mostly used if you go first.
  • Constellar Pleiades: A great Rank 5 XYZ. Useful going first or second.
  • AA-ZEUS: Insane Card, can be recycled with Repair Plant
Some general tactics: Going first: On a good day you make Infinity and pass. On a great day you have at least one hand trap in reserve. On an even greater day you can also make Pleiades/Durendal. Going second:
  • Nova is good for extending by reviving one Cyber Dragon and can occasionally also go for game. It also deters Nibiru.
  • Infinity protects your plays from enemy interruption and can clean the board a bit.
  • Rampage Dragon is your main OTK enabler. It can attack up to 3 times via it's effect, it removes enemy backrow and it can be buffed by Sieger.
  • Fortress/Megafleet are used to clean up the opponents board.
  • Sieger is used to power up Rampage Dragon. You can also increase your Nova, run over a defense position monster with Sieger and then hit the opponent for 4200.
Here is a link to the first Decklist: https://ygoprodeck.com/cyber-dragons-19/
https://youtu.be/_PFkZq9g920

deck_excerpt: A modern take on a Watt deck.
deck_description:
This is not some washed up Watt deck from 2011; this deck can win vs some of the most oppressive strategies in modern Yugioh. Win Conditions:
  • Tsukumo Slash - Lower your lifepoints in a controlled fashion with Shining Angel / Wattdragonfly and then bring out an insane Tsukumo Slash boosted Wattaildragon. Action Magic - Full Turn or Kaijus will help finish the job.
  • Inferno Tempest - Banish all monsters from the decks + 20 additional cards thanks to Necroface and Nyannyan. Thunder Dragonhawk is included here to chain block this and potentially shuffle Necroface(s) that you drew.
  • Mystic Mine - Wattchimera can seal the game vs an opponent that can't link away enough monsters.
The extra deck is really only used to link into monsters with <300 attack. Baba Barber is especially useful to link away a Kaiju + Necroface. The side deck is something I'm still experimenting with. The goal here is to go first and get Wattdragonfly, Universal Adapter, and Thunder Dragon's Hundred Thunders out. Survive. Then OTK with 3-4 Wattgiraffe/Wattcobras with boosted attack values.

deck_excerpt: Solid Tier 2 deck that most players would be able to afford (expensive cards can be swapped out) that can compete with the top decks of the format.
deck_description: This is the deck I topped and earned my first National Invitation with (48th/48th place) at the Philadelphia regional this past weekend. On the play, the deck aims to set up a board with varied forms of interaction and sticky monsters to use to beat your opponent down on the crack back. On the draw, it can pivot with different forms of removal to push through boards and either swing over your opponents' monsters or easily access Zeus to wipe the board and combo in MP2. D/D/D is a high ceiling combo deck that can pivot between an aggressive playstyle and a control gameplan depending on what the situation calls for.  Overall a really fun deck that, with enough practice, any player can master and do well with. Any questions, comments or concerns you can msg me on discord @ drop_the_mike04#3517 :).

deck_excerpt: An Exodia deck for Nightmare Troubadour (2005).
deck_description: Note that Magical Stone Excavation is localized as Excavation of Mage Stones and Spellbook Organization is localized as Pigeonholing Books of Spell.  This deck is intended for the 2005 DS game, Nightmare Troubadour. It's mostly for me to plan out what cards I want before I get them, so be advised that this is largely untested. The hope is that RML has enough spell fodder to get plusses. Thunder dragon is there to thin out the deck, although it might be prudent to replace him with Foolish Burial to get the Exodia pieces out of the way (you can get them back to the hand using Dark Factory and Monster Reincarnation). On the other hand, he's a great target for Card Destruction, so maybe not? Toon Alligator is there so that you can use all three Contents instead of awkwardly having one left over but he might end up being a brick in the hand. The rest should be pretty self-explanatory.

deck_excerpt: Better grind game than Tony Hawk
deck_description: Since it has been my favorite deck since release I've decided to share it with you.  I am playing them with the Symphonic Warrior engine, Genex Undine and a focus on revivability.  The Symphonic Warriors grant you an additional normal summon and a free level 5 machine type monster which you can use with Sulfefnir to go into Infinity. The "Garnet" itself ain't that much of a brick if you draw it, since tribute summoning him gets you the additional normal summon aswell. Try to get him into the grave instead of the extra deck afterwards if you can because you can revive him with the smaller Symphonic Warrior and get the effect again.  I also play Genex Undine since the mill from the deck is a cost and cannot be negated. Genex Controller can become a hard brick sometimes.  I am only playing 1 Halqi even though he is unlimited in TCG because I basically have 5 revives for him from which I can search 3. Because of Halqi I also play T.G. Wonder Magician who's an MST on summon and can also synchro summon on opponent's turn.  I have played Sulfefnir at 3 for the longest time and have just been experimenting with 2 for a few weeks. So far I do not think I have lost any consistency but instead have less dead cards in grave/hand.  Playing 6 handtraps can be bricky at times but you kind of have to play at least a few in the current state of the game.  The Ice-Bound God is a better Lost Wind in this deck.  Unchained Abomination just works perfectly.  Dragite or Dawn Dragster should always be on your field. Even better if you have an Infinity on their side.     If you want to start playing this deck I cannot recommend enough to only us the non-tuners field effect if you really have to since it locks you into only Synchro machine type monsters.     All in all I can really recommend this deck to anyone playing on locals-level. It is fairly consistent, has a great recovery and it's not a helmet deck, so you gotta use your brain.

deck_excerpt: This is a Gren Maju deck that has been brewed for Goat Format. The deck is centred around Banisher of Light along who keep the graveyard empty and the
deck_description: This is a Gren Maju deck in Goat format. It is built around the card Banisher of the Light which allows you to cultivate a game state where your graveyard empty and your exile zone is full. This will unlock a number of powerful cards which otherwise don't see play including Chaos Greed and Chaos End. When things are going well, this deck will have the best card draw in the format. We are also running Bazoo and Chaosrider to keep the bin clear and maintain board presence until you are ready to swing in for game with Gren Maju. Like all Gren Maju decks this is a glass cannon that is easily disrupted in a control heavy format, but when it wins it will be in a dramatic explosive style.

Hi, Grayewick the Fusionist here, back with one of my most hated decks ever made by Konami and one of the most mind-numbing decks to play, Swordsoul... and Tenyi. Except Tenyis are cool, fuck Swordsoul though. "Why play this deck?" If you're gonna ask me personally, I wouldn't recommend playing this to anyone because of despite how much this archetype have broken their own summoning mechanic - much like Drytrons Ritual Summoning using Levels, Zoodiacs Xyz summoning without using monsters of the same Level, and Tri-Brigades cheating out their Link monsters - by SYNCHRO SUMMONING WITH TOKENS AS TUNERS, OF WHICH THEIR STARTERS AND EXTENDERS ALL COULD DO, I cannot fucking STAND how much they could get away with that bullshit, but Fusion archetypes are still getting backlash for receiving their own Shaddoll Fusion because apparently, "it's too convenient", but the former cases were not. I just really want to have an excuse to rant about this bland-ass, absolute one tone taste of a deck. I've never seen a deck that's as easier to build as Swordsoul. Anyway, the list. Main Deck: Disclaimer: I'll only explain the archetypal cards because I really don't like talking about this deck. I've really tried not falling asleep as I was typing all of these so, yeah. I might make a few exceptions along the way though, if I find something that's ACTUALLY interesting. Monsters • Let's tune with tokens because, fuck it why not? - Nothing much in-depth to talk about this one, because honestly there's really not much depth in playing Swordsoul. If you felt insulted, good. I don't care.
  1. Swordsoul of Mo Ye - Insert Important Playlist. Your main starter. Normal/Special Summon her, reveal a "Swordsoul" card or a Wyrm monster from your hand to make a token tuner, then Synchro 8... that's really it. I guess she also draws you a card when used as Synchro Material but that's only relevant for chain blocking Chi Xiao, your opponent's never gonna Ash it. If they did, they're either someone who hasn't played Yu-Gi-Oh in a long time, or they're an idiot.
  2. Swordsoul of Taia - Your main extender. Ignition effect to banish a "Swordsoul" card or a Wyrm monster in your GY to summon a token tuner, you already know how this goes. If he's sent to the GY as Synchro Material, he Foolish Burials a "Swordsoul" card or a Wyrm monster from the Deck.
  3. Swordsoul Strategist Longyuan - Your secondary starter. He makes Baronne De Fleur. That's really all there is to know about him. I guess he also burns your opponent when used as Synchro Material but who fucking cares.
Spells
  1. Swordsoul Emergence - Used to search any "Swordsoul" starter/extender, or to search Archnemeses Protos.
  2. Swordsoul Sacred Summit - Pretty much just an archetypal Monster Reborn. I mean, it targets so at least it's very easy to interrupt.
  3. Crossout Designator - Just because this deck has room for it.
Traps
  1. Swordsoul Blackout - Archetypal Icarus Attack, but it destroys your Wyrm monster instead of tributing for cost.
  2. Infinite Impermanence - Just because this deck has room for it. Also Crossout target.
Then the DPE engine. It's also quite funny that they've pre-hit Fusion Destiny to 2 but yeah who cares lol, it's a Verte pay-off. Extra Deck: • Swordsoul Grandmaster Chixiao - Synchro this to search any "Swordsoul" card you need. Usually made with Mo Ye anyway, so it's either Longyuan for Baronne or Emergence for Protos. It's also has an Infinite Impermanence effect by banishing a "Swordsoul" card or a Wyrm monster in your GY. • Baronne De Fleur - Negate. Yup. • Swordsoul Supreme Sovereign - Chengying - Archetypal generic Level 10 Synchro. A beat stick with a banishing interruption, basically just a better Berserker of the Tenyi, which this deck also can play. • Crimson Blader - The terror of the Dragon Ruler format. Final Thoughts: As you can see, I'm not very enthusiastic about this deck. No disrespect if you like it (but taking it that way is very much welcome), but almost all players that play Drytron, Zoodiacs, Tri-Brigade, and Swordsoul that I've met are all sweaty tryhards who think they're so good at the game just by association of piloting the said decks. I just don't enjoy decks that does not make me want to think. It's one of those decks that I can play on a bad day and still win because it just plays itself, much like the other three. Play it if you want, I could not care any less. As per usual, if you have any questions or thoughts, feel free to express them down in the comments and I'll respond to them as soon as I possibly can (I mean in this case, I'd rather not but I still do enjoy interacting with you guys so, yeah. Questions about anything that isn't related to this list is also very much welcome.).

deck_excerpt: Cómo usar el deck. / How to use the deck.
deck_description:
Si vas primero:
  • Enviar las piedras al cementerio.
  • Dejar en el campo un Crystron Halqifibrax.
  • Invocar primero un Blue-Eyes White Dragon.
  • Invocar al Blue-Eyes Abyss Dragon y añadir una Polymerization o Chaos Form, luego añades el monstruo ritual.
En el turno del adversario, usa Crystron Halqifibrax para invocar a Formula Synchron y luego usar su efecto para invocar a Baronne de Fleur.
If you go first:
  • Send the stones to the GY.
  • Summon Crystron Halqifibrax.
  • Summon Blue-Eyes White Dragon.
  • Summon Blue-Eyes Abyss Dragon and add Polymerization o Chaos Form, then add the ritual monster.
In your opponent´s turn, use Crystron Halqifibrax to summon Formula Synchron, then use its effect to summon Baronne de Fleur.

deck_excerpt: Despia Darklord with very Strong Burn using Athena (up to 10k LP with ideal hand)
deck_description:
Burn deck using Athena.

Ideal Combo: Valhalla + Athena + Venus (+ Maybe Aluber or Branded Opening)
  1. Special Summon Athena with Valhalla
  2. Normal Summon Venus
  3. Activate Venus effect x2
  4. Use two Balls to summon Condemned Darklord
  5. a. Activate Condemned Darklord Effect, discard any card other than Ball (Darklord Superbia if in Hand), add Superbia to Hand b. Summon 3rd Ball.
  6. Summon Parshath with Ball + Condemned
  7. Activate Parshath (Discard Superbia, Add Sanctum to Hand)
  8. Activate and use Sanctum. Add 1 Ball 1 Condemned 1 Fairy back into the deck (keep 1 Superbia in grave to keep the combo going)
  9. Activate Venus and summon 1 Ball.
  10. If you have Superbia + 1 Fairy in graveyard, Activate Athena, Send 1 Fairy to the grave, Summon Superbia, activate Superbia's when effect (can miss timing if used in other chains) Summon 1 other Fairy from grave to the Field (Maybe Aluber).
  11. If you don't have a Fairy in Hand, summon Apollousa or Accescode with Parshath and 1 Ball or whatever you deem smart, then continue from 13.
  12. If you have a Fairy in Hand, Trigger Parshath effect. Banish 1 Ball, Special summon 1 Fairy from your Hand. (Aluber if you are Lucky)
  13. If you can summon Aluber or Have Theater in hand: follow 14 a.) Summon Apollousa or Underworld Goddess, maybe with Masquerena or whatever the situation needs. Condemned is good too if you are low on LP and have to pass. b.) If your opponent is somehow still alive ( you have used Athena's effect a total of 10 - 12 Times by now (6000-7200LP Effect Damage) You can summon Condemned Darklord Twice and then Apollousa (keep Athena on the field and deal 3x600 additional damage for game.
  14.  Summon Condemned with Athena + Parshath. (need 3 Dark Fairy)
  15. Activate Theater (Maybe searched with Aluber or Branded Opening at the end of the combo)
  16. Activate Theater and Summon The First Darklord (Don't Chain) TF Darklord
  17. Activate TFD Summon Superbia, Activate Superbia, Summon Athena.
  18. Activate Athena, Send Superbia, Summon (same) Superbia, Activate Superbia, Summon Fairy.
  19. Keep up and combo if you can, or Pass turn. You have dealt an additional 2x 600 Damage. + 600 If you can summon Another fairy from the Extra Deck using TFD and Superbia. Otherwise Pass Turn with TFD and Athena (Send Superbia + Random Fairy to grave for a Link (so you can chain TFD and Superbia in the next Turn.) (Branded Opening only allows you to fusion summon from the extra deck for the rest of the turn)
  20. Make sure to only Summon Superbia with TFD after a chain has already been resolved, that means; If your opponent Summons without triggering an effect, if opponent goes from Main Phase to Battle Phase or End Phase (TFD can only be activated during the Main Phase)
  Notes:
  • If you don't have Valhalla, Venus or Athena in Hand, you can usually still do normal Despia or Darklord combos.
  • Venus + 1 discard can Link Climb to Link-5
  • Venus is immune to Ash blossom (YGO players don't read) but an Imperm or Veiler may hard brick you if you don't have Branded Spells in Hand. Maybe try to bait out the Ash? If you use Ixchel's effect and discard her + a Darklord you won't be able to full combo if you get Ash'd or Called by'd but your Condemned or Parshath won't be Ash'd anymore.
  • It's almost impossible to Hard Brick unless you pull 2 Shine Balls, but even pulling 1 Shine ball is super annoying as you lose 1+ search.
  • Even if you can't pull of the Athena Combo, you can likely Despia-Darklord OTK, or Defend yourself with Theater and Quaeritis. Since Despia Darklord is very Strong.
  • If you can summon TFD early and Have Theater + another Fairy on field, you will be able to overcome Nibiru.
  • If you have TFD on Field, your opponent can't target Fairies with card effects (Apollousa is a fairy too)
  • Athena's 2nd effect can be used multiple times in the same turn as long as she leaves the field between activations.
  • Add Archlord Kristya if you want Stun
If you play Master Duel, You can add: Diviner of the Herald, Eva (Banned in TCG), Trias Hierarchia, Angel O1 and Darklord Morningstar for a 1 card combo if you top deck Diviner. Summon Diviner, Send Trias, Tribute Diviner for Trias, Summon Eva, Summon Condemned Darklord. Add Angel O1 with Eva effect. Activate Condemned, Add Morningstar, Special Summon Angel O1, Tribute Summon Morningstar with graveyard or Field (Field if Opponent has more than 4 effect Monsters. Use Morningstar Effects for OTK if going second. Decklist Monster: 3x Mystical Shine Ball 3x Darklord Ixchel 2x Dramaturge of Despia 2x Darklord Superbia 3x Athena 3x Aluber the Jester of Despia 3x Indulged Darklord 3x The Agent of Creation - Venus 1x Darklord Ukoback 2x Despian Tragedy Spell: 1x The Sanctum of Parshath 2x Valhalla, Hall of the Fallen 3x Despia, Theater of the Branded 3x Banishment of the Darklords 2x Darklord Contact 1x Monster Reborn 3x Branded Opening Extra: 2x The First Darklord 1x Despian Proskenion 1x Starving Venom Fusion Dragon 1x Despian Quaeritis 1x Masquerade the Blazing Dragon 1x Underworld Goddess of the Closed World 1x Celestial Knightlord Parshath 1x Accesscode Talker 1x Knightmare Unicorn 3x Condemned Darklord 1x I:P Masquerena 1x Apollousa, Bow of the Goddess Side: 1x Trias Hierarchia 3x Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring 3x Diviner of the Herald 1x Maxx "C" 1x Eva 1x Angel O1 1x Droll & Lock Bird 1x Mudragon of the Swamp 1x Called by the Grave 2x Super Polymerization

deck_excerpt: A Pure Shaddolls list for the Fusion Festival ft. Magistus, DPE
deck_description:
Hi, Grayewick the Fusionist here, back with another Shaddolls list but this time, one that is modified to fit the upcoming Fusion Festival in Master Duel and are also updated to utilize the new splashable (NOT GENERIC) boss monster, Destiny HERO - Destroyer Phoenix Enforcer. "Why play this deck?" Well first of all, it's an easy choice. It makes sense, it has a strong match up against combo decks in general because of its boss monsters, and it can be played either aggressively with going second cards or defensively with trap cards. It's a versatile deck that can very much function well without relying on hand traps for coverage, and can abuse one of the most powerful board breaking tools in Yu-Gi-Oh that is almost exclusively used by Fusion strategies, Super Polymerization. Anyway, the list. Main Deck: • The Dolls - Their ratios might be a bit stranger than usual but I can somehow explain why. I had to cut space with Wendi and Squamata to make room for 2 copies of Mathematician. This puts the deck in a position where it has just enough main starter materials as to not easily run out of them and still be able to go through the regular Shaddoll combo lines and still be able to fulfill the Rule of 5 (which is basically just having access to 5 Normal Summon starters in the deck), so what I've decided to play only 2 copies of both starter Shaddolls that of which I've already mentioned and only one of each utility Shaddoll monsters. And their main uses are:
  1. Shaddoll Beast - For draw power.
  2. Shaddoll Dragon - For Spell/Trap removal.
  3. Nehshaddoll Genius - For shutting down an opponent's monster for the duration of the turn. It having a different Attribute is also occasionally relevant.
  4. Shaddoll Hound - For recovery.
  5. Shaddoll Hedgehog - For searching.
  6. Qadshaddoll Keios - Only really relevant because of its different Attribute, being a LIGHT monster, as well as being a "Shaddoll" monster itself. Its Flip effect do come up from though very rarely, but it's better to have than not.
  7. Shaddoll Falco - For your grind game loops with Ariel and Hound.
• Magistus, the engine of choice - The reasoning behind this is actually simpler, and that's also why I personally think this is one of if not the best version of Shaddolls that you can play in Master Duel's Fusion Festival, contending Invoked, and I'll be discussing more of it in-depth individually.
  1. Rilliona, the Magistus of Verre - The superior Normal Summon for a generic Fusion engine, if you just want to play Pure Shaddolls. She practically does the same thing as Aleister the Invoker, except she's already a LIGHT monster, triggers off of being Special Summoned as well, and despite both of them being able to search for a Fusion Spell, their applications can be different depending on the situation. Aleister offers offensive pressure by being a ATK/DEF modifying hand trap, she offers recovery. Aleister offers more aggression to the table with additional Fusion Monsters in the form of the Invoked, she offers versatility for Link Climbing and Xyz/Synchro plays due to the nature of her archetype if you want to employ more of them. It really just comes down to your preference AND focus.
  2. Magistus Vritra - Commonly used to Link Climb into either a Predaplant Verte Anaconda for either Dragoon or DPE, or a Selene play for Accesscode Talker, but this time, having access to a LIGHT monster all the time in a format where you can't Link Climb is more than welcome and enough.
  3. Magistus Invocation - The archetypal Fusion Spell, similar to Invocation due to them being both semi-generic Fusion spells but different in application, but at least it allows you to use materials from your hand when you Fusion Summon with it, which is the most frustrating part about the Invocation.
• Shaddoll Fusion - Yes, my Fusion Spell uses materials from the deck, cry about it. No seriously, this Fusion Spell is one of the three most revolutionary Fusion Spells in the game, alongside Super Polymerization and Invocation (I'm choosing this one because it's archetypal and Future Fusion is not, it's not that serious really.) • El Shaddoll Fusion - Battle Phase shenanigans. It also allows you to play around targeting interruption/removal due to it being a Quick-Play Spell. It also allows you to do the first half of your usual Shaddolls combo while playing around Droll & Lock Bird. Good enough as a searchable one of but more copies is welcome if felt needed. • Resh Shaddoll Incarnation - I'm playing 2 because I think it's the standard. You could probably get away with 1, but additional copies for safeguard is always good for anything if you can play with it well enough, especially in slower variants of the deck. • Shaddoll Core - One of the most underrated card in the whole Shaddoll card pool. This card is one of the keys as to why this deck can GRIND. Its recovery effect when sent to the GY by a card effect is NOT ONCE PER TURN, meaning if you can somehow loop it, you can keep recurring resources back to your hand. • Shaddoll Schism - This card is awfully disrespected by a lot of people due to it having the reputation of being "only a Winda enabler", but no. People seem to forget its more powerful effect of non-targeting, non-destruction removal that happens on resolution, provided that your opponent has a monster that shares an Attribute with the Shaddoll Fusion Monster you Fusion Summoned with this card. You do not have to summon only Winda with this. If your opponent has a problematic monster, feel free to summon a Shaddoll Fusion Monster with a matching Attribute instead. One copy is standard but I've seen some people play 2 and that's actually pretty reasonable. Do it if you have access to more, but one is enough. Extra Deck: • The Fusion Dolls
  1. El Shaddoll Construct - Notorious for two things: 1. Enabling resource loop ever since it got introduced into the game, which results in a fantastic grind game. 2. Its non-targeting destruction effect that happens at the start of the Damage Step. There's a reason why it got Limited and even Banned for quite a long time. 2 is enough for some, but if you can play 3, there's no reason not to.
  2. El Shaddoll Winda - The bane of every tryhard combo decks. One of the most famous floodgate monster in the game, with a very powerful effect of limiting both players to only 1 Special Summons for each per turn. It also has a destruction protection against card effects, that most people seem to forget when attempting to get rid of her. 2 is enough but you could always dare to play 3.
  3. El Shaddoll Apkallone - The newest addition to the Shaddoll Fusion Monster line up, the key to both your grind game and also the source of your targeting interruption. Being indestructible by battle, she's also not a bad defensive monster. Also, people seem to forget that her negation effect is PERMANENT. Always do keep that in mind. Much like Winda, 2 of her is enough.
  4. El Shaddoll Shekhinaga - Our only archetypal reactive negation effect in the deck, she used to be the go-to defensive Shaddoll monster, until Apkallone at least, due to her massive 3000 DEF body. We could play her since we have Extra Deck space, and also a good reason to play Mathematician.
  5. El Shaddoll Anoyatyllis - The hard counter to Nekroz back in the day, and nowadays, Drytrons. She doesn't have anything proactive, instead she acts also much like Winda, except she's preventing both players from Special Summoning monsters from the hand or GY with Spell/Trap effects, that includes Ritual Summoning. She's also not bad at 2700 ATK. Just a one of, also the reason why we could play 2 Ariels.
The others are pretty much all generic Super Polymerization targets that you feel like using. I prefer the usual line up of Starving Venom Fusion Dragon for DARK heavy decks or mirror matches, Predaplant Dragostapelia is actually arguably best one for this format in particular, and Mudragon of the Swamp for the weird Attribute presence. Aiwass, the Magistus Spell Spirit is also technically a Super Polymerization target, and is a walking Fiendish Chain in itself. Invoked Augoeides, in case we run into Invoked match ups, and the man of the hour himself, DPE. Final Thoughts: Well, it's Shaddolls, and I absolutely fucking love them if it wasn't obvious enough. I can't wait to participate in the Normal Summon Aleister Festival, so much so that I might actually try and clear the rewards up to the title. I've already featured this deck and its variants in my former lists, multiple times, so I don't think I have much else to say about it as of now. As per usual, if you have any questions or thoughts, feel free to express them down in the comments and I'll respond to them as soon as I possibly can.

Before getting into the rules let me just say this format is not meant to go "try hard" and build the most optimal competitive deck to face off against your opponent. The idea of this format is to keep it casual and run those "bad" Knights of Atlantis, Chazz (Ojama/Armed Dragon/VWXYZ), God Cards and many other casual decks. Basically approach this format as if you're playing on the playground and not at a local game shop for a tournament.  This format was also designed to be used with the Duel Disk toys licensed by Konami. YOU DO NOT NEED A DUEL DISK TO PLAY THIS FORMAT.  Due to this format being made with the Duel Disks in mind there are rules in line limiting certain cards that can't be used with a Duel Disk.  1-Other than the following rules, all other official TCG rules apply.  2-Due to this being made for a Duel Disk XYZ, PENDULUMS, and LINK MONSTERS ARE BANNED!  3- All cards are limited to 1 copy per deck EXCEPT for cards on this list, you can play 3 of anything on this list: https://tinyurl.com/AnimeFormatExceptions  4) Other than Xyz, Pendelum and Links no other cards are banned, but to balance Gameplay there is a <#907791420469956678> You can only have 3 Cards on the A Tier List 5 Cards on the B Tier List 10 Cards on the C Tier List In your deck. https://tinyurl.com/FormatTierList  5)You can Normal Summon in face up defense like the Anime.  6) You can have up to 20 cards in the Extra Deck.  You can find the full community here: https://discord.com/invite/gGmy52ZEny
