UNBEATABLE 1st TURN COMBO BOARD ANTI-META!  Normal Summon 003. Use effect to special 001 from deck.  Use 001 and 003 to make Halq. Halq effect to summon the second 001 from deck.  Use Halq and 001 to make Auroradon. Auroradon will summon 3 mech phantom beast tokens to your board.  Both 001 effects trigger to special themselves from the GY. Use a 001 and a token to make Arc Light, then use the second 001 and another token to make another Arc Light.  Use both Arc Lights to make Gallant Granite. Use Granite to add Nib.  Arc Light triggers to search Nekroz of Brionac. Use Auroradon to summon Coltwing from the deck by tributing Granite and the last token. Arc Light triggers again to search Benten and Coltwing summons 2 more tokens. Both 001s summon themselves from the GY again.  Use a 001 and a token to make the third Arc Light, then use the second 001 and the second token to make Quandax. Use Arc Light and Quandax to make Dugaress. Use Dugaress effect to detach 2 material to special back an Arc Light, then use the detached Arc Light's effect to search Nekroz of Unicore.  Use Arc Light and Coltwing to make Emeral, then use Emeral to detach the Arc Light to shuffle back an Arc Light, Halq, and 001 then draw a card. Arc Light will trigger again to search Kaleidoscope.  Activate Kaleidoscope, sending Arc Light to the GY to summon Unicore. Arc Light will trigger to search Nekroz of Valkyrus.  Use Brionac effect to search Clausolas, then use Clausolas to search Cycle. Activate Cycle tributing Benten to summon Brionac from GY. Use Benten to search Kristya, then summon Kristya because you have 4 fairys in GY. This is your end board.  Nekroz just went +9 and their end board is Unicore which negates all ED monsters and Kristya which stops special summoning. Even if your opponent can out Kristya, you still have a Nib and the other cards in hand. This board all came from 003.  This deck is insane, and even without 003 you can still make moves. deck_excerpt: The game's most power crept deck meets some of the game's most "niche" cards. What could go wrong?
deck_description: Video link in the description below - Exo ( https://youtube.com/watch?v=6_VO1WHQjk4&t= ) There isn't a lot to say about the "Blackwings" archetype as a whole. Needless to say, there shouldn't be too much to work with when it comes to this once powerful Synchro-era deck that was one of the first "anime" decks that made a singular top cut in any competitive Yu-Gi-Oh since after the GX era came to a close. However from RaidRaptors to Phantom Knights; Blackwings after their prime have been nothing short of a disorderly cluster of archetype reliance and incompetent mashups of DARK-attribute monsters that either want to push for XYZ extension, or forge some Super Polymerization traps that (up until now) have no significance whatsoever. If we happen to learn from now, not all decks from Yu-Gi-Oh's past and present would perform under the cards of the future no matter the circumstance. For Blackwings, this statement speaks no different for them and the reality has hit them hard on myself and others that had played them (and called them the deck that carried the 5Ds Era).   First and foremost, the main concept for Blackwings over the years has either been in favor of Synchro summoning or has been lingering on other pieces (such as Raidraptors); however for this piece, I went with a mixture of a package that fits Super Polymerization ; the recently released synchro monster Maple Maiden ; and the usual Synchro mechanics without the dependency of the DARK-attribute because of Branded-Despia. Why I chose the card Maple Maiden as the go to LV7 over Assault Blackwing-Raikiri the Rain Shower is because of this: the fact that Maple Maiden has the ability to manipulate it's attribute (and all attributes of other monsters on the field) into your favour when special summoned on the field. As a result of this, either I can go into Bahamut Shark to Toadally Awesome (mainly when DARK-attribute monsters are on my opponents field, and I don't have a Super Polymerization ); or I can make her attribute into the DARK-attribute and force a Super Polymerization on all non-Dark monsters on my opponents monsters. While this isn't the go to play for this deck (and it shouldn't be always relied on), it sometimes comes in handy in case you either want a board wipe or want to protect yourself in case you want to not risk a forced board wipe on your end with your Blackwings.   Then comes the Synchro monsters that the archetype has been truly know for consistently push into during it's time in my trials. Besides Maple Maiden , the other LV7 that comes in play in case we can't get access to it is none other than F.A Dawn Dragster (a Synchro monster that negates effects Spell/Trap effects at the cost of lower it's level by 2). Next comes Chaos Ruler, the Chaotic Magical Dragon , who alongside Blackwing-Oroshi the Squall is needed to get the powerful Hot Red Dragon Archfiend Abyss (a one tap negate anything that also revives a tuner monster if any battle damage is done). Finally from what I can go for, two options I can carve out are either Baronne de Fleur or Blackwing Full Armor Master . In this case, the most common choice (while I didn't necessarily feel any favoritism from either in this deck) was in from Blackwing Full Armor Master , and only due to being both a omni protector and a Mind Controller that can be used to sack valuable assets from your opponents (or to give them a bad time).   Lastly comes the Fusion and Link Monsters picked by me; but while there were not too many to choose from, the options however weren't as farfetched as it was made out to be. For the Super Polymerization targets: my picks included Starving Venom Fusion Dragon , Predaplant Triphyoverutum , and  Predaplant Dragostapelia . All of these were chosen because each fit a role of either being a sniping valuable assets off enemy boards of getting rid of problematic monsters (and then you got your Triphyoverutum, the Nuclear option for Super Polymerization). The Link monsters chosen were there to either act as supporting pieces or to be initial in screwing with your opponent. These link monsters include Psy-Frame Lambda , Dharc the Dark Charmer, Gloomy , and Underworld Goddess of the Closed World .

deck_excerpt: UPDATE: Man, can't believe Konami made this tiny mistake...
deck_description: First turn play (Updated): Combo 1: (First Step) Play 2 monster cards in the field, with one of them being a level 3 P.U.N.K. Tuner monster. You can either Fusion summon to Rising Carp to summon 2 P.U.N.K. monsters from the deck or basically summon 2 monsters by normal or special summon. Then Link summon to Halqifibrax to special summon Deskbot 001 from the hand or deck. Proceed to Link summon to Auroradon to special summon 3 tokens and Deskbot 001 from the grave. (2nd Step) Synchro summon Herald of the Arc Light, then use the effect of Auroradon by tributing two tokens to special summon Coltwing. With this, your Coltwing will special summon two tokens, which led to Deskbot 001 to be special summoned from the GY (Reminder: Deskbot 001 is not a once per turn card). Use Coltwing (lvl 10 due to its effect) and Deskbot 001 to Synchro summon Amazing Dragon. Then, special summon a lvl 3 P.U.N.K. monster from the GY with the effect of Amazing Dragon. With this setup, (3rd step) proceed to Synchro Summon Coral Dragon, then Synchro Summon the lvl 9 Karakuri boss monster. Then special summon a lvl 1 Karakuri tuner. With the lvl 9 Karakuri boss monster and a lvl 1 Tuner, proceed to Synchro summon Baronne de Fleur. Combo 2: Follow step 1 from the first combo, then Synchro Summon  C u p i d   P i t c h (This one card can basically give you more opportunities to create stronger boards and negates. Nice!). Increase her level to 5 by her effect, then Special summon Coltwing by Auroradon's Effect (Yea expect Coltwing's effect and Deskbot 001's effect). Then, Synchro summon FIRST Amazing Dragon, then Borreload Savage Dragon by using Cupid Pitch and a token. With Cupid Pitch's effect, add Synchron Magnet to your hand, then proceed to activate Amazing Dragon's effect to summon a level 3 P.U.N.K. Monster from the GY. Synchro Summon Hi-Speedroid Kendama, a lvl 6 non-tuner machine monster, then activate Synchron Magnet's effect to special summon itself to the field. Then yea, do the usual Karakuri trick from the first combo to get a free Baronne. The difference between the two combos: The first combo has a floodgate effect from Herald of the Arc Light, yet vulnerable in battle. It also prevents you from activating cards like Maxx C and Droll and Lock Bird. The second combo, however, has 2 monsters with an Omni-negate and 3 high beatsticks. Since Herald is not present on the field, you can activate cards that has a requirement to be sent from the GY. These two combos can surprisingly work with a single card (E. Teleport) or two cards (any random card and a Noh-P.U.N.K. monster). But keep in mind that this combo is very vulnerable to hand traps, so yeah, wish you luck on getting a Called by the grave or Crossout Designator in your starting hand. You can also play Droll and Lock Bird to counter Maxx "C", just in case you used the first combo, since that doesn't really require you to add cards from your hand to pull it off. Opponent's 1st Turn play: Umm... Wish your opponent is ass and not some meta slave Swordsoul DPE player??? What I can tell you, for now, is to negate and bait out opponent's cards as much as possible, depending on your starting hand. Use hand traps as well to disrupt the opponent's plays (or might as well try to make your opponent surrender, lol). Then, when it is your turn, try to pull off the One-Trick Board (either Combo 1 or Combo 2, depending on the situation). Also, keep in mind that you can activate only one of Amazing Dragon's effect each turn, so yea, be careful of your own activations to prevent a misplay. Reminders: This deck is not-so-perfect, as it is vulnerable by hand traps and negates. It also provides a tiny amount of bricks as well (unless if you really played well) so yeah bear with that. I do not recommend this deck to desperate Master Duel players that are trying to win Ranked Matches lol. Play this deck for fun, I guess. If you have any suggestions, leave it in the comments down below so that, yah, I can be informed on what improvements I could apply. Oh yea btw you can use Dark Ruler No More and Lightning Storm, in hopes that you can make your own board with ease. Edit: Btw currently I'm in Platinum 2 with this deck. I can feel myself promoting to Diamond, so yah, wish me luck. And hey, last season, I played consistently at Diamond 3-4 with the first combo, which gives me a good conclusion that this works in Ranked. Good Luck.

deck_excerpt: This deck is focusing on summon the biggest Cyberdark boi as soon as possible.
deck_description:
This deck is focusing on summon the biggest Cyberdark boi as soon as possible. The deck also contain variety of power cards that can handle many type of opponent board when going second. The main combo is start with having Cyber dragon core or Cyber  Emengency, 1 more dragon or machine monster and Cyberdark Realm in opening hand. The basic guide of the main combo can be found in this video but instead of summon Sieger you can summon Union Carrier so you can equip one more card to Cyberdark End so it can attack more.   Cards to equip to Cyberdark End:
  • Dragon Buster Destruction Sword: Block opponent from special summon from extra deck.
  • Cyberdark Claw: Send card from extra deck to the graveyard.
    • Elder Entity N'tss to destroy a card on the field.
    • Predaplant Chimerafflesia to add 1 Overload Fusion to hand
  • Attachment Cybern: if it get send to the graveyard you can use its effect to revive Cyberdark End or Cyberdarkness.
  • Monster in opponent graveyard that has graveyard effect.
  Convert to TCG:
  • Replace all Maxx C, Dragon Buster Destruction Sword and 1 called by with 1 Psy-Frame driver and 3 Gamma.
  • Replace Union Carrier with Anaconda
  • Add Psy-framelord Omega to side deck

【Witchcrafter Weekly #2】 Fusion Festival Time :) - YouTube

Once again, I have made a mayasaski ftk deck.  This time I opted for only two dakki to see how that would go.  If you’re not familiar with the mayasaski ftk here’s how it goes.  You use dakki (who has no opt on its text) to mash itself while owning a soul-absorbing bone tower. Every time you summon a zombie the bone tower will pitch the top two cards off of your opponents deck, if you do it enough (you’ll usually do it enough) they deck out and you win by default because they can’t draw.  But not only that, today I decided to make a rundown on the deck!  Yes, I’ll be giving you a guide to the list!  1 Doomking Balerdroch  Balerdroch is the star of this deck. Mayasaski lacks a competent boos monster and really can only do utility plays, Balerdroch is the boss monster coming from zombie world who can revive every turn and interrupts two times if you have a zombie world out! This card made zombie world decks much more competitive then they would be otherwise and in Mayasaski it is one of the best tools you could have.  1 Necroworld Banshee  Necroworld Banshee only has one relevant effect, if it’s on the field or graveyard it can activate Zombie world directly from the deck! The zombie world portion in this deck is mainly to make sure you’re safe if the ftk fails. I only used one necroworld banshee because I can very easily send it to the graveyard without any effort.  3 Gozuki  Gozuki does wonders in this deck, it pitches zombies and helps summon zombies zombies from your hand if you’re having trouble getting certain monsters out! All in all Gozuki is a solid tool that is recommended if you want to try your hand in nearly any zombie based deck.  3 Mezuki  Mezuki is sometimes the only reason your ftk works! It’s text is pretty simple, you banish it from your grave to summon a zombie from your grave, no opt no catch, you mill it you get a summon. It’s very helpful when you’re trying to get your soul absorbing bone tower out.  3 Shiranui Solitare  Solitare serves immense purpose in any zombie focused deck for its ability to be 3 additional copies of Uni-Zombie, one of the most helpful zombies in the game. It’s second effect is cool but there’s no using it in this particular deck.  3 Uni-Zombie  Uni-Zombie is an incredible card, it mills a zombie and lets you discard a card which is helpful with zombies sometimes. This card is insane and proves to be one of the best tuners printed to this day.  3 Soul Absorbing Bone Tower  This tower is the enabler of this deck, it’s two effects are simple. You can’t attack it if you own a zombie other than itself and every time a zombie hits the field the top two cards of your opponents deck hits the graveyard. The main mayasaski combo summons so many zombies that the bone tower can deck out your opponent!  2 Dakki, the Graceful Mayasaski  Dakki is the reason why this works as well, the only effect you need to know is this one: “When a “Mayasaski” monster(s) is special summoned to your field from your extra deck, while this card is in the GY (except during the damage step) you can special summon this card”. There’s no opt and the timing clause is that if you tuned it for a mayasaski synchro it can summon itself, each mayasaski synchro can be tuned by a level two tuner for another one two levels higher than the previous one except for the level 11 one, who gets linked and you simply repeat the process.  3 Hajun, the Winged Mayasaski  Hajun can summon dakki from the deck, who then tunes for the Wheeled Mayasaski as they quickly go up into a spiraling loop.  3 Yuki-Musume, the Ice Mayasaski  Yuki-Musume is a mayasaski with the effect to summon itself and pitch any zombie from the deck to the graveyard making it relatively easy to set up the ftk, all in all it is an incredibly solid card being held back by its respective archetype.  1 Glow-Up Bloom  Bloom is capable of summoning bale from the deck, a good effect but due to only needing one bale and the sheer amount of zombies you can send I opted for only one.  3 Mayasaski Winter  Winter is a card that can transform attack points to virtually zero in Mayasaski, plus it provides a nifty draw effect and can revive zombies, in most decks this is a card not worth playing but in a deck like mayasaski playing this card is relatively safe  1 Zombie World  Zombie World is simple, everything you ever loved is a zombie now. Zombie World has an entire structure deck and even mor just normal decks built around it, it alone counters multiple decks including dinos, Dlink, Swordsoul, Tri-Brigades, and more! I only have the need for one because of banshee  3 Mayasaski Return  Simple text but incredible help, it literally just rotas or foolish burials a mayasaski card, doesn’t even need to be a monster, so you can actually search the new mayasaski trap with it.  1 One for One  Simple enough for you? There’s seven total level one monsters in this deck. The main purpose of this card is to make summoning Hajun easier.  3 Ghost Meets Girl - a Mayasaski and Shiranui’s Tale  The newest mayasaski support, Ghost Meets Girl is a vanities ruler for zombies and even goes as far as to recycle a banished zombie! This card is simply insane with an effect that ends turns and.  3 Shiranui Style Swallow’s Slash  Swallow’s Slash is a handy card for interruption with two instant pops and is generally used in zombie decks in general.  2 Gashadokuro, the Skeletal Mayasaki  This is part of the mayasaski loop along with an immunity effect  2 Yoko, the Graceful Mayasaski  This is part of the mayasaski loop along with a monster pop  2 Tengu, the Winged Mayasaski  This is part of the mayasaski loop along with spell/trap removal  2 Tsuchigumo the Poisonous Mayasaski  This is part of the mayasaski loop along with even more milling lol  2 Orboro-Guruma the Wheeled Mayasaski  This is part of the mayasaski loop along with battle protection  1 Yuki-Onna, the Absolute Zero Mayasaski  Yuki-Onna comes with two negates in response to graveyard summons, making it a really solid counter to certain decks.  2 Yuki-Onna the Icicle Mayasaski  Mayasaki’s newest link monster! This link three allows mayasaski to do ftks even more efficiently with its reviving effect! Overall this card is very helpful for the deck in general!  2 Yuki-Onna the Ice Mayasaki  Mediocre card meant for link climbing     So what happens with all of these mills, and how many do you usually aim to get?  Well, that’s simple  Each time Dakki summons two gets pitched, each time the extra deck summons two more gets pitched,  4 gets pitched from Orboro and Dakki  4 more gets pitched from Tsuchigumo and Dakki  4 more gets pitched from Tengu and Dakki  4 more goes bye from Yoko and Dakki  4 more incinerates from Gashadokuro and Dakki  Another 4 from Yuki-Onna and Dakki  Another 4 from the link 3 Yuki-Onna and Dakki  Another 4 from the link 4 Yuki-Onna and Dakki  The link 3 Yuki-Onna revives Orboro which tosses another 2  Tsuchigumo and Dakki throws out another 4  Tengu and Dakki Tosses out another 4  Yoko and Dakki for another 4  Gashadokuro and Dakki pitches 4 more  Yuki-Onna and Dakki for 4  and the link 3 Yuki-Onna and Dakki for a finishing 4  How many was that? 58 cards milled in one sequence, you can deck out a 60 card deck with that, mayasaski used to have trouble with that!  Strengths of this deck:  This deck can shut down a lot of options for your opponents and also doesn’t have much trouble preforming an ftk as well  Mayasaki’s endboard will consist of one monster who floats 5 times and occasionally Bale and a lock to summoning  This deck is incredibly fun to play  Weaknesses of this deck:  You have no room in your extra because Mayasaski demands a lot of space in the extra  Mayasaski lacks a direct negate and has to rely on other things  A single handtrap is all it takes to kill this deck at times  This deck is one of the easiest Nib targets in the game  Overall I really like this deck! I have a lot of fun decking out my opponents through this deck and pitching so many cards is really funny for me.

deck_excerpt: Updated Spellbook Dogmatika, by using new cards and optimizing my build.
deck_description:
After probably way too long, I'm updating my first I've ever posted, Spellbook Dogmatika. The strategy is still basically the same: Spellbook of Fate + Dogmatika Punishment, but it's just more optimized and runs way better. PS: The deck is not Meta. There are a thousand of better Dogmatika builds, that are Meta contenders, this is not.
  • Cuts:
    • Dark Magician of Chaos(1 to 0) - I was using it as a Magicians' Souls target, but as the comments said, it's not worth it. Also, I was drawing it way more than needed.
    • High Priestess of Prophecy(2 to 0) - Too bricky, there are better targets to souls now, like Illusion of Chaos.
    • Dogmatika Fleurdelis, the Knighted(2 to 1) - Since I mostly used this as interruption after the combo as an add from Titaniklad the Ash Dragon, using multiples caused me to draw the card, which was bricking.
    • Nadir Servant(3 to 2) - Banlist. That's all.
    • Spellbook of Power(2 to 0) - It was just too situation to ever use it. And it was the card I was mostly siding anyways.
    • The Grand Spellbook Tower(1 to 0) - I just don't know why I was even running this card, it was just souls target, which we have better ones.
    • Spellbook of Eternity(2 to 1) - In the past, I thought I needed 2 for consistency, but I know now that you will mostly just copy the effect of it with Spellbook of Master, which is way more important.
    • Spellbook of Wisdom(1 to 0) - The card is still on the decklist, but it's totally optional. It can make you brick, or it can be clutch, it depends too much.
  • Adds/New Cards:
    • Handtraps - I was dumb. Sorry. Not running handtraps nowadays is already a lose. In this build, I'm using Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring and Effect Veiler, as bridges to Crystron Halqfibrax and Accesscode Talker, but those are your pick.
    • Illusion of Chaos + Preparation of Rites - Illusion of Chaos is a card that didn't existed, so that's why I wasn't using it. You can replace it with Pot of Prosperity, but it stops you from activating Spellbook of Knowledge.
    • Dinowrestler Pankratops - The deck was losing a lot to other control decks in game 1, so I just had to add something to stop at least 1 of the set cards.
  • Side Deck Changes: Those changes are not as important, since it's not your main form of dealing with the opponent, but it's still relevant. I'm not gonna point all of them, since like I said, you can just change whatever you want on it.
    • Forbidden Droplet - Kinda weird to use this, but it was being very clutch when needed. Can also send materials to activate Spellbook of Fate, which happens more than it looks time.
    • Rivalry of Warlords - By itself, this card CAN kill decks. Like I said, can. That's why it's on side deck. Neither of the decks on this build care about it, since most of them are Spellcasters and you can just play around it.
    • Nibiru, the Primal Being - Kaboom? Any tier 3 or lower combo deck dies to this, no reason to not play if you're in game 2 or if you know your opponent deck, you can even main it.
 
  • Some Side Notes:
    • Comments also gave some tips about using 3 Secret Village of Spellcasters, but when I played it, I was just drawing it with no Spellcasters, which is a brick. So I think 2 are ok, but now with searching Magicians' Souls, I'm not that certain anymore.
    • Also from the comments, user @kissbandit suggested some cards, between those were:
      1. Witchcrafter Golem Aruru - Good card, but I always have protection with Spellbook of Wisdom, which I'm already considering cutting.
      2. Chaos Sorcerer - Interesting pick, but not playable, the Dogmatika engine already uses all, if not most, of Dark attribute monsters for El Shaddoll Winda summon, which means his summon would clash with that engine.
      3. Quintet Magician + Magicalized Fusion - You put it as trolling, but I tested it seriously. It's not that bad. If you're using Predaplant Verte Anaconda, that's even easier to summon. Now saying all of that, you are using Main and Extra Deck spaces, which can brick, so it's not that consistent.
    • This is becoming comments suggestions by now, but as user @Yugituber said, you can use Invoked engine on it, but you can be careful about your Normal Summons. Other than that, it works just fine, as seen on the user @toe build-https://ygoprodeck.com/invoked-spell-book/
    • Brave Engine - That's one I'm temped to, but I will not be using it. It can improve the deck a lot, but it can also hurt the deck. In a way, it's optional to the user.
Old Post: https://ygoprodeck.com/spellbook-dogmatika-3/ Original @toe Post: https://ygoprodeck.com/invoked-spell-book/

deck_excerpt: Simple Branded deck made from the Albaz Strike structure deck.
deck_description: This is just a deck I made out of three Albaz Strike structure decks and some assorted old cards I've had lying around for years. I've not played any proper games with it (yet, looking for a place to play) but done a load of test hands with it and it seems pretty consistent. There's the obvious combos in it like using the kaijus to get rid of problem monsters and then fusing them with Fallen of Albaz to get your own bosses out like Titaniklad or Lubellion. Mirrorjade is obviously the big boss of the deck with its banishing and destruction abilities on top of that base 3000 attack, however I only run two Mirrorjades because of its "you can only control 1" clause so I decided to tech in a Five-Headed Dragon I had lying around on the off chance I can summon it (using Branded in White, which I'm pretty sure can summon it) but other than that it's probably nothing spectacular, just a deck I made out of the cards I had available to me at the time and just wanted to showcase what I was able to create.

deck_name: Danger! Dark World The most competitive and affordable
deck_excerpt: The best Danger! Dark world deck on ygoprodeck.com
deck_description:
1. General danger inclusion 

For danger we want to draw all of them but not multiples of the same card. However there are ways to get around this with certain effects and with the amount of copies of each card we put into the deck. We also have to keep in mind what we can do with the extra deck in terms of levels. So with that out of the way we did not include Danger! Dogman! because the card does, in a worse way, what the rest of the deck already does which is deal with our opponents field. We also don't include Dogman because the deck doesn't have any level 7 xyz and we generally don't want to summon and Danger! Nessie! as Nessie's discard effect is much more helpful to search for either jackalope or to get our level 4's or 8's which tend to have a much greater impact in general. The only other inclusion which might be different is only including two Danger! Chupacabra! This is because as helpful as the discard effect is you must have a danger! card in your GY for it to be helpful. Therefore we only run two of them

2. Dark World Inclusion

Generally we run less darkworld monsters because on their own they are dead draws. However paired with Danger! monsters they provide amazing effects for the deck. We run Beiige, Vanguard of Dark World because he's a free summon when discarded. We can also use Grapha, Dragon Lord of Dark World to return Beiige to our hand and later summon him again. Therefore we only run two of him along with only two Grapha. Grapha is nice as when discarded he offers us destruction along with the fact he basically makes the rest of the dark world monsters level 8s in addition to their level, like I said he bounces other darkworld monsters to hand to special summon himself from the GY. We run three Snoww, Unlight of Dark World as she can search for all of our dark world cards that I will talk about later along with the fact we can use her to summon Grapha from the GY or just as a level four if we're desperate. Last but not least is Broww, Huntsman of Dark World he gives us additional card draw, lets us get Grapha from the GY, and works with our other graveyard interaction that I'll touch on later. We run three however running Broww as a two of isn't going to hurt the deck. 

3. Spells and tra... oh wait there's only spells

So there are only spells in the deck because the deck is a combo deck. The goal is to combo into basically your entire extra deck or to combo into enough monsters to unalive your opponent. First off we start with our only danger spell. Danger! Response team is in the deck for a few reasons and can fix a lot of problems Danger! can encounter. Any card that can't be destroyed by battle or card effects or is just immune to monsters in general, a good example being Infinitrack Fortress Megaclops which danger darkworld would only be able to deal with using the extra deck. On top of that Response team can also be used to guarantee discards of nessie or jackalope who 90% of the time you don't want to summon. So you can either keep response team in your hand and try to discard it to use it's effects later or set it if you know you're gonna want to bounce a monster back to hand. Next up are the darkworld spells which are much more basic. Dark World Dealings is a spell that lets both you and your opponent draw 1 card and discard one card. The initial use is obvious because you want to discard cards but it also works with the dark charmer and Fabled Andwraith in the extra deck. Next is Gates of the dark world which acts as another dark world dealings that works well with Blackwing - Zephyros the Elite. We only run one of them because it can be searched with snoww and drawing more than one would give us more dead cards that we don't need. In terms of generic spells that aren't Danger! or Darkworld we run two allure of darkness, two pot of avarice, a card destruction and a monster reborn. The two allure only let us go even in terms of cards but can easily save us from bad hands or get the deck out of any tough spots. We generally dump darworld cards but if you have two of the same Danger! monster in your hand and you don't have many cards then banishing a Danger! monster can sometimes be a option. Pot of avarice is nice as we end up having a ton of monsters in the GY and you can easily avarice twice in the same turn. Especially with how we construct our extra deck. Next is card destruction which doesn't really need a explanation. Every card in our deck except most of our spells we want to discard. It also works with pot of avarice and helps put cards like Grapha into the graveyard. Monster reborn is the last spell and always gets us out of any sticky situation if we don't have the  correct monsters on the board to xyz or link summon. It can also be used to steal some monsters from our opponents GY that works quite well with some of our extra deck that I'll address later.

Extra Deck with some alternatives

For the extra deck some of it is because we're on somewhat of a budget and some are just necessary for the deck to be good both going first and second. Generally Danger! Darkworld wants to go second as the large amount of destruction effects allows this deck to play around a wide number of negates. However, the first three extra deck monsters help the deck go first with extra value and creating some scary board presence. The first of which is probably the strangest card in the extra deck but a card I've had too much success with not to put it in. That card being Fabled Andwraith and the one of card we put in the main deck just for it which is The Fabled Cerburrel. Now I have this card in for extra draw as the opponent could discard a card to negate Fabled Andwraith's first effect however this deck goes so positive on card draw that this trade isn't worth it a lot of the time for the opponent. This also counters certain decks I've personally been seeing more recently, that being adventure, certain phantom knight decks/engines, and some cyber dragon. It can obviously deal with more decks and works well against hand traps in general. This is because most hand traps get discarded from hand to graveyard so if they Ash Blossom, Effect Veiler, ghost ogre, or droll (it works on more these are just the most common ones I see) you still get the summon.  Next Is Number 38 who negates a spell on field which will in any case slow down the opponent. It's quite easily to get out and can be used to summon megaclops who will get us more value later. With 38's new reprint in Second Haunting he's more than affordable.  last but no least for our strange but effective cards for going first is The Zombie Vampire. She gets us a summon from the top four cards of either players deck. This not only helps fill your GY but there's also a chance to get your opponents boss monster for free as it doesn't negate the summoned monsters effects. This can also give another card the extra deck Dark Charmer, Gloomy a chance to be used on turn 1 letting you go into even more extra deck monsters. Now for the stranger part of the extra deck but in my opinion very versatile and quite effective. This is of course our Galaxy-Eyes Cipher Dragon, Galaxy-Eyes Full Armor Photon Dragon, and Galaxy-Eyes Cipher Blade Dragon. The first one, Cipher dragon, allows you to take control of an opponents monster and use it as xyz material for the other two galaxy-eyes monsters you have. Granted you do have to remember this basically takes away your ability to OTK your opponent but it gets around destruction effects. Then the other two dragons can be xyz summoned using either the stolen monster or just using Cipher dragon. You can summon full photon over cipher dragon, destroy a card, then summon cipher blade over to destroy another card. This is just a whole lot of value for a very easy to summon set of cards. Note at the time of making this you can buy each of these cards for a dollar or less.  Finally in the extra deck you have you're very basic monsters. I:P to summon Borrelsword Dragon, Raiders knight used to summon Arc Rebellion XYZ Dragon who is also used as a very easy otk that your opponent has to negate in some way. Finally there's number 60 who's used to extend your turn by letting you draw and discard, he's also useful to summon Infinitrack Fortress Megaclops who we put into the deck because it still lets any of your already used/negated xyz monsters still be useful and some decks just struggle to deal with Megaclops. That's the whole extra deck!  If you're looking for some rather expensive upgrades they can be any of the following cards: Apollousa, Bow of the Goddess (The Alternate Art is usually cheaper), Underworld Goddess of the Closed World, Number 97: Draglubion plus Number 100: Numeron Dragon, Dingirsu, the Orcust of the Evening Star, and Divine Arsenal AA-ZEUS - Sky Thunder.
Synchro

deck_excerpt: Isn't this just the plot of Avataro Sentai DonBrothers?
deck_description: The new Selection Pack may have given me both the P.U.N.K. Fusion and Synchro main monsters, but only one copy of 1 out of 3 Main Deck SR monsters. While trying to gather more gems, I had an idea.  And I thought it was gonna be terrible, but it's not that bad, actually?  Enter this mashed deck of the Live☆Twins, the new P.U.N.K. cards, and a small dash of Destiny HEROs because dear god the new Fusion is good AND I somehow pulled it. And while I don't have enough Evil☆Twin cards to support the Live☆Twins, I did happen to have a decent amount of Code Talkers and a copy of Firewall Dragon to support the literal one Link Ki-sikil I have. If you wanna have a run at this deck and you DO happen to own more of the Evil☆Twin Links, it honestly might be a good idea to just chuck the Code Talkers out to make room for them. Similar notes for anyone who actually owns any other missing cards - Live☆Twin spells like Secret Password, P.U.N.K. monsters like Foxy Tune, etc. But you might have to swap some cards in and out. Iblee might also be a good idea for all the Link monsters, but for the time being, I left her out.  Tested this out in Ranked while trying to get more gems, and honestly? Not that bad! Would probably perform better if I actually had more of the cards, but it did win me a few duels. Certainly went a lot better than other 2-Archetype decks I've tried to make work. I've actually won with this deck in comparison to them.  Still a WIP for the obvious reasons, but this deck may have actual potential.

deck_excerpt: "The beacons are lit! The Ojamas call for aid!"
deck_description: So, horrible (amazing?) realization - the ironically Thunder-type Splights support specifically Level 2 monsters. You know what archetype is JUST Level 2s that certainly need some help? Ojamas. With their powers combined, Ojamas can potentially speed up! Or at least get some kind of assistance when the Splights are on the board, boosting and protecting them. The Splights also aren't really affected by cards like Ojama Country. Some'll actually get a stronger attack because of it! Ojamas can also go into the Splight's Extra Deck monsters, so if you can't get out any of the monsters to block off part of the opponent's board, get one of them out instead. Mix up board blocks with the Level 2 protections, and blast your opponent away as soon as you can, before they crush you right back. Some quick cards I wanna go over: Tri-Wight is essentially Ojamandala, but better. There's no LP payment for getting the main 3 Ojamas out. You can also play Ojama Delta Hurricane immediately after, and it makes summoning Ojama Emperor with them a lot easier. Number 64: Ronin Raccoon Sandayu is the closest we're ever gonna get to an Ojama Xyz monster. It only takes Beast monsters, which means you can't put the Splights into it as material, but you can protect it, and that's very important because two of them out on the field in defense essentially creates a wall. Number 64 can't be destroyed by battle or card effect as long as there's a Beast-type monster out, so if you need to make sure you don't get blasted through, get two out to buy some time. Your opponent either has to negate their effect before attacking, or banish them, which the Splights can prevent. Their effect also lets them create a token that gains ATK equal to the highest ATK on the field at that moment, and what's better is that this ATK stat isn't affected by Ojama Country. So you can get a token out, then get an Ojama out to swap the stats of everyone on the field, letting only you keep any stupidly high ATK. I didn't include the other two raccoon cards used for Number 64, really because Splights are pretty good themselves to back up the Ojamas. If you wanna try and get Number 64 out faster, DNA Surgery could help, but it might not be worth it. Recycling Batteries is recovery specifically for the Splights in the deck. Play it, and you've got two of them back in your hand immediately, good to go for immediate use. Alternatively, you can swap this card out for Pot of Avarice to draw two cards to put monsters of either archetype back, but you don't get the protection guaranteed back into your hand. Personally, I think Recycling Batteries is a better idea, since Ojamas can recover on their own with their field spell and Tri-Wight. But both cards are a good idea, considering you're gonna have a lot of monsters piling up in that graveyard. I haven't tested this deck yet, so I don't know if it'll actually work as intended, but it's just really funny - especially since Splights would work a lot better with other Level 2 monsters like the Live☆Twins, who are specifically dedicated to this sorta thing. But it's a deck for fun, anyways. Heck, if you wanna go really crazy, try smushing them in here too.

deck_name: CRYSTAL BEAST Post Legend of the Crystals
deck_excerpt: Crystal Beast deck by YGO Lite
deck_description: https://youtu.be/-6y9eSnv9d0

Branded Fusion, NS Aleister, somehow we're making Shaddolls, somehow Super Poly is more busted than ever, and here's a deck that just draws Fusion Destiny to make DPE (when it doesn't make it other ways!)     I actually like how this list turned out. There are some wild combos here, and some good tech plays, and very little fluff.  Tuned the Extra Deck a little - 2 Mechaba seems pretty standard rn for NS Aleister, but this list never needed 2 Mechaba, and using 2 slots on Mechaba and Artemis meant being a little shy on Mirror Jade targets, and particularly short on Lubellion. 1 Albaz is fine in this list - you have to manage resources well, so try not to banish the Albaz for Shaddolls until you're really done with him. Otherwise, he's fine - he's a mini-super poly which is good bait, and a good super poly target, so there are worse bricks in a lot of decks, even if I'm not thrilled Konami got me playing Fallen of Albaz.  No side deck, because that will vary based on the meta. In a deck like this, a high volume of high-quality generic interruptions are necessary, and the mix in the main is fine, so I'd advise a lot of 1 and 2 of tech calls for a deck like this, and to avoid relying on "silver bullets" for a matchup game plan, because in a 60 card list with no Pots and DPE but no Verte you're going to struggle to see any of your side tech, so you have to want to side it often. This list is pretty sick. I think the leaner, tighter Snow list might be overall stronger, but this list is strong, consistent, and has a comparably high ceiling (maybe higher sometimes?), but lacks some of that linearity of play.

deck_excerpt: Fun and competitive deck. If you have the Rngesus on your side this will be your best deck. Lightsworn has so much potential.
deck_description: Disclaimer: This deck will make your opponents cry.  This deck has many good win conditions. You can easily Link climb with knightmares and Accesscode to clear the field and then set up negates. Just have to believe in the power of RNG.  You start off with trying to dump your deck into the gy and then work from there. Chaos space + collapserpent/wyverbuster gives you a good start. Always try to add chaos creator with chaos space. Chaos dragon almost always fixes your hand and gy, its a good card. DONT OVER EXTEND. Remember to keep at least 1 Dark and 1 Light monster in grave. Levianeer is a good extender too, i usually use the special summon from gy effect. To bring back  level 4 tuner.  This deck is also good against control decks. Use Underworld to get rid of problematic monsters (Plasma, Dragoon, etc..) Bagooska can stall out a field of negates if they arent playing link monsters. Gren Maju can beat over anything in the late game. Kristya will activate your opponents effect "Cry". Feel free to make adjustments to extra deck. Ive tried to add zeus but doesnt come up often.  Most of all this deck is fun to play but very competitive. Takes a lot of practice to get the big picture of this deck. Side deck is still in progress.  Main Deck: 2x Chaos Dragon Levianeer 1x Archlord Kristya 2x The Chaos Creator 1x Danger! Nessie! 1x Destrudo the Lost Dragon's Frisson 3x Wulf, Lightsworn Beast 1x Fairy Tail - Snow 1x Black Dragon Collapserpent 2x Chaos Valkyria 1x Danger! Mothman! 1x White Dragon Wyverburster 1x Raiden, Hand of the Lightsworn 1x Performage Trick Clown 2x Felis, Lightsworn Archer 1x Performage Hat Tricker 1x Danger!? Tsuchinoko? 2x Lumina, Lightsworn Summoner 1x Danger!? Jackalope? 1x The Phantom Knights of Silent Boots 1x Gren Maju Da Eiza 2x Solar Recharge 1x Harpie's Feather Duster 1x Foolish Burial 3x Charge of the Light Brigade 3x Chaos Space 1x The Phantom Knights of Shade Brigandine 2x Phantom Knights' Fog Blade --------- Extra Deck: 1x Chaos Ruler, the Chaotic Magical Dragon 1x Borreload Savage Dragon 1x PSY-Framelord Omega 1x Cyberse Quantum Dragon 1x Number 38: Hope Harbinger Dragon Titanic Galaxy 1x Number 41: Bagooska the Terribly Tired Tapir 2x Minerva, the Exalted Lightsworn 1x Underworld Goddess of the Closed World 1x Accesscode Talker 1x Apollousa, Bow of the Goddess 1x Curious, the Lightsworn Dominion 1x Knightmare Unicorn 1x Knightmare Phoenix 1x I:P Masquerena --------- Side Deck: 1x Archnemeses Eschatos 1x Eldlich the Golden Lord 2x Orbital Hydralander 1x The Chaos Creator 1x Shaddoll Beast 1x Shaddoll Dragon 1x Shaddoll Squamata 1x Shaddoll Hedgehog 1x El Shaddoll Construct 1x El Shaddoll Winda 1x Knightmare Gryphon 1x Galaxy Cyclone 1x Shaddoll Fusion 1x Shaddoll Schism

deck_excerpt: No monsters just Tokens  Tokens > Monsters
deck_description: Win condition Defeat your opponent with attack damage The deck The niche about this deck is to test the current viability of using tokens only and no monsters. There have been lots of new releases related to token and token support, enough to actually build a specialised deck. The question of course: "is it viable?", well that's up to the deck and the people wielding and improving the deck. At the moment this token only deck or (T.O.D) for short is more of a control deck than anything else. It has lots of monster effect negation and card destruction. It does really well going first with this deck. There is a new card called "Parasomnia Pillow" that has not been widely released yet, but is available in it's Japanese form which can be played on dueling nexus for the time being as a pre-release. I do believe the equip card has potential to boost the performance of this deck and is great to use on your opponent's monsters. Parasomnia Pillow effect: During the End Phase: You can destroy the equipped monster. If this card is sent to the GY because the equipped monster was destroyed and sent to the GY: Special Summon 1 "Parasomnia Token" (Level 1/ATK ?/DEF 0) with the equipped monster's original Type, Attribute, and ATK, then equip this card to that Token. You can only use each effect of "Parasomnia Pillow" once per turn. Strategy It's always good to have "Pacifis, the Phantasm City" on the field. When summoning any tokens you can then add any "Phantasm Spiral" trap card to your hand, of which is immediately playable. I do believe a lot of people are already aware of the "Brave engine" and how good it is, which does make this deck shine really well. The "Brave engine's" equip spell "Dracoback, the Rideable Dragon" can be used on any token and bounce big extra deck monsters back into the extra deck. Effect rulings on tokens are also slightly different on tokens than on monsters, since they don't go to the GY or can be banished, some effects cannot be used on tokens, for example "Eater of million's" effect. You may want to brush up on effect rulings for tokens. This is by no means a meta deck, but is pretty decent. Hope you have fun!

deck_excerpt: Z-ARC Turbo Deck - Turbo the Supreme King (Master Duel )
deck_description: The ol' Z-ARC deck. The first deck I planned building after coming back to Yugioh 5 years after having duels at school with crazy old cards. Ended up building RDA over it but hey it's whatever.   First decklist I made for a ZARC deck was absolutely abhorrent as I had zero clue what I was doing. When I played with friends, stuff like Blue Eyes was impossible to get over. Took me a while to learn new Yugioh (especially Pendulum) and here I am now with the last version of Z-ARC I'll be making.   《 MAIN DECK 》 ➥ Monsters:  Pretty basic Pendulum Magician stuff but with extras, because this deck is about Z-ARC, not building a board of 8 negates after a 10 minute turn.  Black Fang, White Wing, Purple Poison, Oafdragon, and Wisdom-Eye all at 2. Black Fang / White Wing / Purple Poison can all be scales, but their main purpose is to be material for Z-ARC. We're not running any of the actual Extra Deck requirements for Z-ARC, just the main deck substitutes. Oafdragon as a good low scale, and to grab a card from the ED. Wisdom-Eye is there to place scales as per usual. Astrograph, Chronograph, Darkwurm, Gate Zero, Celestial Magician, Arc Pendulum, Deskbot 001, and O-Lion all at 1. The Sorcerers are pretty obviously there to summon Z-ARC, or be used as Link fodder to send em back to the Extra Deck. Darkwurm can be used as a play starter, using things like Foolish Burial or Dragon Shrine to send it to the GY and then use it's effect to summon it. Gate Zero is a great low scale that also has a decent but not very useful effect when we have Z-ARC out. Deskbot 001 and O-Lion are there for the Halq / Auroradon Synchro combo, but I'll get to that later. Skullcrobat at 3 because it's Skullcrobat, no explanation needed. Free search for a Normal Summon.  ➥ Spells & Traps: Raigeki and Reborn as just basic and useful spells. You can replace these with more handtraps like Veiler or good going second cards like Lightning Storm or Droplet. I just like the cards themselves because they're OG but still useful. Though I have been considering swapping them for Droplet. Pendulum Call and Duelist Alliance as more searches. Pretty basic stuff. Pendulum Call is only at 2 because we do use Pendulum effects decently often with Wisdom Eye and Oafdragon. Star Pendulumgraph for Scale protection and draw power when you bring out Electrumite.  Dragon Shrine and Foolish Burial are here to quickly get either Darkwurm or the Magicians needed for Z-ARC. If you get Dragon Shrine, send Arc Pendulum so the second effect procs and you can send another Dragon, aka Darkwurm. That's why I use Arc Pendulum rather than the original, because it's a Normal monster which means Dragon Shrine can be used at full potential. Imperm is pretty obvious. Just a good negate. You can once again swap it out for whatever else you want.    《 EXTRA DECK 》 ➥ Fusions:  2 Supreme Starving Venom and 1 copy of the main boss itself, Z-ARC. For obvious reasons. Z-ARC is an underrated boss monster. 4K beater, can't be targeted or destroyed, blows up enemy field on summon, and can summon a Starving Venom (or any other Supreme Kings you might be running) whenever it destroys a monster by battle. Only problem with it is how hard it is to summon, but with this deck its fairly easy, and there are other monsters you can go for.  ➥ Synchros:  Herald of the Arc Light is a good negate and also has an effect like Dark Law which banishes stuff instead of them being sent to the GY. This alone counters a ton of decks, especially meta decks like Drytron or Admancipator, which use their GY as a field of its own with tons of effects. It also has the Stardust Dragon tribute-to-negate effect. Wonder Magician is a free card pop (can be used on your scales like Double Iris to grab a Pendulumgraph). Borreload Savage is there for obvious reasons, it's THE best generic Synchro atm and not much will change that.  ➥ XYZ: Utopic Future and Draco Future are there for when you get 2 Timestars or a Bagooska on the field. Overlay them for a good negator that can't be destroyed and has a decent body + stealing potential. Timestar is there pretty obviously to search for your Magicians. Bagooska is for when you either get negated, have a bad hand, or don't want to play through a Maxx C.  ➥ Links: Halqifibrax is the heart the Synchro combo. Electrumite is a must in any Pendulum Magician deck. It makes Astrograph basically always be on your field, can destroy a card for an effect like Double Iris, gives you draw power, and has good Arrows.  Auroradon is there, once again, for the synchro combo. Spawns tokens on summon, tributes itself and 1 token to summon O-Lion.    Apollousa is the best Link monster negate and is easy to make, with generic materials. Once per CHAIN negate??? Of course Apollousa is in here. If you don't want another negate, use something like Accesscode or Borrelsword.   《 SIDE DECK 》 ➥ You can run DPE instead of the Synchro combo package if you want, I just don't run it because I don't find it fun.   That's about it, Z-ARC is one of my favorite cards and while this deck might not be too competitive, it is incredibly fun thinking of all the combos and managing all the needed Magicians to big brain Z-ARC out as fast as possible.
a

Melffys are one of my favorite archetypes, unfortunate it's not very good but it is fun to play :)  The chain I would go for to start off:  Rescue Cat (Obedience Schooled or Nimble Beaver)  -> summon Melffy Catty & Melffy Puppy -> XYZ summon into Melffy of the Forest -> search for Melffy Hide-and-Seek, Melffy Tag, or Playhouse  In the case of Ash Blossom, use Obedience Schooled and continue the chain as normal. You could go into Joyous Melffys instead of Melffy of the Forest if you have Melffy Hide-and-Seek or Melffy Tag. Once you have Melffys of the Forset on the field you can go into Joyous Melffys. Joyous is nice for its quick effect allowing you to special summon monsters from the graveyard. The best targets to go for are Melffy Catty, Melffy Puppy, and Kalantosa, Mystical Beast of the Forest. Melffy Catty allows you to search cards from the deck, Melffy Puppy allows you to summon from your deck, and Kalantosa allows you to destroy one of your opponent's cards. Kalantosa is one main way to get rid of cards in this deck. Alpha, the Master of Beast is a quick way to get a powerful 3000 ATK monster out on the field with the benefit of returning cards to your opponent's hand. It's one of the best cards due to its ease of summoning and ability to get rid of cards with protection.  Have fun running this deck :)

deck_excerpt: P.U.N.K. with the Halq line, semi-budget
deck_description: This deck makes the Halqifibrax line very consistently while going plus off of many of the interactions.  The starters are Sharakusai and Ze Amin, or Foxy Tune, Ogre Dance, or Emergency Teleport, which can all search the first two P.U.N.K.s mentioned. Sharakusai with any P.U.N.K. in hand turns into Rising Carp, which then turns into two level three P.U.N.K.s (usually Ze Amin if you haven't already used her, or Madame Spider and Wa Gon). If you started with Ze Amin instead, search Foxy Tune if you haven't already used it, or any level 3 P.U.N.K. if you have. Now that you have two tuners on the field, go into Halq, summon 001, then into Aurorodon, summoning back 001. From here, go into One of the two Cupid Pitch's, increasing the level by one. Then summon our Coltwing from deck using Aurorodon, summoning back 001. Go into your second Cupid Pitch, decreasing its level by one. Now you can make Borreload Savage Dragon, and F.A. Dawn Dragster or Clear Wing Fast Dragon. Remember to use Cupid Pitch's effect to search a monster with 600 Def from deck (all of our level 3 P.U.N.K.s meet this condition). Remember to activate your P.U.N.K. effects to search for cards, like Madame Spider and Wa Gon.     At this point, your graveyard is pretty full so you can use a Pot of Avarice to net two more cards. Its very possible that you still haven't normal summoned, and if so we can either normal a Sharakusai to Synch off into an Amazing Dragon or Psychic End Punisher during the opponents turn, or use our Sharakusai to extend further if we have not yet used his effect. In that case, we can make Rising Carp, using Carp to search a level 3 P.U.N.K. and Deer Note. Synch these two into Chaos Ruler, using Chaos Ruler's effect to search and Deer Note's effect to bring back Sharakusai which we can Synch off with Chaos Ruler during the opponent's turn.

deck_excerpt: Summon the Power of Blue-Eyes in this Specially crafted deck.
deck_description: A powerful but also vulnerable Deck build. Its primary purpose is the summoning and control of Blue-eyes White Dragons and Blue-Eyes Shining Dragon. This is accomplished through the use of Maiden's with eyes of Blue and both White Stone variants. Its protections come marginally from spell and traps. Instead its primary field protections are in the summon and use of its synchro summon Azure-Eyes. Not a deck for beginner's nor for tournament play. For as many strengths and plays as this deck has it is constructed with just as many exploits and weaknesses. Its design set to challenge opponents and inspire them to come back for another try.

deck_name: Zombie World Control Post Dimension Force
deck_description: Zombie game plan using the new Dimension Force Support

Thought I'd share this since I found it when I went looking for my old physical cards to sleeve the rarer ones. No this is not a good deck and no it was not made with the banlist in mind (younger me would have probably thought you where lying when you told him that Pot of Greed was banned from play or that you where only allowed one monster reborn) so there are some issues there. Although I do still think that some of these old school cards could work in other decks (namely D.D. Scout Plane and Sacred Crane.) It did have some changes made to it around 2012 when Legendary Collection 3 released so this is the final form of it. Judging from the cards I picked for it I think the idea is to summon big beaters like the Summoned Skull, Guardian Eatos or Black Luster Soldier and attack for game with some consistency from Sacred Crane, Pot of Greed and Witch of the Black Forest (I have Sangan in it as well but forgot to put it in the when I used the deck builder) in order to thin the deck and get what I need.

deck_excerpt: Red Dragon Archfiend Deck & Swordsoul Engine - Master Duel
deck_description: Experimental RDA deck using Swordsouls. I'll update it in the future but this is what I have for now. Aside from the basic Resonators, Swordsoul can work as an engine on its own in this deck and it isn't nearly as Ash prone as the Assault Mode engine. Assault Mode also requires a normal summon while Swordsouls can pretty easily special summon themselves. They also have really strong synchros that work pretty well with Red Dragons gameplay wise, since Chixiao is another negate to stack with Abyss and Chengying will gain a ton of attack because of Red Reign and Supernova.

deck_name: Dark Warrior Deck List & Combo For The May 2022 Format
deck_excerpt: This is a Dark Warrior deck list and combo for the May 2022 format.
deck_description:
Combo

Hand
  • A Hero Lives
Board
  • Dark Requiem XYZ Dragon
  • The Phantom Knights of Rusty Bardiche
  • Destiny HERO - Destroyer Phoenix Enforcer
  • Predaplant Verta Anaconda
  • Artifact Scythe (Set)
  • Phantom Knights' Fog Blade (Set)
Notes
  • 4 monster negtates.
  • Destroy one card during your opponent's main phase.
  • Prevent your opponent from using their extra deck.
  • Can also special summon The Phantom Knights of Break Sword and Dark Rebellion XYZ Dragon from your graveyard if Dark Requiem XYZ Dragon's effect is used three times.
  • This is also a two card combo that can be done with Vision HERO Vyon, Elemental HERO Stratos, Armageddon Knight, or Dark Grepher, and any extender.
Steps
  1. Activate A Hero Lives. Special summon Elemental HERO Stratos from the deck.
  2. Activate Elemental HERO Stratos, search Vision HERO Vyon.
  3. Normal summon Vision HERO Vyon.
  4. Activate Vision HERO Vyon, send Elemental HERO Shadow Mist from the deck to the graveyard.
  5. Since Elemental HERO Shadow Mist was sent to the graveyard, activate it to search Destiny HERO - Malicious.
  6. Activate Vision HERO Vyon's second effect, banish Elemental HERO Shadow Mist from the graveyard, search Polymerization.
  7. Link into Isolde, Two Tales of the Noble Knights (Elemental HERO Stratos + Vision HERO Vyon) into the extra monster zone.
  8. Activate Isolde, Two Tales of the Noble Knights, search Vision HERO Vyon or any dark warrior monster that will not be used.
  9. Activate Isolde, Two Tales of the Noble Knights, send 4 equip cards including Divine Sword - Phoenix Blade from the deck to the graveyard to special summon Armageddon Knight from the deck.
  10. Activate Armageddon Knight, send The Phantom Knights of Ancient Cloak to the graveyard.
  11. Activate Polymerization, fusion summon Destiny HERO - Dangerous (Destiny HERO - Malicious + The Other Vision HERO Vyon or Dark Warrior).
  12. Banish two warrior monsters to add Divine Sword - Phoenix Blade from the graveyard to the hand.
  13. Activate Destiny HERO - Dangerous, discard Divine Sword - Phoenix Blade to send Destiny HERO - Denier from the deck to the graveyard.
  14. Banish Destiny HERO - Malicious from the graveyard to special summon a copy of itself from the deck.
  15. Link summon into The Phantom Knights of Rusty Bardiche (Armageddon Knight + Destiny HERO - Dangerous + Destiny HERO - Malicious) in Isolde, Two Tales of the Noble Knight's bottom right arrow.
  16. Since Destiny HERO - Malicious is the graveyard, special summon Destiny HERO - Denier from the graveyard by its own effect.
  17. Activate Destiny HERO - Denier, add the banished Destiny HERO - Malicious to the top of the deck.
  18. Link summon into Artifact Dagda (Isolde, Two Tales of the Noble Knights + Destiny HERO - Denier) into the extra monster zone.
  19. Activate The Phantom Knights of Rusty Bardiche, then since a card effect was activate on the field, activate Artifact Dagda.
  20. Artifact Dagda will resolve first on a separate chain link to set Artifact Scythe from the deck.
  21. The Phantom Knights of Rusty Bardiche will resolve last, send The Phantom Knights of Torn Scales from the deck to the graveyard, then set Phantom Knights' Rank-Up Magic Force from the deck.
  22. Banish The Phantom Knights of Ancient Cloak from the graveyard to search The Phantom Knights of Silent Boots.
  23. Since a Phantom Knights card was banished from your graveyard, special summon The Phantom Knights of Torn Scales from the graveyard by its own effect.
  24. Banish two warrior monsters to add Divine Sword - Phoenix Blade from the graveyard to the hand.
  25. Activate The Phantom Knight of Torn Scales, discard Divine Sword - Phoenix Blade, send The Phantom Knights of Ragged Gloves from the deck to the graveyard.
  26. Since you control another Phantom Knight monster, special summon The Phantom Knights of Silent Boots from the hand.
  27. XYZ summon into The Phantom Knights of Break Sword (The Phantom Knights of Torn Scales + The Phantom Knights of Silent Boots) to the right arrow to The Phantom Knights of Rusty Bardiche.
  28. Since a Dark XYZ monster was summoned to an arrow that The Phantom Knights of Rusty Bardiche points to, activate its effect to destroy The Phantom Knights of Break Sword.
  29. Since The Phantom Knights of Break Sword was destroy, activate its effect to special summon The Phantom Knight of Torn Scales and The Phantom Knights of Ragged Gloves from the graveyard. Both of those monsters are now level 4.
  30. XYZ summon into Dark Rebellion XYZ Dragon (The Phantom Knights of Torn Scales + The Phantom Knights of Ragged Gloves).
  31. Banish Destiny HERO - Malicious from the graveyard to special summon the copy that was shuffled back into the deck.
  32. Link summon into Predaplant Verte Anaconda (Artifact Dagda + Destiny HERO - Malicious) into the extra monster zone.
  33. Activate Predaplant Verta Anaconda, send Fusion Destiny from the deck to the graveyard to fusion summon into Destiny HERO - Destroyer Phoenix Enforcer (Destiny HERO - Dasher + Destiny HERO - Celestial).
  34. Banish The Phantom Knights of Silent Boots from the graveyard to search Phantom Knights' Fog Blade. Then set it.
  35. During your opponent's standby phase, activate Destiny HERO - Destroyer Phoenix Enforcer, destroy itself and Artifact Scythe.
  36. Since Artifact Scythe was set and sent to the graveyard during your opponent's turn, activate its effect to special summon itself from the graveyard, then activate effects to prevent your opponent from special summoning monsters from the extra deck for the rest of the turn.
  37. Activate Destroy HERO - Destroyer Phoenix Enforcer destruction effect to revive itself during the next standby phase.
  38. During your opponent's main phase, activate Phantom Knights Rank Up Magic Force, banish 1 Dark monster from the graveyard, XYZ summon into Dark Requiem XYZ Dragon by using Dark Rebellion XYZ Dragon as the material. The summon will be to the right arrow of The Phantom Knights of Rusty Bardiche.
  39. Since a Dark XYZ monster was summoned to an arrow that The Phantom Knights of Rusty bardiche points to, activate its effect to destroy one card on the field.
