My Eldlich Deck.

Fluffal is a deck that I've always wanted to learn since the excellent supports it received in the Rise of the Duelist collection, especially the new combos involving Fluffal Dolphin that allows you to reuse the Toy Vendor several times in the same turn. Other Archetype cards that catch my attention are Edge Imp Scythe and Cruel Whale because they are the only way for Fluffal to interact in the opponent's turn via the engine. This is an underrated deck mainly because in the last few years since its last supports players have focused on a unique Win Condition for when the deck goes first like making True King of All Calamities (VFD) and Artifact Scythe lock. Of course, when you resolve these cards victory is practically guaranteed but the Fluffal engine itself has the potential to make End Boards with many versatile interactions without having to resort to cards that end up on the Banlist sooner or later. VFD has been banned for a long time and Artifact Scythe is next on the list, so the way I'm going to present what Fluffal gameplay I consider the safest because no matter what the next banlist is this deck will continue with the same power level as long as many other decks in the meta will take heavy hits which will lower their powercreep relative to Fluffal. I had already made a presentation of the deck in Fusion format: https://ygoprodeck.com/fluffal-fusion-format-may22/ and basically this is the continuation of how the deck plays in Traditional format. Of course, combos and things I said in that format are also valid for this one, but as the extra deck is not restricted, you can do more advanced combos. //////////////////////////////////////////////// Combos: Let's start with small card combinations that complement the combos I talked about in the previous profile deck: //////////////////////////////////////////////// Combo 1: Dog + Patchwork (Blind Second OTK) NS Fluffal Dog and eff Add Fluffal Sheep Activate Frightfur Patchwork Add Polymerization and Edge Imp Chain SS Sheep and eff return Dog to Hand and SS Edge Imp Chain LINK-2 Cross-Sheep and Edge Imp Chain eff Add Frightfur Fusion Activate Frightfur Fusion summon Frightfur Kraken(banish Sheep and Edge Imp Chain) Activate Polymerization Fusion Sabre-Tooth(same Zone Cross-Sheep)(using Kraken and Dog) Sabre-Tooth eff Reborn Kraken cl1 and Cross-Sheep eff Reborn Dog cl2 https://www.duelingbook.com/replay?id=813757-37309876 Gamestate: Cross-Sheep + Dog + Saber-Tooth + Kragen = 10400damage //////////////////////////////////////////////// Combo 2: (Dog + Edge Imp Chain) + Random Discard (Blind Second) NS Fluffal Dog and eff Add Fluffal Bear and eff discard to GY to Set Toy Vendor from Deck Activate Toy Vendor and eff Discard Edge Imp Chain to DRAW 1 and Special or Discard Edge Imp Chain eff Add Frightfur Patchwork and Activate Patchwork Add Polymerization and Edge Imp Sabres Activate Polymerization and Fusion Cruel Whale (using Dog and Sabres and [Summon in the Middle Zone Column]) Cruel Whale eff Destroy Toy Vendor and Opponent's Card ***Toy Vendor eff Add Fluffal Dolphin and Cruel Whale eff tgt itself send Frightfur Repair to GY Frightfur Repair eff banish from GY to Special Dolphin from Hand Dolphin eff Set Toy Vendor and Foolish Fluffal Wings Activate Toy Vendor and eff Random discard to DRAW 1 and Special or Discard Wings eff banish itself and Bear from GY to DRAW 2 and Send Toy Vendor to GY and Toy Vendor eff Add Fluffal Sheep SS Sheep from Hand and eff Return Dolphin SS Edge Imp Chain from GY LINK-2 Cross-Sheep and Edge Imp Sabres eff Reborn from GY(zone Cross-Sheep points to) and Cross-Sheep eff Reborn Dog To finish the OTK you have several ways: If you have Polymerization = Fusion Frightfur Kraken using Dog and Sabers (Kraken Attack Twice) If you use LINK-4 other than Apollousa: you can do Borrelsword Dragon or Knightmare Unicorn and then Accesscode Talker. https://www.duelingbook.com/replay?id=813757-38957033 Gamestate: Cruel Whale + Cross Sheep + Dog + Edge Imp Sabers /in Hand: 1 DRAW + Dolphin /Total DRAWS: 4 DRAWS, two of which depends on luck because they were made with Toy Vendor I could make this combo even better if I had access to Fluffal Penguin because one thing I noticed when doing Test Hands of Fluffal was that you only reach the apex of Fluffal's deck when you manage to solve Toy Vendor at least twice and Reborn from GY's Penguin with Cross-Sheep or Frightfur Repair to extend plays by Special Summoning Fluffal Monsters from the hand you added with Toy Vendor or being extremely lucky to draw the right cards at the right time, which rarely happens. //////////////////////////////////////////////// Discussion about these two Combos: From these combos it can be seen that in both I had to play (Dog + Edge Imp Chain) and what changed was the choice of what to add to the hand with Fluffal Dog: between choosing to add Fluffal Bear or choosing Fluffal Sheep. I've come to the conclusion that making the Edge Imp Chain eff trigger move with Fluffal Bear set Toy Vendor to discard it will be the best option in most situations because triggering Toy Vendor multiple times in the same turn guarantees you to build solid plays and that rely less on luck as you add the Fluffal Monster you need at that gamestate with Toy Vendor. For example you can make Frightfur Tiger by destroying the Toy Vendor and adding Fluffal Dolphin and if you have an Extender you bring the Dolphin to the field and set the Toy Vendor by sending Fluffal Wings or Edge Imp Sabres to the GY and generate even more advantage. So most of the time Fluffal's problem to continue playing is just putting the Toy Vendor Search on the field because when you manage to do that you reach the apex of the deck. Playing with Fluffal Sheep is only worthwhile when you already have Fluffal Penguin in hand because you will make Cross-Sheep very early in the combo using Edge Imp Chain material and then Fusion Summon using Penguin as material that will be Reborn of the GY with Cross-Sheep allowing you to Extend moves. But even so, you are faced with the dilemma of having to draw a Dolphin or something similar to continue after Fusion Summon so in practice comboing through Toy Vendor is always better for taking the randomness of miraculous Draws to continue playing since you have several one-offs in the deck that just want to add to the hand at the right time. //////////////////////////////////////////////// That said, if the problem is that you can extend the plays after the Toy Vendor Search and put the monster on the table by Special Summoning from the hand, then how to increase the chance of making your combo work? Basically you have three ways via the Fluffal engine to Special Summon your hand monsters: Fluffal Penguin, Toy Vendor and Frightfur Repair. Thinking only of turn 1 deck plays, the only ways to resolve the extender Frightfur Repair would be: - you use the Edge Imp Chain combo to Add Repair for the hand and the Cruel Whale sends a Fusion to the GY - hard draw her and you have a lot of Draw effects for that and then send a Fusion to GY - or send it straight from the deck to the GY with Cruel Whale or discard it to resolve cards like Toy Vendor and Penguin. The Toy Vendor is a Extender of Special Summon from Hand that by itself depends on luck to resolve because you need to DRAW a Fluffal Monster to be able to Special Summon it. However, there is a way via the engine to make this effect always resolve: use Edge Imp Sabres eff to return a Fluffal Monster to the top of the deck. And Fluffal Penguin will be an Extender whenever you summon a different copy of it to the field, so it's the easiest of the three to resolve in theory. The problem is you can bring him to the field because the easiest way would be for you to Fusion Summon using Penguin as material and use Cross-Sheep to Reborn Penguin. However, the Fluffal engine in the pure version cannot Cross-Sheep before Fusion Summon most of the time because you only start the turn by putting two monsters on the field as follows: - Use Fluffal Sheep eff to return a Fluffal monster like Fluffal Dog to the hand and bring an "Edge Imp" monster instead - Be lucky enough to use the Toy Vendor effect and hit a Fluffal Monster to Special Summon ANY monster in your hand. So you're faced with having to do Cross-Sheep only towards the end of the Combo when you've already done Fusion Summon and to trigger your Reborn effect you have to use Edge Imp Chain eff on the GY as I showed in Combo 2 and that's not it's very efficient because again we get into the story of you needing to get out of inertia to use this effect but the opponent's interactions will stop you most of the time. Anyway, using Frightfur Repair as an Extender depends on what your play is going on, so there's no guarantee you'll always access it, especially since it's a one-off card. As for Fluffal Penguin and Toy Vendor, you maximize the number of copies in the deck to make sure you can use them during your combos. After all this fuss comes the point I want to make about how to increase the consistency of the deck to use your main extenders (Toy Vendor and Fluffal Penguin) in the best possible way: - We have to use Extenders from outside the archetype which are the examples of Main Deck and Side Deck cards that I put just to discuss this subject: - Eldlich the Golden Lord that has excellent synergy with Toy Vendor and is still a body on the field to make Cross-Sheep as soon as possible making it the second best generic Enabler card option for the Fluffal deck. - In the Side Deck I put more examples of cards that function as a body on the field to make Cross-Sheep: Hand Traps that not only interact with the opponent but also stay on the field like Nibiru, the Primal Being, Token Collector and Fantastical Dragon Phantazmay. But the suspense I leave is to present the best generic Enabler card option for the Fluffal deck: Magicians' Souls and Illusion of Chaos package. This engine does the same role as the Golden Lord of interacting with Toy Vendor and Cross-Sheep only in a much better way: - You now have a second way to stack the top of the deck with a Fluffal monster to take the Toy Vendor eff randomness out of Draw ensuring you will Special Summon it. - Second that you pay the discard of the activation of the Toy Vendor's Draw effect with the Illusion of Chaos itself that you didn't return to the top of the deck. - Thirdly, Magicians' Souls will enter the field to be half of the Cross-Sheep apart from not being able to do it early in the combo. - Room that like the Golden Lord you send the Toy Vendor to the GY to buy cards at the same time you get a Search. - Fifth it is Dark attribute so it's half a Dharc the Dark Charmer, Gloomy to make moves to force interactions like stealing the Destroyer Phoenix Enforcer from the opponent's GY. In short, using 2 Magicians' Souls + 3 Illusion of Chaos is mandatory in any competitive Fluffal build currently, I'm just not using it because this is a version I tested before I understood the importance of the Souls package in the deck. So you've just discovered the best deck in the game to abuse the Illusion of Chaos package. ///////////////////////////////////////////////Test Hands: These are some replays I did about my progression in learning how to use Fluffal in the best way possible. At that time I still used Fluffal Owl in the deck so that's why I left it in the Side Deck to comment on this fact, I also used 3 Polymerization but I saw that these two cards weren't that good in the deck because you don't Fusion Summon that much to win games. These test hands are not didactic, so many times I had to go back a move because it wasn't the best option. And there are times that in the random draws of cards like Fluffal Penguin and Fluffal Wings I added from the deck to the hand instead of buying because I already knew the draws that would be because this is an improved version of the test hand compared to the original I had made with the same Opening Hand and that I had realized that I made a move wrong and this is the final version of the best way to make each combo. One thing that is clear in these replays is that they take away any doubts anyone might have about wanting to play Fluffal Blind Second because they think turn 1 of the deck is weak when in fact you can always setup at least 3 interactions, including Edge Imp Scythe + Fluffal Penguin and Bahamut Shark bringing Toadally Awesome and also the interaction of I:P Masquerena. I'm not one to make Apollousa turn 1, I prefer the versatility of I:P Masquerena that can either become an Apollousa on the opponent's turn or a Knightmare Unicorn. I only do Apollousa on turn 1 in combos where I've Special Summoned so much that I need to clear my field to have room for other plays and that's exactly Apollousa's role in most decks in the game: turning multiple monsters that are doing nothing on the field in an omni negate making room for you to do more atrocities. /////////////////////////////////////////////// https://www.duelingbook.com/replay?id=813757-38832002 TEST HAND 1 Penguins Garden + (Edge Imp Chain + Dog) + Octopus = Cross-Sheep + I:P Masquerena + Penguin /in Hand: Edge Imp Scythe But I could have done it differently: 1 - Use Penguins Garden to discard Edge Imp Chain 2 - Give NS from Fluffal Penguin and SS Dog to Add Dolphin (but this move really needs Sheep to work so this turns out to be the best way to play) *3 - Replay error: I had already used the Dog effect so I had to bring the Octopus straight and I had to fix this move. /////////////////////////////////////////////// https://www.duelingbook.com/replay?id=813757-38832768 TEST HAND 2 Dog + Wings + Dolphin + Polymerization + Patchwork I hit Toy Vendor allowing SS to Dolphin and DRAW Penguin + Scythe and Add Octopus Dolphin send Edge Imp Sabers Set Toy Vendor and Activate Patchwork Add Edge Imp Chain Cruel Whael Fusion move and first use Frightfur Repair effect for Reborn Penguin and Bahamut Shark + Toad and then Cross-Sheep Edge Imp Sabers play + Toy Vendor and Cross-Sheep Reborn Penguin / Toy Vendor discard Scythe and SS Octopus and Add Scythe to Hand I:P Masquerena + Abyss Dweller /////////////////////////////////////////////// https://www.duelingbook.com/replay?id=813757-38833408 TEST HAND 3 Toy Vendor + Patchwork + Edge Imp Sabers + 2 Penguins ***Fusion Frightfur Tiger to destroy your own Toy Vendor to make Dolphin send Wings Combo. LUCK: Buy Sheep = allows you to reach Cross-Sheep for you to then play Edge Imp Sabers + Toy Vendor Reborn GY's Penguin with Cross-Sheep and brought Dolphin to the hand and make Bahamut Shark and then made Toy Vendor buy Penguin to have the missing Octopus summon extender to add Edge Imp Scythe back to the hand. /////////////////////////////////////////////// https://www.duelingbook.com/replay?id=813757-38833944 TEST HAND 4 (Dog + Edge Imp Chain) + Scythe + Wings + Repair LUCK: I hit the Toy Vendor DRAW Penguin and was able to Special Summon Edge Imp Chain and make LINK-2 Cross-Sheep and add Patchwork Big Brain: Making Tiger Destroys Patchwork and Reborn Penguin and Search Dolphin Do Dolphin eff send Octopus because it had Repair in Hand and Bahamut Shark + Toad and Reborn Octopus Add Scythe to Hand Wings Combo = Toy Vendor Add Sheep = Lambda END BOARD: Cross-Sheep + I:P Masquerena + Lambda + Toad /in Hand: Octopus + Scythe + Penguin /in GY: Repair + Edge Imp Sabers /////////////////////////////////////////////// https://www.duelingbook.com/replay?id=813757-38834453 TEST HAND 5 (Toy Vendor + (Bear + Edge Imp Chain) + Penguin + Scythe) Make play Tiger and destroy Toy Vendor at the same time DRAW 2 Discard 1 Toy Vendor Add Dolphin and Dolphin combo with Wings and Add Sheep = Cross-Sheep while returning Dolphin to the hand Edge Imp Sabers eff Reborn from GY and Cross-Sheep eff Reborn Penguin and Penguin eff to make Bahamut Shark + Toad END BOARD: Cross-Sheep + I:P Masquerena + Tiger + Toad /in Hand: Edge Imp Scythe + Toy Vendor /////////////////////////////////////////////// https://www.duelingbook.com/replay?id=813757-38834899 TEST HAND 6 Gamma + Dog + (Penguin + Patchwork) + Polymerization Add Scythe to guarantee Fusion Summon play on the opponent's turn and gave Redundant Draws with Penguin I did Normal Summon Dog and Add Octopus to Special and Add Scythe to Hand. END Board: Lambda + Octopus /in Hand: Scythe and Follow Ups. If I had negated a Hand Trap with Gamma: Cross-Sheep and changed it to (Tiger move destroys Toy Vendor) Dog = Bear = Toy Vendor and destroy to add Dolphin and Penguin comes back from GY with Cross-Sheep to bring Dolphin from hand and you do Full Combo. /////////////////////////////////////////////// https://www.duelingbook.com/replay?id=813757-38835398 TEST HAND 7 Gamma + (Penguin Garden + Owl) + Scythe + Repair LUCK: Penguin DRAWS = Wings + Toy Vendor LINK-2 Lambda and Repair eff Reborn Penguin and plays Fluffal Wings and Toy Vendor LUCK: DRAW Foolish Burial Goods and Search Dolphin Dolphin Send Played Edge Imp Sabers and Bahamut Shark + Toad Foolish Burial Goods = Octopus and Edge Imp Sabers return Octopus and Toy Vendor DRAW and Special it to Add Edge Imp Scythe back to Hand End Board: Lambda + Toad + I:P Masquerena + Octopus + Toy Vendor /in Hand: Scythe + Gamma /in GY: Penguin + Edge Imp Sabers + Repair /////////////////////////////////////////////// https://www.duelingbook.com/replay?id=813757-38848897 TEST HAND 8 Toy Vendor + (Bear + Edge Imp Chain + Penguis Garden) + Driver I used Dolphin as a fusion material because I wanted to return one of the Polymerizations to the deck and have a valid target to activate Patchwork on the next turn. Whenever you use Edge Imp Scythe as a Fusion material, it's because you've already thought about adding it back to the hand with Fluffal Octopus whose main function is exactly to leave Scythe + Penguin's play alive on the opponent's turn. I made a mistake in order to bring Dog into the field as I needed to bring Octopus as a priority. END Board: Apollousa(24ATK) + I:P Masquerena + Toad + Edge Imp Chain /in Hand: Scythe /in GY: Sabers + Dolphin + Penguin + Repair + Toy Vendor ///////////////////////////////////////////// Final explanation about some Cards: Always summon the Fusion Monster in Middle Zone because that zone Cross-Sheep will ever points to. Speaking of monster zones always summon Eldlich the Golden Lord or Magicians' Souls in the Extra Monster Zones Column to avoid conflict with Cross-Sheep. /////////////////////Main Deck Cards: Fluffal Octopus will grant you the Edge Imp Scythe back to the hand if you had to discard it for the GY or use it as Fusion Material and even Add Fluffal Sheep to the hand and Special and return the Octopus to the hand to bring an "Edge Imp" monster from the GY. And if you bring him in on your opponent's turn with Cross-Sheep you continue to add GY Monsters to your hand for free. An interesting thing about the effect when used as a Fusion Material is that you in addition to returning Fluffal Wings or Edge Imp Sabres (used as Frightfur Fusion material) to the GY you can also return any other Banished Monster like Psy-Frame Driver to the GY and the Gamma will come alive again. Royal Penguins Garden Continuous Spell allows you to do 2 card Full Combo because it adds Fluffal Penguin on activation and can decrease Penguin Level to discard a card and we have great discards like Toy Vendor and Edge Imp Chain. For example with Edge Imp Chain Add Frightfur Patchwork and Add Polymerization and Scythe/Sabres. The same goes for Toy Vendor that you discard and Add Fluffal Dolphin to make a move to set it back and send Fluffal Wings to the GY. The only downside is not being able to do Bahamut Shark because it becomes Level 3 but even that is easy to get around by doing Fusion Summon it goes back to Level 4 and just Reborn with Cross-Sheep for example to make Bahamut + Toad. Being a Spell in the s/t Zone you take advantage of cards like Forbidden Droplet and Eldlich the Golden Lord and Magicians' Souls by sending it to the GY for free. Phantazmay is a good card in the deck because drawing two cards will allow you to leave Edge Imp Scythe alive on your opponent's turn to make Cruel Whale and basically you get two Monsters on the field with one protecting your cards from being targeted. /////////////////////Deck interactions with Artifact Scythe for anyone who wants to use it: Another interesting interaction of Fluffal Octopus is with Artifact Scythe taking Cosmic Cyclone and you make Cruel Whale using it as material then you return Scythe to GY and destroy Artifact Dagda with Cruel Whale for even after Cosmic Cyclone manages to lock it Extra Deck. Artifact Scythe even if you hard draw him you can fearlessly discard to GY because you can just pass with Artifact Dagda and on the opponent's turn Edge Imp Scythe summon Cruel Whale to pop Dagda and trigger eff to Reborn Artifact Scythe and lock opponent's from use Extra Deck anyways. /////////////////////Extra Deck Cards: One thing some people don't know about Cross-Sheep is that you don't have to specifically Summon an Extra Deck Monster type and have to trigger eff because any monster that you Special Summon in a zone it points to already triggers its effect if you have a Fusion Monster in the other Zone it points to you will Reborn a Level 4 or lower GY Monster in the same way. Abyss Dweller has secret 500ATK Boost effect that no one remembers when using a WATER monster as Xyz Material so your fusions like Cruel Whale and kraken become even stronger with Abyss Dweller on the field. One Extra Deck card that I'm definitely thinking about taking out to play a competitive version of Fluffal is Sabre-Tooth because I've never had to so it's just taking the place of a more useful card. I would instead use cards like Dragostapelia for Super Polymerization, or Bagooska which is giant at times when you need to buy time in the game, test Guardian Chimera in place or put a LINK-4 ending games like Accesscode Talker. /////////////////////Explanation some Side Deck cards: I'm not using Verte Anaconda because it's pretty clear that this card will be banned and this deck doesn't have the absurd fusion spell of strong and boss monsters at the level of Destroyer Phoenix Enforcer and Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon. Speaking of DPE, using it in this deck doesn't make any sense because you're just trying to do what a lot of competitive decks do only worse. The best target to use Super Polymerization in the deck would be to use Dragostapelia given the popularity of Fusion monsters in the format and you don't have much room in the extra deck to put more than one Super Poly target. Guardian Chimera is an insane card for Fusion decks and in this deck you even get protection while you have Polymerization in the GY and you use generic materials to make it so we can use cards like Eldlich the Golden Lord and Psy-Framegear Gamma as Fusion Material. ////////////////////////////////////////////// Disregard the Side Deck, these are just examples of cards I've used to discuss their use in the deck.

deck_excerpt: An Exodia Deck to be played in Edison format (March 2010 banlist), based on drawing and blocking.
deck_description: Hi fellow Exodia players here's a decklist I used to run in 2010, which nowadays is referred to as Edison Format (using March 2010 banlist). This version of the Exodia deck focuses on blocking the opponent attacks and drawing lots of cards until you get the 5 pieces in your hand. Almost all monsters are to be set in face-down DEF position, exception made for the Cyber Valley which has to be summoned in ATK position (and the 5 pieces of Exodia, of course). Lots of spells and traps focus on preventing or defending from attacks, while the rest are for drawing and searching the 5 pieces. The deck must be exactly 40 cards in order not to lower the probability to draw the 5 pieces. A couple of simple combos: - Reckless Greed must not be used until you can activate 2 or 3 simultaneously (to skip only 2 draw phases, but drawing 4 or 6 cards) or, alternatively, in desperate situations. - The Dark Door works really well with Scrap-Iron Scarecrow and Shield Wing, but of course it's quite easy for the opponent to get rid of this combo since it's sufficient to remove a continuos spell which is easy. This combo will probably let us gain a few turns. Side Deck analysis: - Crystal Seer is the most valid monster we kept outside the deck, so it might be added if necessary cycle through the deck faster - A 3rd Shield Wing if the first two are not enough, but it's also very likely that instead we could reduce from 2 to 1 in the main deck (needs testing) - Messenger of Peace is the most valid spell we kept outside the deck, so it might be added if necessary to defend more - Burial From a Different Dimension is a desperate partial remedy in case the opponent manages to banish some pieces - Pot of Avarice is a desperate partial remedy in case the opponent manages to make us discard some pieces - Starlight Road could very likely be moved directly in the Main Deck, but depends on how frequently the opponents use board wipes, is a very valid trap - The Transmigration Prophecy is analogous to the Pot of Avarice - Royal Oppression has to be used with opponents making a lot of special summonings - Bottomless Trap Hole is for stopping decks with combos relying on specific monsters A variant of this deck is possible as follows: Remove: - 3x Scrap-Iron Scarecrow - 3x The Dark Door - 2x Shield Wing Add: - 3x Messenger of Peace - 3x Jar of Greed (or alternative cards as 1 Magical Mallet and/or 1 Starlight Road and 1/2 good card(s) from the suggested list) - 2x Crystal Seer It substitutes a defending combo with a single slightly stronger defensive card and puts more effort into drawing cards. A few extra useful cards: Monsters: - Vortex Trooper (another valid monster to draw some cards, but has some drawbacks) - Deep Diver (theoretically good, but too slow since you need to wait the end of the battle phase and the card goes on top, therefore "blocks" the next draw phase) - Battle Fader (not awesome since only prevents direct attacks, but still ends the battle phase) - Treeborn Frog (could work well with The Dark Door, but the Shield Wing si simply better) Spells: - Giant Trunade (could turn out to be useful in case lots of opponents use many offensive spells and traps, but we do not attack so having them to set defences is going to block them and we don't want to help remove them) - Heavy Storm (probably even worst than Giant Trunade since it also destroys our own spells and traps) - Card Trader (apparently good, but actually quite slow) - Nightmare's Steelcage (probably too much since we have Swords of Revealing Light, but still a very valid option) - Magical Mallet (one of the best alternative to Reload, Card Trader, Card Destruction since you can choose which cards to recycle, but still it's a -1 in hand) Traps: - Jar of Greed (could easily add a x3 of this one to reinforce the Legacy of Yata-Garasu, simply there were more important cards to add as defences) - Waboku (good to gain 1 turn, prevents all possible attacks risks) - Threatening Roar (alternative to Waboku, prevent all possible attacks) - Defense Draw (not perfect, only saves you from 1 attack, doesn't protect the monster, but lets you draw 1 card) - Magic Cylinder (strong, but we don't care about damaging the opponent) - Dimensional Prison (only stops 1 attack) - Fiendish Chain (maybe) Please leave some comments to let me know what your think and keep playing this wonderful format!

deck_name: Swordsoul Tenyi Diamond I Master Duel
deck_excerpt: Master Duel Diamond 1 40 card swordsoul tenyi less extender more consistency
deck_description: 40 card swordsoul tenyi no DPE no deskbot to increase consistency. (if you want the deskbot line, i suggest to remove 1 monk and 1 shaman of tenyi to add halqi and auroradon)  the gameplay:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=je8Q7VkUwGc  Warning: might be very boring, no DPE, no halqi combo.  Basic Combo:  1 Card: Swordsoul Emergence search for taia, banish taia, search for swordsoul emergence (if you drew wyrm next turn, you can search mo ye, if you did not search for taia) or swordsoul blackout (for extra disturption).  2 Cards: Swordsoul Mo Ye +1 wyrm bread and butter of swordsoul combo, mo ye would synchro lv 8 chixiao to search for Longyuan and synchro 10 (either baroness or chengying, if you have card effect that banish or destroy your chengying except chixiao such as called by the grave or swordsoul blackout) chengying could be solid option.  2 Tenyi (Ashuna +1 different name Tenyi) Special summon ashuna, link summon monk tenyi, use the second tenyi to SS itself, use ashuna effect to SS the different name from field tenyi (i.e. SS vishuda if you have adhara) synchro to chixiao. Now, you have two route depending on your hand and matchup, against light based opponent, you don't want to banish adhara since you want to use baxia eff to destroy monk of the tenyi and SS adhara. route 1: banish Adhara to add Ashuna from banish, chixiao would search for Mo Ye or Longyuan, Mo Ye will reveal ashuna to synchro lv 8 (baxia or drago berserker of tenyi) or longyuan would discard ashuna to become chengying. route 2: Chixiao search for Taia (no wyrm or swordsoul) or Mo Ye (have another wyrm / swordsoul card), synchro lv 8 baxia then destroy monk of the tenyi to SS adhara from GY, synchro 9 chaofeng lock light  4 card: the combo is pretty similar with 2 card Mo Ye, but you start with Longyuan first to synchro baronne to avoid nibiru, then you will synchro Baronne, then lv 8 chixiao, alternatively you can do this with taia for three hand combo.
